description:
Last year, Delhi saw 18 incidences of acid attack. However, this number doesn’t paint the correct picture as these incidences are just the ones wherein the victims registered reports against perpetrators.

Laxmi Agarwal is one such victim of an acid attack which happened in 2015 in Delhi. At that time, Laxmi was a 15-year-old teenager. This unfortunate incident left her scarred – both physically and emotionally – for life. Not being the one to give up, she sought the support of many acid victims and filed a petition to curb acid sales in the Supreme Court of India.

For her commendable work in helping acid attack victims, Laxmi received the International Women of Courage Award from the then U.S. First Lady Michelle Obama. Today, Chhanv Foundation – an NGO run by Laxmi - is the hope and voice of acid attack victims all over the world.
name: Laxmi agarwal

description:
She was Born in a poor family of rural Manipur, Mary always dreamed of becoming a world champion in boxing. Last November, Mary Kom took everyone by surprise when she clinched a gold at the ASBC Asian Confederation women’s boxing championships. This was Mary Kom’s first international gold medal since the 2014 Asian Games and her first medal in over a year.

Post delivering twins in 2007, everyone thought that Mary’s boxing career would be over. However, she bounced back with a silver medal at the 2008 Asian Women's Boxing Championship. Today, Mary is a proud mother of three and pushes herself to do better than her last win.

So I found that
These ‘women of steel’ have inspired me to be brave and never let anyone or anything stop me from being the best version of myself. I salute their undying spirit!
name: Mary Kom

description: Dutee Chand is a Poor odia girl. Her dedication and hard working bring her success. She is the third Indian woman to ever qualify for the Women's 100 metres event at the Summer Olympic Games. However in the 2016 Summer Olympics, her 11.69s in the preliminary round did not qualify her for the next round. In 2018, Dutee Chand clinched silver in women's 100m at the Jakarta Asian Games. It was India's first medal in this event since 1998. In 2019, she became the first Indian sprinter to win gold at the Universiade, clocking 11.32 seconds in the 100m race.
name: Dutee Chand

description:
A less known name amongst the ones people derive inspiration from, Laxmi is a true fighter. Her attitude and take on life is truly inspiring. This lady is an acid attack survivor. But what she did post the attack is nothing even close to be termed as surviving. She gave her life a meaning with a reason to make every action count.

Girls are very sensitive about their outlook and beauty, this girl lost it all because of a social miscreant completelty unaware of the repercussions on ones life. People started sympathizing, making her feel worse. But she held herself strong, accepted the fact and decided to do something about it. What inspires the most is that normally a person gets down and out after losing the most essential society acceptance but this girl not just stood up for herself she just took over like a storm and made sure such incidents does not happen so casually. 

I learned from the local journal that her consistent effort made the court define a law controlling the availability of acid to common people. 

For me, this lady is a true inspiration and I would always celebrate HER. She taught us that given this life we should always strive to make our mark in the society. We need to stand out and speak up so that others can take precautions. Feeling depressed and surrendering to life is the easiest a person can do, fighting back and making a difference is what defines a true warrior.

May this girl keep gaining strength and support to achieve all the success and love in her life.

God bless!!!
name: Laxmi Agarwal

description:
V. Shanta is an Indian oncologist and the chairperson of Adyar Cancer Institute, Chennai. She is best known for her efforts towards making quality and affordable cancer treatment accessible to all patients in India. She has dedicated herself to the mission of organizing care for cancer patients, study of the disease, research on its prevention and cure, spreading awareness about the disease and developing specialists and scientists in various subspecialties of oncology. Her work has her won several awards, including the Magsaysay Award, Padma Shri, Padma Bhushan, and Padma Vibhushan, the second highest civilian award given by the Government of India.

She has been associated with Adyar Cancer Institute since 1955, and has held several positions, including that of the director of the institute between 1980 and 1997. She has served as a member of several national and international committees on health and medicine, including the World Health Organization's Advisory Committee on Health.
name: Dr.V.Shanta

description:
I read an incident about Mother Teresa which taught me the humility and patience.

Once when she had been to a merchant and requested to help her for her 'children', the underprevileged from slums of Culcutta, the merchant not only refused to help, he even spit on her face, when she repeatedly requested him.

Tears rolled down my eyes further, I read the incident that she did not get insulted or discouraged. She said, this is ok for me, dear, please give something for my underprivileged  'children'.

It not only made the merchant ashamed of himself, he also felt very sorry and agreed to help her 'children' everyday.

Her such a humility and patience motivated me to be humble and to have patience for success in life.
name: Mother Teresa

description:
Well, thats my mom.
What inspires me about her are so many things that days can passby but incidents wont get covered.

What inspires me the most is that she is a minimalist person. She knows exactly how to plan her expenses, where to invest and where to contain. 

Unlike other ladies in her group she is not the one who would crib for what other ladies have better or to be frank costlier than what she has. She knows what is justified. Because of her mental strength and stability, we observed our family grow personally as well as professionally. 

The most inpiring thing is her persistence to continue maintaining  what is justified.  This needs a lot of mental strength, for a housewife its very easy to get finicky about possessing the costly stuff in order to have a status maintained to be ranked high in the social circle. 

I have learned a lot from her, I anyway celebrate HER but next when I meet her will surely tell her that I wrote about her somewhere. She would be really happy. Thank you, God bless!
name: Rupali Sinha

description: She is impeccable with her words, her commitments and her value system. She has her flaws and she isn't afraid to admit them and work on them. She inspires me because she follows her heart and her passion. She is a life coach, loves DIY, she dances, paints, sings, runs an NGO, holds healing sessions, keeps her home spaces de-cluttered, is meticulous with how she uses her things. I look up to her because she is everything she wanted to be and not defined by one single identity. She has time and again surpassed the limitations of her own mind, body and spirit by trying to be the best version of her self. She invests time in her own self-practises to gain mastery over herself. I love her because she is a living, embodying example for everyone around. She leads not by words, but by actions. A true leader, with a compassionate heart, an intellectual mind and a beautiful soul.

description:
She is my mother. I know every mother inspire her son or daughter in their life. But about me its different. Because of my mother I am alive otherwise i would not be in this world. I became alcoholic in past life I was away from my family. My family got fully disturb my wife son daughter father and herself worried about me and I was in that stage that I dont care about them, even I lost my job there was no source of earning left for me, I lost my respect in friends and relatives due to alcohol.  But she stand behind me and fought against my alcoholic stage and bring me out of that.  Now this is almost 10 year I havent touch alcohol, I am living with my family like never before, now I have a good job with great position in company. 
For her she done her job, but for me she not only save my life but she also help me to gain my respect again in the society. Now people are giving my examples how I fought  against alcoholism. 
She is my real inspiration. She is my HERO

description: She was a topper in batchlers but had to skip final year exams as she had broken her spinal cord into 4 pieces. Went through a grueling surgery and rehabilitation for 1 year. Despite which she couldn't walk normal and had to take a support for entire life. She came back after 1 year and passed this year bachelers as well in flying colors and went on to complete masters as well. She quit her job in Microsoft to join a company called Deque systems which makes accessible friendly software. She moved back to India to bring awareness to public and private sectors about accessibility. She is now the managing director of Deque systems India still helping in building accessible friendly systems and software. Mom to 2 kids, she completed another diplomo in management with IIM Ahmedabad and still is challenged and walk with a stick in her hand or abnormally. She was and is an inspiration to all of our classmates and colleagues.
name: Sujasree Kurapati

She had to deal with a number of things like cooking food for us,washing our cloths etc.. without caring about herself....with no demands.....

Mother is our first friend,she is our first guru.....My Mom has taught me to strive for my aspirations...
My source of inspiration is none other than my beloved mother. My mother is someone who will do anything for her children. She is someone who very important in my life. She always helps and keeps me. No one can’t replace her place.

My mother has always been very patient with me. She always gives me advises and support whenever I need them. She always in my side during good and bad time. She always lend her shoulder for me to cry on during the bad time. She takes good care on me and my other siblings. She nursed me when I was sick, she always anxious me when I don’t on her side. She angry with me when I do something wrong. She is a good listener when I told my story. My mother is one of the most important motivators in my life. It is because she always encourage me to study hard and always give me a lot of boost.

My mother works very hard day and night. It is because she wants to ensure that her children get comfortable life and can study well. That makes her doesn’t think about herself again.

Here I would like to thank to God for giving her in my life. No amount of money I can repay for all the kindness and love that she had given for me. I shall always cherish the sweetest memories of her for as long as I live. This memories shall always remain fresh in my mind. My mother is truly a source of encouragement and inspiration. description:
My mother has always been my inspiration since childhood. Many people say that they want to become like their mother when they grow up but I know I can't because you cannot give up what she gives up for you. So after my father passed my mom took the additional responsibilities. Now she had to earn as well as manage the house. And guess what , she has completely nailed both the roles. She's a brave lady who has faced many problems in her life but has never given up or never let any problem to come on me. She was much interested in studying in her childhood but due to the financial condition of her parents she somehow completed class X. And to the contrary she has done everything so that I can get a good education. From being a best friend , to a critic my mom had played every role in my life. 
 From stepping into her beautiful heels that would make me feel on top of the world (even though I would trip over several times), to wrapping myself in her gorgeous saris that would make me feel like a princess, my mother has been there with me through all my thick and thin. She's my real life superhero. Also not only my mom , every mother on this earth is an INSPIRATION!
name: Varsha Madhwani

description: I am very inspired by my grandmother, Mrs. Swaran Suri. She raised me and my younger brother with great love, care and affection while our parents were professionally employed. I cannot thank her enough for teaching us Punjabi by only talking to us in Punjabi that made us learn the language seamlessly. She has also taught me great recipes such as Kanji drink and Baingan Kachris that are rarely known by kids of my generation. She also recited interesting mythological stories to me and was my friend in reading the Hindi story magazine Nandan. Till date, my grandmother continues to support me and inspire me to see old age with great grace. I know not everyone is very lucky to get old, and old age brings with itself a lot of body problems. Therefore, the never ending enthusiasm to learn new things such as a smartphone by my grandmother at the age of 84 is something that makes me very motivated and positive towards life. I thank God for blessing me with such a sweet, caring and modern grandmother. May God bless her always.
name: Mrs. Swaran Suri

description: Nisha did her schooling from a small town in Tamil Nadu. Despite all odds and with no one to guide or help her, she completed her Engineering by getting selected through state merit. She then went on to getting selected as a Gazetted Class 1 Commissioned Officer in the Indian Air Force in one of the initial batches of women officers, paving the way for future generations of women. She was commended for her professionalism and also selected as one among the initial Lady Commanding Officers in a front line operational Air Force base leading her men from the front. After 15 years with IAF and being involved in strategic projects, she moved seamlessly into the Corporate world and has been recognized time and again for her dedication, hard work & professionalism. Nisha has simultaneously mothered 2 lovely daughters and has been a role model as a mother and a wife. As much as she is a professional at work, she is a loving and caring homemaker too. She is an exceptional cook and can anticipate and keep track of everything at home too. She is an amazing baker and has all the elements to take up baking as a profession too. She spends her free time also doing decoupage art work which she uses for gifting her friends. She is well read and never hesitates to lend a helping hand to her friends in times of need. Its amazing to see her multitask everything in her life. She makes it a point to keep in constant touch with her mother and help her out emotionally and financially especially after her father passed away. What's really interesting is how she takes care of her father-in-law too, for his medical treatment.  She has volunteered with NGOs to teach under privileged children and also for flood relief victims and rescuing animals in distress. She speaks up and takes responsibility where she sees something going wrong. A professional, a mother, a wife, a daughter-in-law, a sensitive and sensible woman.... a superwoman! This is why I admire Nisha!
name: Wing Commander OK Nisha (Retd)

description: The reason. Why i am participating in this contest is not that i have done somthing which noone has ever done, its becaise to hear my story many girls or women can get inspiration and this story is very common. I am a single mother,  got divorced in a very young age of 25, as i got married also when i was 19. Obviously not educated enough by tgat time, hardly graduation second completed and that too i remember post marriage only i have given final exams. Marriage was failed from day one due to the domestic violence and non respect, i have been in that failed marriage for 7 lobg years just to give every bit fron my end so that things might get changed,  but nothing such happened,  now the day comes i have my baby, a sweet little innocent baby,  who does not even know the meaning of all thises big words i mentioned. But the situation of my marriage was getting worst day by day. One fine day i looked at my son and thought that i am responsible for his future as if somwthing went wrong in his life it will be my responsibility. And that very moment was enough to give me the courage of packing my bags and movibg out from the door withoit thinking about society and people.  It was tough in starting as managing son and doing job was not easy,  someday the thought also came that i will not be able to manage, i should call my aprents for help but then i have stopped myself.  I pursued my MBA during this time and taken more challenges in professional life.  Now as tome passed and its been 7 years i have been divorced,  my son is 8 yrs old and he respect me and every women and me who is now a COO of a company.  Every girl out there should never stop believing in them as its only you who can change your life.  Have a good day.
name: Neha Singh

description:
I being pediatrician was posted for duty and got call of raped case of disabled women .She delivered baby girl weighing 2 .9 kg so cute healthy.
I saw mothers father restless, as her daughter was unmarried physically disabled being raped and he couldn't even keep that newborn baby. 
I asked him to handover the baby to me
My mother was also ready but later she said what if my wife doesn't accept that girl..As I wasn't married that time .I thought a lot and finally we handed over that girl to police as per routine procedure . 
It was in 2007.
That time I decided to adopt baby girl and give family to someone in need.
I have one child..Healthy 
Then we got call from orphanage in 2016,October that they received one baby girl
We went there , she was 3 month cute girl wearing new clothes but malnourished,smell of urine and hair full of dandruff. 
She grabbed my wife's dupatta and then we decided to take her into our family 
Now Vanshika, my daughter is most adorable lovable person in our family.
I am proud of her
She is teaching me how to be strong in life.
She falls,bleeds often,she has asthma,she has reflux but still strong.
name: No name

description:
While  quitting her studies would seem like a major backward step, such didn’t prove to be the case. After her mom’s death in a major accident while in car with her father She took admission in distance learning, and completed her degree while taking care of the house and her father. After intense struggle, and working hard day and night, she got selected as the District President at the women cell of an NGO by the name of Guard of Justice and Human Rights and Divisional Director for World Aid Organisation For Human Rights. As they say, if the individual possesses a certain spark, a strong will, no circumstances can come in the way. This proved to be a major step in the making of a woman who would go on to do incredible things for the society. Within an year, she solved 40 cases of domestic violence which now has reached to 300 and served the people in need, breaking several stereotypes in the way. All this hard work got awarded, and she got promoted to the post of National General Secretary of Guard of Justice and Human Rights. She is no less than an icon for the people of Jammu and Kashmir, who give her much love and consider her as their role model.
While speaking to the ‘Millionaire Sayings’, she said : “ I want to set an example for those who are taken aback by looking at the miseries of life. I am right now the youngest entrepreneur of J&K running my own institute for Spoken English. What I want to tell people is that everything has a purpose. We just need to step onto the right path, rebuild our vision, Smile and move on.” True girl, you really have set an example for the world to look at! Considering the pain of women she is running several free institutes of self defence for women where they are trained for Martial Arts.
Unpredictability is the other name of life. In year 2017 she received Global Icon award followed by Global peace awards in 2018 in Hyderabad on the occasion on International peace day where she was invited as special youngest guest.
name: Manjot kohli

description:
It’s the story of an iron lady who made people realize that sometimes problems are not big, we are small because we can’t handle them. She believes that real happiness does not lie in success, money, name, and fame but lies within gratitude. Some bad incidence can break you physically and deform your body but transform your soul and turn you in the best version of yours. 
She was born in a conservative family. Muniba married at the age of 18 years due to family force as she was not ready to marry nevertheless Muniba Mazari Wedding successfully arranged by her family in 2005. Muniba Mazari husband was an air force pilot in Pakistan army and now he is a commercial pilot in private airlines. Muniba Mazari’s Husband name is Khurram Shahzad who had divorced her in 2015 due to her physical condition.

After a tragic car accident, her doctor told that she would be not able to sit, walk and give birth to a child. However, she can sit now in a wheelchair.

She is a bachelor’s in fine art and she is running “Muniba’s Canvas”. She claimed that she is a mix media artist, but indeed you will see in her all artistic image that is abstract of a woman’s life. Apart from art, she is also the mother of a child. She has adopted a baby boy, his name is Nael.

Today, she is participating in many social activities. She is helping a poor child and suffering from Thalassemia with the support of UNICEF. She was awarded by many world’s leading organization like WCCI Lahore Division, UN, CGC, The Karc Brothers Award 2017, Forbes 30, BBC’s Top 100 Women, NPC for her work and achievement.
name: Muniba Mazari

description: She is my mother in law.She is the lady who has always support me in my bad days n good days,As I don't have children she was my great support n use to tell it's ok just think that I m your child as m getting old day by day n she use to fight with my relatives who use to tease for not having children, She was the more thn my mother. As was in depression she encouraged me to go out n do job (as I didnt needed) so that my mind would divert n told that don't worry about the household work. She was my strength. As I didnt had children she became my child as she was suffering from Dementia disease.....in this the patient become day by day small in age.She was very young by heart and was more n dear friend to me as we use to share all the small things to each other.I Miss Her A Lot as she has taught me to be strong.

description:
Principal Pria school and an educationist for 30 years now. Her journey begins from a small town of Balrampur in UP where she did her education in hindi medium till MA BEd. Her marriage made her travel and settle again in a small town of Navi Mumbai called Rasayani.  In these 31years of her stay in Rasayani  she has hot the label of Mother India for being a teacher class apart and for more then 15 years running the institution as a Principal. She has won more the 4 consecutive best principal awards. Got her school many best school and other awards. For the board, she had played several roles from examiner, moderator and now the member of editorial board of Maharashtra state board for hindi. In a marathi dominant society, as a north Indian still maintaining her language and stand fiercely she turned her enemies and haters into followers. Her charity work is know to the whole town where she has adopted 17 students residential Mentally disabled school students to take care of all their needs. 30% of their poor kids study free of cost. As she has implied education for all. Even after all these, the book of accounts has always shown progressive profits. 
Her journey as an educationist is not only inspiring for me but also to thousands of students like us. 
Apart from being a wonder working woman, she has raised 2 well groomed and successful daughters.
name: Madhu Shailendra

description: Prachi is my elder sister. She was diagnosed with cancer early last year. While she was devastated when doctors told her, she decided not to be bogged down by the disease. She went through multiple chemotherapy sessions & fought the cancer cells back. Since childhood, she was stubborn and peristent. I saw the same version of her, as she stayed determined to not only survive but come out as a warrior. Prachi is married and has three-year old daughter. Today she is out of danger and undergoing medication. She supported and counselled many other cancer patients during and post her treatment. Today, she continues to be a part of cancer help groups. Her passion for life and attitude for staying strong for her daughter and the family inspires me. We worry too much about little stuff when there are warriors like Prachi fighting the real battle. I hope that I prove to be a good brother to such an amazing human being.
name: Prachi Kulkarni

description:
My incredible mom beat cancer at the tender age of two; and despite being told by countless doctors she could surely never be pregnant, here I am, 23 and healthy!

Pregnancy for her body wasn't easy, but my amazing mother never complained. She has always taken life with so much joy and faith. Despite unfathomable health issues, my mother is so much more today: She is healthy, strong, independent, beautiful, loyal, hilarious, an awesome cook, a dog lover, a wonderful wife and the person I most strive to emulate.

She is the embodiment of resilience, and as I start to build my own life, I am incredibly confident knowing she is, and always will be, part of me.

description:
*Mom*
Truly an inspiration for me. We lost her while battling with cancer for 5 long years.
I lost my father 15 years back and since then, we, me and my elder sister, had seen her as our pillar of strength. And now for more than 5 years she had been fighting hard to win over such a deadly disease. She always had the zeal to live for many more years. She always used to motivate us to keep going ahead, winning over our difficulties.
She was the one who motivated me to go back to work after a gap of 8 years, after my first child was born.
She was the one, whom I could come back to home and pour out all my days talks, used to share with her my ideas, how to implement them. Always ready to guide us motivate us and was always there to love and protect us, who else other than a Mom, would you want in your life back again.
She has been a true Woman of Substance.
My Mom my World, my Inspiration, to Never give up.
Love you Mom and miss you lots
name: Suman Kapoor

description: Born on the eve of the 19th century in a home of a sowkar in Alibag inMaharashtra Radhabai was eldest in a family of six. Her father passed away when she was 12 years old and it befell upon her frail shoulders the responsibility of looking after her family and her agricultural estate from a very early age . The British collector who was her fathers friend helped groom her in the art of reading farming riding and administrating her estate which comprised of 400 acres of farm land. At the age of 24 soon after WW I she was sent by the crown to England representing the women ofrural India who played a role in supplying wheat and rice to the soldiers on the front. Radhabai returned with the images of English villages ingrained in her mind and implemented the sewage system in her village. She was helped in her venture by a strapping young lad whom she went on marry in 1921. The village was transformed overnight and was the cynosure of all the other villages. She had brick roads built and had oil lamp posts similar to the gas lights she had seen in Manchester put up on the road leading to her village. The Commissioner of Kolaba impressed by her entrepreneurship gave her the go ahead for building the Pen Mandwa jetty which made the fishing industry flourish in Raigad district.This design which she had drawn from her memory after visit to Scotland  was adopted in many parts of Maharashtra. Radhabai had 11 children 6 sins and 5 daughter. They  all went on to become famous in their own field of specialisation andwerecsent by her yo pursue higher education in England and America. Radhabai was known for her generosity and helped educate the girls in her village by holding classes in her home teaching Marathi English , History , tailoring and farming. Hers was th only village where superstitions were dispelled and people were taught the science of practical reasoning.  She died at at the ripe old age of 85 a woman of substance. She was my grandmother.
name: Radhabai

description: founded in 1996 and Murty is one of the trustees. Through Foundation she has built 2,300 houses in the flood affected areas. Murty’s social work covers the healthcare, education, empowerment of women, public hygiene, art and culture, and poverty alleviation at the grassroots level. Her vision of a library for each school has resulted in the setting up of 70,000 libraries so far. She is helping out rural areas by building 10,000 public toilets and several hundred toilets in the city of Bengaluru. Infosys Foundation is a public charitable trust founded in 1996 and Murty is one of the trustees. Through Foundation she has built 2,300 houses in the flood affected areas. She has handled national natural disasters like tsunami in Tamil Nadu and Andaman, earthquake in Kutch – Gujarat, hurricane and floods in Orissa, Andhra Pradesh and drought in Karnataka and Maharashtra. The Government of Karnataka awarded her the prestigious literary award, the ‘Attimabbe Award’ –for her literary work for the year 2011–12.

description:
She is full of inspiration. A strong lady who motivated every women of our country. She's known for her karashmatic aura , bold speeches and kind behaviour. Like many I also followed her on social media , where thousands asked her for help. By her activeness , it seems that she never slept. Whenever anyone cried for support she immediately took required actions. It's not surprising that millions eyes got wet after her demise. Her achievements are uncountable but what I admire her alot is how she managed work with family. I am from New Delhi , the UT where she became first women chief minister. So, my attachment towards her from my childhood. Being always on crucial position she balanced her work life balance . As a working woman I can say it would be taughest phase.
Another mesmerizing part of character is her speeches. Irrespect of the platform or agenda , her words were equally effective. Everytime she stood to speak, usage of her words, representation of critical issues , expression of her thoughts made everyone speechless. 
This amazing lady was loved by everyone. Some believed her principles and practices and some don't but everyone had believe on her. 
Who doesn't want to idealise such person. I am glad that I born at the time when such a great narrator & inspiration lived too. 
Sushma swaraj inspired me and will inspire me in future as well.

description:
Life is something that I have always believed to be a river that constantly flows, never stops or slows. It has those straight, normal, and peaceful times, but it has rough times with twists and turns. I think everyone knows this, but some people have worse experiences than others. Those experiences cannot be avoided and have to be faced. Everyone always faces those experiences differently as they come. The ones that face the experiences with the bright hearts and their heads held high are those that inspire me every single day to keep going.

My mother has held her head high every day while facing her daily experiences and still continues to hold her head up high and inspire me every day
She got married to my dad on Aug 15th, 1989. She  have me,(her first child) june 7th, 1991, about five years later. I observed My mom , she take my family responsibility and she start forming and clothes sales , what she earnings that all money she spent my studies , only she had one time food in my childhood days , finally me and my brother completed Btech and got a good job , now I am working as RF engineer and my younger brother working as Assistant Engineer.

With raising two kids and having a part-time job as a marketing analyst, she had a lot on her plate, yet she always made it all work. Running between three different schedules of two different kids and her work with all different sets of friends and interests must not be an easy task. Especially at one point when two of those kids were in diapers at the same time! I saw how difficult that was, I saw my mom work really hard to make everything work within our house. Yes, it wasn’t perfect, but she always kept her head up and kept going.
That is truly something that has always inspired me, and one thing that has always made me want to always keep moving forward in my life. My mom keeping her head up showed me that I could keep my head up too, every single day.
She was always there with encouragement whe
name: Vijaya Lakshmi ( my mom)

description:
I love my parents a lot but when it comes to talking straight from my heart, I’d say it’s my sister who is responsible for the little success I have achieved today.
When we were little, we never fought like most siblings do. She has always supported me, be it in my academics or my pranks. She would attend PTA meets at school and yell at the teacher who would complain about me. She always defended me in front of my parents.

I remember, when I was scheduled to appear for my SSC and the exams were just a week away, I had a district -level cricket match to attend. My mother said ‘no’ but my sister stood by me and I went to play that match.
That was one match where I scored a double hatrick for which I also drew a lot of praise. To add to my excitement, I saw my sister cheering for me in crowd.

After my graduation, she convinced my parents to let me  admission to coaching centre.All the credit of me being a aspirants today goes to my sweet sister Sashmita. Once during Raksha Bandhan, I’d asked her, “Why do I always give you gifts on Raksha Bandhan?” Since that day, she has been gifting me each year on Rakhi.
She has been my sister, my friend, mentor, my inspiration and my conscience. Even today, if I have to share anything, she would be the first person I would call.. I Love My Sister Alot
name: Sashmita Behera

description:
I wanted to share a deeply personal story to show the sacrifice of my wife Kiran every day. Prior to the birth of our daughter, my wife and I had tried several times to have a child. Fortunately, it worked out two different times that my wife was able to conceive and begin carrying. Unfortunately, both times, those future human lives ended in tragedy with miscarriage.
These were two of the most devastating moments of my life, and yet I could only imagine how sad and defeated my wife felt. She wondered if something was wrong with her. She initially doubted if it was ever to be — would we have children? Or would we run into the same, terrible fate again? We had a choice in that moment — believe and try again, or give up.
Of course, she never gives up. So there was really, only one option.
It took tremendous courage to try again for another child. Most people don’t realize how difficult and transformative the effect of conceiving and carrying a child is on a woman’s body. Even after only 10 weeks, a woman’s body has changed dramatically. Hormones are running wild. This is a truly magnificent and dynamic undertaking.
It’s something that most people don’t speak about. The grieving, suffering and need to build yourself back up emotionally, mentally, spiritually, and physically. For something so amazing to be taken from you, and to have to reconstruct your dreams, ambitions and hopes, is as challenging a hurdle to overcome as any in life.
Far too often, women privately have to tackle this experience. Privately, women dig deep into their faith and inner-strength to persevere and come out better, stronger and more beautiful than ever before.
Her next pregnancy led to the birth of my daughter. I learned in those nine months more about courage, devotion, commitment and strength than I had in all my previous years. We had our baby girl. And we had a treasure trove of life lessons in how incredible a woman’s sacrifice is.
Kiran's example for me changed the way I saw all women.
name: Kiran Bala

description:
God couldn't be every where therefore he created mother's.

My mother is a great woman. I don't mean that in a generic way either. I mean it in the sense that she has accomplished many things in her life.
 She has taught me to always try my best, to treat everyone equally, to not give up when things get hard. She tells me to at all times be honest because in the end, lies always hurt more. She instills the importance of family and of doing well at school in me. When I make decisions and she doesn't always agree with them, she makes sure that I know that she is behind me all the way because she wants me to always be happy. She has taught me right from wrong and the significance of self-respect. 
             She is my mother, the greatest influence in my life. Not only as a mom but also as a friend. 
Another reason why my mother is my favorite person is because she is very blunt. She says what she means and means what she says. 
Life was hard for her, but she never gave up because she knew that she had three young children, who she would die for, waiting at home. She was strong and powerful in every aspect of life: mind, body, and soul. When times got hard, she just thought about us and nothing else, as long as it's what we wanted and if we would benefit from it. She has helped us get through the tears, pain, and hurt of our lives. But how did she feel? No one ever knew, because she never took time for herself, it was all about her children.
name: K Girija Varma

description:
Hi I'm vinod, working in insurance sector .  My story is lil long so please be patience now here we go.

I met with her in 2014 at her place and she was looking so beautiful look like fresh ROSE.  Somehow I started talking to her and she was so smart that I got to know when I spoke to her.
Lateron, I proposed her and she accepted this i.e., after one year I proposed her.   Four year' we were in relationship but unfortunately her marriage was fix and I went to her place met with her parents I did everything which was possible and at the end she was nt agreed to come
It was not written in my destiny.

She got married and busy in her life.

But I had nt moved on and I became irresponsible person, the whole family was shouting step by step everyone was coming and they started given there own thought which was not acceptable and I ran away from my home....

I was alone on station for three days without eating and not doing anything...  On fourth day I went to temple and ask for food and I got it. I thought I will be here and won't go that place my home again basically I wanted to go out side just wanted refresher but I dint feel it..

After a week I met with one girl and she recognised me said Vinod what u doing here and dint recognise her even I forgot my name also.  Then she called her husband, they took me in her car and went to the hospital doc said it's just normal weekness will be allright.  I was unconscious when I was admitted so dint know who bring me in hospital.

She called my family they came to the hospital and she got to know all my story.....

She told to everyone not to say single word to him about why he ran where he was and forget that girl nothing only go meet and say bye..  she said I will take care of him once he will be alright, he will come to home.. 

It was magic in her voice that everyone understood in first time only.  The same way my family treated with me the way she told and I got to know that she was my college frnd I was happy to see her..

description:
Chungneijang Mary Kom Hmangte (born 1 March 1983
is an Indian Olympic boxer from Manipur.
 She is the only woman to become World Amateur Boxing champion for a record six times, and the only woman boxer to have won a medal in each one of the seven world championships.
Nicknamed Magnificent Mary, she is the only Indian woman boxer to have qualified for the 2012 Summer Olympics, competing in the flyweight (51 kg) category and winning the bronze medal.
 She had also been ranked as No. 1 AIBA World Women's Ranking Light Flyweight category.
 She became the first Indian woman boxer to get a Gold Medal in the Asian Games in 2014 at Incheon, South Korea and is the first Indian woman boxer to win gold at the 2018 Commonwealth Games.
On 26 April 2016, Kom was nominated by the President of India as a member of the Rajya Sabha, the upper house of the Indian Parliament.
In March 2017, the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Government of India, appointed Mary Kom along with Akhil Kumar as national observers for boxing.
Mary Kom won the Gold Medal in Asian Boxing Championship. She defeated Kim hyang Mi (North Korean boxer) of North Korea in the title match.

After her sixth world title, the Government of Manipur has conferred on her the title “Meethoi Leima” (loosely translated as great or exceptional lady) in a felicitation ceremony held at Khuman Lampak Sports Complex in Imphal on 11 December 2018. At the function, CM N. Biren Singh also declared that the stretch of road leading to the Games Village in Imphal West district, where Kom currently resides, would be named as 'MC Mary Kom Road'.
Kom was born in Kangathei village, Moirang Lamkhai in Churachandpur district of rural Manipur in India.[16] She came from a poor family. Her parents, Mangte Tonpa Kom and Mangte Akham Kom were tenant farmers who worked in jhum fields.[17] They named her Chungneijang. Kom grew up in humble surroundings, helping her parents with farm related chores, going to school and learning athletics initi
name: Chungneijang Mary Kom Hmangte

description: Rasheeda, 38, lives in Srinagar, India. 'Brought' to Kashmir by an agent from her village in West Bengal, Rasheeda was married to the fisherman Haji Ghulam Mohd. (the man in the image) who was a widower and more than twice her age. Bride-purchase remains a common practice in Kashmir, not so much because of dearth of women in the Valley, but because older men, widowers or men suffering from physical disabilities (i.e. so-called ineligible men) are not able to  find brides for themselves from the region. Rasheeda inspires me because of her fortitude, her wonderful ability to adapt and her indomitible spirit. Now a mother of two sons, a teenager & a pre-teen, she is the mistress of her house. Her husband's emotional dependence on her testifies to her kind and loving nature. What is more, he reposes complete trust in her. She has also won the respect and love of neighbours, perhaps more than a Kashmiri woman in her place would have. Rasheeda's story teaches us that the human spirit isn't easily vanquished; no matter how far we are from our loved ones, no matter how intimidating our present circumstances (as Radheeda's must have been when she arrived here as a young bride), we must not perish. Like this brave woman, whose face clearly bears the signs of wistful longing for her homeland and mild happiness at the discovery a new life, we must continue to spread cheer and love, no matter where we are.
name: Rasheeda

description: Prabhjot Kaur (alias Sheetal) was born to uneducated parents in a remote village of Haryana in 1986. Her parent's house was located on a kachha mud road 2 KM from the village (the road is still a kachha mud road and parents are staying in the same house, although house is in a better shape now). She suffered a polio attack in her left leg at a tender age of few months for want of timely proper medical care. As a disabled child,  initially she studied in the village school till 5th . Her father used to take her to village school and back to home on a bicycle. She was very interested in studies and to achieve her dreams , she struggled hard in life . With her grit and determination, she completed BSc, MSc(Chemistry), B Ed at a great personal discomfort staying away from her parents from 6th class onwards, initially with relatives in Indore and later on in hostels in Yamuna Nagar and Patiala. Inspite of her physical medical disability;  now at 32 years of age, she is a successful career woman as a Science PGT teacher in a Punjab Government School. She is happily married to a man with a golden heart and a proud mother of two beautiful daughters . Her life story is an inspiration for all girls , specially for girls with disability from under privileged section of society .

description:
Jo insaan dusroon ke dukh mein dukhi ho aur dusroon ke sukh mein sukhi ho ishwar ki is pratima ko manak bai kehte h.
Ye kahani h ek aisi aurat ki zisne dusroon ki raahon mein hamesha Phoolon ki baarish kari kintu khud Nirantar bina thake kaaton par chalti rahi.
Manak bai ka janam 1955 mein indore ke ek jile mhow mein hua tha. Unka bachpan garibi mein bita. Unhone choti si umar mein hi
Sangarsh ki kulhadi apne haathon mein pakad li thi. 7 saal ki umar tak aate aate vo ek din kam karte waqt aag ki laapton mein ghir gayi Jiske karan unke sharir ka aadha nichla hissa pura jal gaya tha. Jiske karan
vo ek sal tak karwat bhi nahin badal pati thi kyunki aisa karne se unki kamar se khon ki Dhara behne lagti thi. 12 sal ki umar mein unki shaadi karwadi gayi.shaadi ke kuch hi saal bad pati ki mrityu ho gayi aur unke 5 chote chote Bacchon ki zimmedari unhi par aa gayi . Is bure waqt mein unke maa baap ne bhi unka saath chod diya. In Dino vo hamesha sochti ki insan ko marne ke liye thoda kintu zinda rahne ke liye hardin zahar
pina padta h. Unhone phir kuch kaam karne ki
thani. Aur ek kirane ki dukan dali is sangarsh mein unke Bacchon ne bhi unka bahut saath diya. Isse vo itna kama pati ki apne Bacchon ka pet bhar deti. Gujara thik se naa ho paane ke karan  unhone kuch samay bad udhaar lekar duudh chalane ki ek machine kharidi . Ye paise unhone 15 din ke bad vaapas de diye. Phir aage chalkar unhone kisaano se Duudh lena chaalon kiya aur ise
Indore ke vyaparion ko becha. Shiksha ke abbhav ke karan unhe jodna ghatana tak nahin aata tha par unhone vo bhi sikha aur lakho ka karobaar kiya. Issi se unhone apne 5 baachon ki shaadi kari , ghar banwaya, apne bachoon ko kaam khulwaye aur apne parivar ka Ghar kharch vohi chalati rahi.unhone bachoon ke bachoon ko bhi apne pero par khada kiya unhe sanskar diye Unhe bhi naye kaam khulway aur Unki bhi shaadi kari .
Aaj vo 85 saal ki ho gayi h kintu phir bhi vo surah 5 baje uthkar karobar kar rahi h .

description:
Every woman is capable of inspiring any man. The degree of inspiration goes northward with their continuation of hard work, dedication, love and sensivity. 
In my life, I do agree that I have a great impact on me from my mother. Now, my wife also earn my awes whenever I think of her eternal perseverance for keeping our family bond intact irrespective of the fact that she came from entirely different cultural and social background. 
But, here I would describe a special, very special event of my life. Due to some failures in competitive exams, I would be negatively charged everytime; negativity was just oozing out of me everytime. I used to complaint about everything everytime. I was so doomed that even when I see the plus sign, i would think its nothing but a combination of two negatives' sign. I earned a sobriquet,  'Nigattu'. 
One day, while returning from my own city Saharanpur to Roorkee; it was pouring heavily, as usual I was cursing the dancing drops of rain too. Near Bhagwanpur turn, I watched a small girl with her mother was literally dancing bare foot on the muddy side of the road, hopping on the pot holes, holding her maa's torn pallu and singing loudly , making different types of funny faces, drenched completely. She was the epitome of full bloom lotus, the diva of unending joy, the deity of bliss. And there I was, who was a brand shop from top to toe, materially very very rich as compared to that lovely doll buy still was a mere  pauper considering her happiness and blissfulness. The message was clear to me and I do believe that God Himself arranged that 10 minute long live clip just for me. Soon, like the rain washed all my negativity, I parked my car and jumped out of my car, drenched myself. I was crying, yelling , weeping all wiered emotions in unison. I reached that girl and did best for her, what I could. Touched her and her mom's feet and drove to my home. Couldnt take my little Guru's pic!! The nigattu was no nigattu any more.
name: Rajma

description: Her courage, determination and love is what I inspires me. She is my mother and when I was kid, I never realised how much she had done for me and continues to do so. But all mothers do that for their kids, right? Well yes, but my mother had to play multiple roles in my house being the only female adult in my house. We always had decent ancestral property but still were financially weak because my father wa struggling with his career choices back then. That's when my mother took to teaching and I am proud son when I say she will be retiring after 2 years as a principal. Since my dad was struggling with his income and my mother took up the job only because she wanted to give us good education. Had she remained a housewife, we would have still survived but could not thought of the education we got. I am an MBA from one of the best B-schools in India, Jamnalal Bajaj Institute of Management Studies and my sister is a graduate from one of the best design colleges in India, National Institute of Fashion Technology. All of this was made possible because my mother decided to do something in those uncertain times. Not just that, she donned the roles of a dishwasher, a laundry person, a cook and what not in a household which believed all the chores of a regular household are a female's responsibility. My grandfather lost his wife quite early in his life when my dad was a small child, and my mother had to take care of everything. She also had to play motherly figures to my dad's cousins as the age gap was quite big, and it was when my mother herself was in her early twenties and my dad's cousins ages ranged from 6 to 15 years (they were 7 in total). In my growing up years, I have always taken for granted what she has done for all of us. It gives me a lump in my throat now that I think about it. If there is one person whose thought inspires me in the lowest of phases, it is my mother. The way she has uplifted everyone's life she has touched, is just amazing. She is my superhero!
name: Veena Kumari

description: In a materialistic world of today where money is the main motto and people work for the same day and night .Majority of them earn money through unethical means as well .Thanks to the Almighty Lord who has gifted the nation a beautiful, pure and selfless soul like Mother Teresa whose preachings and followers still exist following her footsteps of helping the needy.Well having said that,she has influenced me right from my childhood school days in almost all ways .Her motto of serving humamity had transformed me drastically in my school .I used to tell my mother to cook some extra food for the economically backward and low income students in my school and we used to eat together on one table  and relish our food .Not only that, since i was a scholar in academics i used to help the students who were backward in understanding levels by waiting back for an hour and teaching them.On our school day offs they used to come to my house and i used to teach them .This gave me a great sense of achievement and happiness .I followed this practise in college as well .I also took up initiatives wherein i not only personally contributed financially,but also arranged for funds from my neighbors .Now am a successful and contented person in life , however  i strongly feel that Mother Teresa still infuences me till date .Her gesture towards humanity is endless .Having said the fire in me to help humanity is still alive as i am involved with a few NGO's which are involved to improve mankind life and raise the standard of living for the backward class.I personally visit the blind schools and donate on festivals and special occassions .Hope and pray to Almighty  God to influence  each one of us so that we all have a  genuine and selfless soul like her and povery is completely eridicated from its roots .Hey Lord everyone has a right to enjoy life to its fullest .Kindly grant my wish .I bow down to you as well as your pure Creation Saint Mother Teresa with all due respects .JAI HIND.
name: Saint Mother Teresa

description: Indra Nooyi is one of the world famous woman. Today Nooyi is the first female chairman and Chief Executive Officer of PepsiCo. which is the second largest food and beverage companies in the world. Her appointment to this position saw her become one of the most influential Indian-American businesswomen in America. Born on 28th October 1955 in Chennai. She was from tamil speaking family in chennai Tamil nadu. she completed her bachelors degree in chennai and diploma in management at calcutta. she worked after getting degree in India as product manager in johnson and johnson , textile firm, then she was going to America to study her master degree at Yale university. Then she worked in many companies Boston group, motorola, Asea broen bovery. She gave her 100% in every company. She joined PepsiCo in 1994 as senior vice president position. By her talent every 2 years she is getting promoted in PepsiCo. Today she is the chairman and CEO of PepsiCo. About her family she married Raj k Nooyi and they have two daughters . she likes music and enjoys playing guitar. Forbes journal valued she is third strengthen woman  among the 100 strengthen women list in 2008 . she was selected Padma Bhushan award in India. In 2014  her remuneration is about 19 $ millions. she is the member of many industries across the world. Her advice is always learning, don’t loose curiosity, Love if you do anything, help people to raise.My inspiration is Indra Nooyi . I am an assistant professor in India , I currently housewife,I am very much proud I am from Tamil nadu India.

description:
She is my cousin sister but regards me more than a real one. A sibling with 2 other brothers and one sister Premlata lost her father when she was barely 20 years old . She not only completed her studies in Home  Science but also facilitated her siblings to complete their education , facilitated  her mother in getting all of them married and decided to devote her life with her mother by remaining single and looking after her as she used to keep unwell . This apart for the last 40 years she has been dedicated volunteer at the Govt hospital spending quality time to look after the patients by arranging medicines, blood and meals for them and their relatives free of cost by soliciting support from relatives and friends,  failing which from her savings & pension to fulfill her philanthropic passion of serving humanity . Keeping nothing for herself she did charity along with her mother to donate clothes and medical equipment may not necessarily be of high value to hospital  and her college.She went a step further to rescue any known or unknown in distress which set an example in a small town Udaipur in Rajasthan where Premlata has been bestowed with  several prestigious awards and citations .
I personally feel that the sacrifice made by her from any early age in supporting her family , mother and public at large inspite of she now being over 70 years is not only a inspirational story but a reality which people only dream but never execute These are rare dedicated lot in unknown quarters not seeking publicity or reward but passion to work relentlessly to pay back to the society.
name: Premlata Mehta

She was not allowed to work. She faced many difficulties during her life and had three children. Despite all her hurdles, she made her two daughters independent. It was her encouragement that led me to study at London School of Economics. Today, I am a successful economist working at the Asian Development Bank. My achievements are all her achievements. description:
What is it about her that inspires you?
Answer - Everything about her inspires me.
She is Amishi Patel.
Inspiration need not be of big or great things. Sometimes, small things leads to transformation.
Amishi is a friend, philosopher and guide.
Few people can be your friends, very few can be philosophers and handful of them can guide you on the right path. She is the best person you can have as a friend and guide and she has her own philosophy. Though she is my senior at workplace, she has always comforted me. She has inspired me to do what I want and not what is right in the eyes of society. She carries a smile wherever she goes. She has inspired me to a new way of life where it is okay to make mistakes, where it is fine to cry, where it is still not too late to start afresh. She is someone who strongly believes in herself and expects the same from others. Her ideology is simple..if you are confident in what you are doing..nothing can stop you.

A beautiful heart will always inspire you and she posseses one.

description:
Women are like the light in our lives.Though the watts may differ with each one, they illuminate our lives in their utmost power. And like the guiding light the women in my life have always empowered me. While my mother has made what I am today, my sister made me realize how wonderfully a women fosters all relationship keeping two families in sync. Then when I got married, my soulmate unveiled a new chapter in my life and taught me to let it go. But this has all been an ongoing process and when I think of a single fable of a lady which inspired me, I remember one incident.

In my last company, my senior was a female and a very hardworking one. One day we had a professional event in our office and she was down with high fever from the previous day itself. I know how hard it is to work when your body straight away declines to work in harmony with you. So irritation, lethargy and lack of enthusiasm is quite obvious but ironically she was up with full force. Nobody outside our workstation came to know that she was not keeping well. Above that, she could have left early on the previous day and even on the day of the event but she did not do so. She somehow embossed her determination on me and this incident would be etched in my mind forever. 


Women have a superpower within them. They are like the sun that never fails to brighten our morning whatever the odds maybe, sometimes it may not even be visible but its light always festoon our lives with affirmation.
name: Gunjan Taneja

description:
Man’s favorite donkey falls into a deep precipice. He can’t pull it out no matter how hard he tries. He therefore decides to bury it alive.

Soil is poured onto the donkey from above. The donkey feels the load, shakes it off, and steps on it. More soil is poured.

It shakes it off and steps up. The more the load was poured, the higher it rose. By noon, the donkey was grazing in green pastures.
name: Sandhya jain, my mother

description:
My Maid, but for me it’s an acronym for  “Mehnat, Ambitious, Inspiration and Doctorate”. Hema wakes up early in the morning by 5:30 and ends her day by keeping her weapons “Utensils” down by night (10 pm) and then goes home cooks food for family and enjoys healthy life. In this tech era, she doesn’t have Mobile or Landline number may be that’s why she gets more time to manage things than anyone, and at the age of 46 she runs at the speed not less than “Hima Das” (Irony) , though she isn’t literate and doesn’t have Qualification/Management degree, I have still tagged her as Doctorate in her profession as she manages everything right from morning huddles till night chores. Every Self employed or businessmen  works atleast 40 hours a week, for her its more than 70 hours. I believe it’s not the success of person rather it’s the journey which inspires. I am inspired by her PULSE (Passion to work, being “U”, Lovesome , Strategic & Enthusiasm).

Want to meet this inspirational lady? call me, coz remember you can’t reach her through 10 digit number.

Place : Hema's Cabin

description: Calm as morning water nobody  can even judge what she has been through as she is always distributing happiness and aiding people in need in every possible way. Gynaecologist by profession got married and later divorced just because she could not bear kids but never revealed the reason was not her. Bravely heading forward in battlefield of life got married again to a father of two where nobody was adjusting but she used to go to her job,prepare meals, wash clothes and all with immense patience. Still life was hard but she was harder. She went to complete her M.D. at the age of 47 and life instead of getting easier got tougher as she started getting transfers to far off places. This woman of gold learnt to drive at the age of 50. One fine day when at tough terrain she handed over the car to the driver the driver after a few minutes list control and the car went rolling into a deep gorge around 1500 feet down. She came out of the car ,the car caught fire but she left no chance of taking the driver out till some villagers came and pulled her apart. Walked uphill on her feet with blood all around. There are certain other incidents too. Her life has always been taking her exams but seeing her tells how to say c'mon! bring it. I am not afraid. She motivates me how to be always be happy no matter even if you are sitting on the volcano of worries. I have learnt that how to spread positivity even after getting all negative in life. Moreover she has also taught to be loving and polite. She is a gem who has taught me how to shine in the darkest spheres of life. Yes, she is my true inspiration, my true motivator and above all my mentor.
name: Dr. Ajai sood

description: There are people who love you, there are people who inspire you and then there are people who give everything in their power to let you rise. My mother has done all three - even when I know for a fact that she didn’t have the means. Let me give you a glimpse of my childhood. I belong to an average family of 5 where worked in a clerical post at a bank and was the bread earner as the world says. My mother who’s more qualified(educationally,  has interpersonal skills better by a huge margin, and is triple as hardworking if I’m not understating) was banished from working by my father. Well, such is our society. So she started stitching clothes to give us certain luxuries our father wouldn’t be able to afford (since he was managing the house). She would work so hard for a suit that she charged Rs. 30 for. Put milk and besan on her face because she didn’t get any money for a face pack while all the other women from the same social stature did. We grew up and as her children started supporting her, she started to jump at every opportunity that she got - be it the multilevel marketing structure certain companies like oriflame, Tupperware followed where they needed local agents or be it being a post office account sales manager. She has never looked down at any work and had embraced every opportunity she had got(even with her age - she’s turning 65 soon) God knows I have never met a more hardworking woman in my 26 years of existence. And our pride only grows when we see her getting recognised for her work - she was given the best manager award at wonderchef’s national conference at Hyderabad this May. She’s an inspiration for all her friends and for her children. If only we could take 10% of her strength, motivation and way of looking at life.
name: Sudesh Chawla

description: From being a super mom of three at the tender age of 26 (first one at 20) to a woman who gives so much to the society with her initiatives , this lady ( my mother and my bestest friend) inspires me in every breath of my life. She not only taught us how to live life happily (me and my two siblings) but also how to keep the world around us happy. She taught us  all lessons of life, but never even made us realize her sacrifices. Though being left out alone at home, with three of us out of our small home town due to lack of opportunities, she never make us feel that she is alone but rather wants us to spread our wings and fly high. From teaching 6-8 students in need at our home for free to always being the most active member of any social activity in our town ( Guna) she not only inspires me but many. She donates food at the railway station to the ones in need, she goes to old age homes and Aangan Badist to donate needful things , She provides water tanks to sabji waalas in the scrouching summer and yet make a balance of loving her husband, kids and grand kid. She runs a boutique at home just to keep herself busy and in the process help her husband run the family nicely! She is a true inspiration not only to me but to several other women who are not that lucky by the gift of life.  She is a forever inspiration to me ❤️.
name: Upma Rathi

description: She is the first women IPS officer of India and She had done wonders in all her assignements. My best memorance as mentioned below: Chanakyapuri was an affluent area that included the Parliament building, foreign embassies, and the residences of the Prime Minister and the President. The crimes in the area were mainly limited to minor thefts, but political demonstrations (which sometimes turned violent) were a regular occurrence. During the 1970s, there were many clashes between Nirankari and Akali Sikhs. On 15 November 1978, a group of Nirankaris held a congregation near India Gate. A contingent of 700–800 Akalis organized a demonstration against them. DCP Bedi's platoon was deployed to stop the protesters and prevent violence. As the protesters resorted to brick-batting, Bedi charged them with a cane, although there was no tear gas squad to support her unit. One of the demonstrators ran towards her with a naked sword, but she charged him as well as other demonstrators with a cane. Ultimately, her unit was able to disperse the demonstrators. For this action, Bedi was awarded the President's Police Medal for Gallantry (1979), in October 1980.
name: Kiran Bedi

description:
CELEBRATE HER STORY

As life continues to throw challenges at me, I draw strength from the proverb “When the going gets tough, the tough gets going.”

For me, a badass officer who personifies this virtue of valiance and fearlessness is none other than the first woman I.P.S. officer Kiran Bedi. She truly mapped out the road for several women to follow her path of serving the country as a police officer.

 

Kiran Bedi introduced many reforms in the Indian prisons to show the right direction of life to hardened criminals. She introduced yoga and meditation to soothe the tensed nerves of the prisoners and make them peaceful. Although she suffered many setbacks in life, she never accepted defeat. Kiran Bedi was transferred from one place to another under pressure of those ones, who were unable to digest her popularity and success, but Kiran Bedi stood her ground and accepted this punishment in her stride although no fault of hers. She stoically faced numerous challenges of life and undertook herculean tasks with great determination and willpower

 

Amongst other accolades Kiran Bedi also won an Asia Region Award for prevention of drugs and after that was honoured with the Magsaysay award in the year 1994. Even after retirement, Bedi established the Navjyoti Delhi Police Foundation which helps house homeless people, drug addicts and provides education for slum kids in India. Apart from this, she is known to be a part of several movements including the Anti-Corruption movement in 2010.

 

Her journey from a pretty tennis player to the Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry has been truly commendable- a story legends are made of! In this month of India’s Independence, I salute Kiran Bedi, the prestige and pride of our nation! She will forever be my inspiration.
name: Kiran Bedi

description: My parents are nothing short of role models for both me and my sister, who have got undivided and unfailing love from them, no matter the circumstances. However, the onus of us growing into mature, somewhat worthy and confident humans goes to our mother. Being an Army wife, she has handled our various homes and us, almost alone.  Every place that my dad got posted to, she turned the house we were alloted into our home.  No matter where my dad was posted in,  how many occasions he missed with us or how many holidays we spent at our grandmothers place without him;  the one thing that was constantly provided us with, was extra care and love from our mom. While my dad was (and still is)  serving the nation,  she was (and still is)  taking care of everything. Even while dealing with us strictly, her care for us, showed up in those scoldings too. To narrow it down to one quality in her that I admire, wouldn't be fair enough to attribute to the meanings she has brought in our lives. She has made our life (me and my sister) complete, and that's what we admire the most in her - she being the person that she is. She has shown us in endless situations that standing up for yourself is important, no matter if the world is against you. Hence, I'll always treasure her and her values; for what she taught me is going to help me be the individual I aspire to be.
name: Chumki Nath a.k.a MUMMA

description:
This story starts with a flashback. I would have been four or five years old. In Kerala, back then, during temple festivals,playing movies on God was a pattern.As children we used to look forward to it. At night my grandmother would take all three grandchildren of her's to the temple ground and we would sit next to her in the crowded ground and watch movies with our eyes fixated on the screen. It was during one nights in a temple that I saw this small kid in the form of Lord Murugan(Karthikeyan) with big beautiful eyes, Godly face and did everything impossible for a child. I was a fan since our first meeting. Sridevi,  has been a part of my life since then.She means more than an actress to me.Both my parents loved her too. So whenever a movie of her's played in Doordarshan on Sunday evenings, my mom would take me to the nearby home (since we didnot have a TV then). I sat and watch Sridevi, sing, dance, make faces and shift forms in the blink of your eyes.
Sridevi became a source of happiness to me, without me even realising it. She kept the fun factor in my life alive. Women never felt like the oppressed gender when I watched her. She was always the mighty one. She could fight, do double and triple roles, do wits, hit the villain, be the boss, challenge the hero and even become a celestial being! I believed that all women could that. In Chalbaaz when she says, I am just a woman who is trying to make my mark in this male dominated world, blood gushed into my brains.!An industry where the face of actresses kept on changing and heroes remained forever, I saw her with father and son! Even in the presence of the biggest of stars she stood tall.
I was an addicted fan,  is and will always be. Even in her goodbye to this mortal world, she taught me how life is unpredictable and when here,be the reason for someone else's happiness and live life like a star!
name: Sridevi

description: Whenever we hear this three letter word 'Maa' it brings a peaceful smile on our face. Really this word has magic in itself and same way the person which holds this designation in our lives is more special. My mother , she is truly a blessing for me she has not only supported me but also she is been always a complete book for me whose each and every chapter of life teaches me how to live. She has always guided me to manage,learn and remain happy in every situation, not only professionally but also she has taught me that 'being a girl you have to play many roles and that's the beauty of your life ,so in every role you don't have to proof yourself but just do your duty and if you do it with ease and smile on your face it would be be perfectly done and people themselves will appreciate it'. She has scolded me more than loving me(that is what I sometimes feel :p) but her each and every scolding has taught me lots of things and because of that only today I could achieve everything I could dream about. she is my inspiration and my life.
name: My Mother

description: She is my sister. She got married in 1998 at the age of 18. She was just 12th pass out when she got married. After marriage she completed her B.S.T.C. and got a job of govt. teacher but always she wanted to study more and complete her graduation. She got two girls in next few years. Her family was not in support of girl children in the family but she fought alone and provided good education to both of them. One of them is studying in Delhi University now. One day she told me her wish to be a graduate. I pushed a little and she took admission in BA as private student. With her job, kids and all the family responsibilities, she completed her graduation in 2018 (20 years after her marriage) with FIRST DIVISION. She was so happy like she got a noble prize. This is the woman with passion for her duties. She is the only teacher in her school. Because of her efforts only children the her village don't go to private schools. They love her a lot and ready to come to school in vacation too. They are the only children I know who don't like holidays. She approached the govt. authorities and got the approval for the renovation in the school. She is the lady with the difference. I salute her for her dedication and commitments.
name: Reena Goyal

description:

This incident does not stop her in achieving her dreams. She is the worlds first amputee who have climbed the mount everest and other mountains. This is the greatest milestone as compared to other milestone. She is a perfect example for many people. She has a tremendous will power, determination and strong heart which helped her in creating this history.

description:
वो ख़ुद! 
वो ख़ुद ही ख़ुद को मानती हे, क्यूँ की वो जानती हे कि वो ख़ुद ही ख़ुद में ख़ास हे और ख़ुद के दिल के बेहद पास हे..
वो ख़ुद ही ख़ुद का एहसास हे 
और ख़ुद ही ख़ुद की प्यास भी..
उसे कोई और पसंद नई हे,
या फिर उसका कोई पसंदीदा नई हे।
वो कॉन हे ? एसी क्यूँ हे? और केसे?
केसे वो एसी ही हे? और जेसी हे वेसी ही क्यूँ?

क्या उसे एसा किसने बनाया हे? या वो ख़ुद बन गई?
हाँ उसे ASA बनाया गया हे और वक़्त ने बनाया हे।

वक़्त ने सिर्फ़ उससे छीन कर मुस्कुराकर चलना सीखाया हे..
वक़्त ने सिर्फ़ बहता रह कर उसको ना बहना सीखाया हे..
वक़्त ने सिर्फ़ अपनी ही फ़रमाइश पूरी की हे..
और वक़्त ने सिर्फ़ अपना ही एक पहेलू चलाया हे।

नाहीं उसका हिस्सा चला, और नाहीं क़िस्सा,
नहीं उसका रोना चला, और बस सिर्फ़ खोना।

फिर भी।
फिर भी वो जानती हे की वो एसी क्यूँ हे, लेकिन केसे?
केसे सब छीन जाने पर भी उसने सब सँवार लिया?
केसे सब बह जाने पर भी बना लिया?
केसे फ़रमाइश ना पूरी होने पर भी संभाल लिया? 
और सिर्फ़ अपना पहेलू ना चलने पर भी ख़ुद को माना लिया?...

यही हे वो ख़ुद।
वो ख़ुद जो वो ख़ुद हे और कोई और नहीं।
    



By-Ayushi Mandlesha
name: Ayushi Mandlesha (self)

description: She is my friend inspired and support

description:
So the woman who has inspired me is none other than my mother.
I am 23 years old and what i am is just because of my mom. She has made so many compromises in her life so that the other person should be happy .
As my father is a surgeon so basically he used to get posted to other states of India or abroad.
But my mom shed her tears only once when my father was leaving as he wanted that me and my mom should have a great living. 
My mom she raised me single handedly, acting as both parent.
She is bold enough and independent.
She has powerful wings which are spreaded to bring happiness in my life.
When i am alone i think of her, how she has lived her life just having me in her life, so i have the courage to fight back.
If i am independent in my life its just because of my mom.
Being independent is a great thing for all of us, but only some have the courage of staying independent.
She taught me how to spread my wings of happiness and to fight like a warrior when the world is against you.
What i admire about my mom is her smile, its like the morning sunrise wherein everyone wishes to be able to see the sun against all the odds which are happening i life.
She has helped a baby turn into a toddler then a kid then a teenage and then into an adult, where she saw so many obstacles but she knew that we just need to break the hurdles and to get stuck.
Its very difficult for a new born mom to raise her baby wherein she has no support but in times its just that she knows that she is the whole world for her baby.
She told me that woman should be financially independent in their life and to be able to stand and walk with their head straight. 
The world can't to anything to a strong woman.
So thank you mom for making me independent and strong and to be carefree.
name: Winnie Goyal

description:
Every mother plays a crucial role in her child's life. Her enormous sacrifices and unconditional love has no match. Unfortunately ,my life took an unexpected turn 4 years back . I lost my father due to a sudden heart attack. My mother was a pampered wife throughout , she never faced the harsh realities of life as my father always shadowed her with utmost love. After his demise , she fixed her broken soul for us . She gathered the courage to start working as a teacher at the age of 48 regardless of any teaching experience in her entire life because she use to be a home maker. As , my family lives in a small town , people made all sort of comments to let her feel down. Nonetheless ,she stood like a pillar of strength for us. Now she is managing her work life , looking after home and playing the role of mother as well as father to us. 
She is a source of inspiration for me to take on every challenge of life with undying spirit and that woman are capable of achieving everything . I hope that God gives enough strength to her that she never feels alone and I as her daughter make her a proud mother at each step of her life.
name: Princy Gera
