description:
Firstly i see this contest as one the best opportunity to write about my hero,my inspiration,who is my wife dr.preethi balachandar. I don't know whether i will win this contest or not but i have already won this contest by a colossal margin just by writing about my hero and inspiration,my dear wife...
We both are doctors,but she sacrificed her career and practice to back me and to take care of the familial well being by standing like a pillar of support. she takes care of each and everything at home and makes it sure i don’t get even a drop of stress and helps me to concentrate on my professional demands and excellence. She makes all the notes for my lectures,for my conferences,for my courses with all smiling faces..Today i am one of the best lifestyle experts of india and i owe all my success to my hero-my wife-my inspiration.The inspirational story doesn't end here,she as a mother is thoroughly unmatchable. She stays with my son 24*7 and you will be surprised to know she is the best friend of my son.Yes,the key reason for that is the systems she has made at home-1.no whatsapp 2.no facebook 3.no phone usage till 12th grade.4.internet only for educational purposes.5.even my phone does not have a whatsapp.Well my son has no problems with all these system,just because she keeps him occupied with lot of activities and spends all the quality time with him so that he doesn't get addicted to all these “new age addictive technologies and gadgets” which are leading to series family crisis and health issues all over the world. She is not only the hero for me,she is the hero for my son too...she always inspired me to work hard and today she stands synonymous to-*dedication*hard work*giving back*systemic living*never ending love*unconditional care*superior humanity and yes,”THE WOW WOMEN” who is an example to millions of woman in this nation..“celebrating her is actually celebrating my life” because she makes my everyday a celebration.. my hero-my wife-my inspiration...
name: DR.PREETHI BALACHANDAR

description:
A Mother is the truest and most pure form of love. No matter what path was ahead my mother moved headstrong.
She did not fear the obstacles but met them with grace and elegance not once letting her guard down or giving way to a crack that may have caused a fracture. She is formidable and fearless. 
During my stormy adolescent n youth she stood by me like a rock filled with the Spirit of God. She taught me to discern what would be a better choice reasoning out my every query, setting clear examples. 
Her knowledge is vast and she is totally aware of many a subject....
Today as I also play a similar role ,I look back at the sacrifice she made every single day,  the trouble she went through to protect her Cubs like the fearless Lioness. ...
She is the earth that binds everything together, like the walls of a house are kept together by what binds them. ...Her compassion keeps me going on every difficult day....
She is my role model ,my everything....
And more I was surprised one day, when both my Cubs said to me that they want to be like HER,MY MOTHER, when they grow up....so thus I know that she encompasses everything and is the epitome of a well balanced and fulfilled life.
HER CHILDREN RISE UP AND CALL HER HAPPY,HER HUSBAND TOO AND HE PRAISES HER.
( Prov.31:28)
name: Annette Bragança Pinto

description: A ideal companion and a mother. renunciation personified.  Devoid of any earthly attachmentexpectations from the world, a devotee to her god and husband. She has not given birth to a child, because she is the mother of the mankind, unlike her counterparts who crave for a child, as if not brearing a child is the greatest sin on earth. Holy Mother’, Sri Sarada Devi, the spiritual consort of Sri Ramakrishna, was born on 22 December 1853 in a poor Brahmin family in Jayrambati, a village adjoining Kamarpukur in West Bengal. She epitomizes how to lead a spiritual life while discharging household duties. She led absolutely pure life, and served Sri Ramakrishna as his devoted wife and disciple, while remaining a virgin nun and following the spiritual path. A supreme standard of life's highest manifestation.
name: Sri Sarada Devi

description:
Look at her photo. Does she look 59?

There are several terms that come to my mind when I think of her - 'Iron lady', 'Happy Soul', 'Smiling Buddha', 'Inspiring Human'. When people who know her feel low in life, they think of her and get an instant shot of inspiration. The relief and peace that a religious baba cant provide, she can do that easily provide that through her outlook towards life. Married to once a rich family in a small town of India, Bulbul has kept her family strong during her husband's bankruptcy, did not let the male-dominated society take away her second child away from her, has fought and won 2 battles of cancer - ovarian and breast, has not let her left-side paralysis stop her from standing tall, so what if a negligence by the surgeon during her cancer surgery may have cost her another couple of surgeries - one of them a major plastic surgery, life has given her multiple fractures and surgeries on her hands and legs but that doesn't stop her from going for her evening walk. Doctors say she is a moving miracle, people like me who know her call her the ultimate inspiration - the ever-smiling sunflower of our lives. She is the hope, the beacon that brightens our life. She inspires us to live in the present and never fret about life. She reminds us of how fortunate we are and why we should be grateful to God every single day. She is someone whose story should reach out to people who are depressed, under duress, or those who are just not satisfied with their lives.

1) Mental strength can win over any disease. Look at Bulbul
2) You are always better off than millions of people around. Look at Bulbul
3) Happiness is more a temperament rather than circumstance. If you think you are unlucky, think about Bulbul
4) Whatever be the situation, you can always chose to be happy. Look at Bulbul
5) Financial distress? Depression? Feeling Hopeless? Medically Unfit? Unhappy? Unlucky? Look at Bulbul
And many many many other things to look at and learn from Bulbul.
name: Bulbul

description:
A woman plays a number of roles in her life. She is a daughter and a sister, a wife and a mother. She can succeed in the first ones by being loving and thankful but being a good wife requires more than just love. She needs to be caring, devoted, and trustworthy to keep her family whole.

This is where my wife comes in. Being a wife looks easy, but it is not. Being married to the man of your dreams brings lots of joys. It is the beginning of a new life for the women. There are lots of challenges to be faced and responsibilities to be fulfilled. She handles each with much ease.

Here is where understanding each other’s wants, needs and expectations take centre stage. Ultimately,  a good wife begets a good husband and vice versa.
name: Debjani Kundu

description: The first woman IPS officer of India, an inspiring role model, a Ramon Magsaysay awardee Kiran Bedi has a powerful influence on my life. Two beliefs of her which always give me courage. Life is always on incline way- It either goes up or down. 100 things happen in life- 99% things are your own creations. If good happens enjoy and if bad happens learn from them. 1 % things are beyond your control and you can’t do anything about it like natural calamities, death of your near ones etc. Only you can respond to such situations with all the courage stored in you with no place for fear. The iron lady, who joined Indian Police as a tough woman, a woman with infantile stamina. For her, police stood for power to correct instead of power to punish and believed in equal policing despite of all men around her. It was first and the last time when the Prime Minister of India was given a parking ticket. She denied self-glorification by refusing Asian Jyoti award as it was not for her whole traffic unit. The rule was simple-pro justice because of which she was sent to indiscreet postings where others would say ‘No’. She was sent to prison assignment a den of criminals-10000 men to 400 women to lock her thinking as there will be no car and no parking tickets to vips or ministers. She never complained about anything what was left over by the officers earlier in Tihar jail or in other postings of her. She started education and meditation in prison and converted prison to ashram and was instrumental in introducing prison reforms. A beginning of a bigger change.  Change is never easy and full of challenges and when those moments pass, we discover the hidden strength that exists in each of us. She is currently into movements of education and anti -corruption. I take this platform to thank you for being there without knowing how you are still changing my life and Celebrate HER in every woman who gets inspired by such persona even if it means that you are the only woman doing it.
name: Kiran Bedi

description:
My inspiration is my mother, it seems very obvious that a child to be inspired by his mother. My father was in BSF and my mother was a single working parent for me and my sister. She started working as a teacher in the year 1992 in Jodhpur, and it was the time when there was a mental illness in our society of a small city like Jodhpur that a woman can not work, she is born to serve his husband and in-laws but with the support of my father, she has gone against society and started working as a teacher.
In the present time, culture has arrived that the husband and wife both are working and they do not have time for their children. Children are getting older at the creche with learning from their nannies and I still remember the time when my mother woke up at 5am to prepare breakfast and lunch for her children, then she drops us to school and gives everyday same instructions till the age of 14 that do not fight with anyone or do not do anything wrong so that anyone in family gets a chance to blame my mother that due to her wish of being teacher her children are making a nuisance. That time I and my sister were always in thinking that our mother is so strict and put lots of restrictions to us but now is the time when I really respect her a lot and I am proud to my mother that due to her courage only we are having a life which we were not even can dream about.

I am a student studying in the college. My Mother Inspires me a lot in every way. Whatever today I had learned in my life because of my mother. What's special about my Mother is? She Never reluctant to do the job, and try to grab every opportunity whenever she get's it. She is working in the diamond industry as a female worker with too many male workers, there firm have the full of male workers and not even a single female worker is working at there. She is always asking me, what you wanted to be in your life? I always reply I want to be an Investment Banker and at where my passion is!
She is opposing me every time and saying that there is a lack of scope in such things. But I always says I am not doing for the money, I am doing for myself. But I tell myself in my mind that I am doing for you only. She gives me full blown confidence in every way and teach me the real lessons about how to ignore those persons who are hurting you. I always tell my mom that why you are not taking a One Week leave from the job so we could travel and feel relax with each other. But she always telling if I won't earn who will see your education and material expenses. She Works whole day from 8:30 AM to 7:30 PM and even she don't take a rest. She sometimes tired, I am seeing it but she always makes her happy and try to glam her face every time. How!!! I don't understand. She always do her work and tell me to give head massage and sometimes she got angry that Seth(Boss) is satisfied with his work and always try to out from the situation so she could satisfy. I always learn from her that how she makes the budget and control the household expenditure. description: She is a child of a God and i believed when i see her struggling everyday with respect to financial issues but never loose hope or faith on God. She was a computer teacher in an esteemed school but when it came to fulfilling her responsibilities she dropped teaching just to raise me and my elder sister. Things got worse when my nani expired. We had financial issues so she decided to take tuitions at home and be the best homemaker too. There were issues in her married life which led to suicide attempts but she was a fighter and she is surviving only to teach us how to make a respected living in this very challenging society. She had lost all her educational documents meanwhile so she could not continue teaching in any school due to absence of proof and from that day the pinch in her heart allowed me to understand the need and importance of education. My elder sister could not complete her CS finals and to reach till that stage she took almost 9 attempts meanwhile i started my CA and got the degree in 2019 after struggling with 6 attempts. So my mother took 15 attempts to not only provide us the much required degree but all her patience, struggle, endurance, faith, hardwork, prayers, sacrifice paid off with the message of how much a degree can provide you with! Even we fall she is standing beside us only to give us her helping hand till the last breathe of her life. She is an inspirational legend unnoticed to entire world but who is a world for me undoubtedly. The way she has so much in her that even at the age of 51 she dreams of opening an institute of her own, teaching me the importance of healthy lifestyle, good eating habits, saving of wealth is truely beyond imagination. God bless such inspirations

description:
The woman  who inspires me most is none other than my wife Mrs. Madhumita Padmapati. Her compassion towards fellow human  beings is perhaps second to none. I will narrate just one incident to illustrate my point. Once on board a flight from Kolkata to Guwahati, a young lady who was sitting next to my wife suddenly fell fell critically ill. Before my wife realized what was happening, the lady, who was a cardiac patient and was already beginning to lose consciousness, fell on my wife's lap. We  immediately called for help from the flight attendants. Together we poured some water onto her face, and as luck would have it, she regained her consciousness. My wife then massaged her head and forehead and asked her if she would like to eat something. My wife fed her Maggie that we purchased for ourselves. After eating, she felt somewhat better. My wife kept on massaging her head for the entire duration of the remaining part of the journey. At Guwahati Airport we finally handed over the young lady to her father who was 
 waiting for her. Had it not been for my wife's unrelenting care, and love and attention, we do not know what could have happened. Three cheers and Kudos to my dear Madhumita!!! We all need people like you around us.
name: Mrs. Madhumita Padmapati

description:
My mother, Mrs Tirumala is my role model. She inspires and motivates me to grow without any barriers.
  
My mother supported me in every part of my life. Right from childhood she has been with me like my shadow. It had been riddled with hurdles and difficulties, but she has managed to cross them with her love and care.

Basically we are from a middle class family and father is a private employee and we are total four including my sister. So my mother also had to handle our home life. So she started tailoring to help my father. That is how she was able to satisfy financial needs in the home. There are certain days where we couldn’t eat food for three times a day still she never make us to starve. When I was studying my engineering there was a time where my friends going for an excursion and I couldn’t afford money even though my mother gave money to go with my friends without hesitating. By this I learnt “Time is precious than wealth”. Because if my mother say no I would have missed those days with my friends and I really won’t get those days back even I have enough money now. She gave everything in my life what she didn’t get from her childhood. It’s her dream to see her children to be happy and achieve what they need. I feel she achieved it.  

Now I've graduated in B.Tech (ECE) and I’m working as software engineer.

Whenever I look at my mother I see an ordinary person but when I think about what she does and how she does it she becomes divine and the reason of my smile! 

The experience of my life so far has truly brought things into perspective. My mother has taught me that hard times can be overcome and that losing battles can be won. She has taught me more than I could have learnt from any book. 

She sets an inspirational example to me teaching me how to live life and make make wise decision even in the most uncertain situations. I respect her a lot. She is my inspiration and I feel everyone should have a mother like my mother. Love you Amma!!
name: Tirumala

description: n 2013, Manisha Soin started a platform called ihealthkonnect- India's 1st price discovery platform for healthcare where one could discover and compare prices for medical procedures, surgeries, cost of medical treatment from some of the best hospitals in India. At ihealthkonnect , her mission was to improve access to healthcare. She believe that healthcare was made for everyone since the pain point for most people was the lack of awareness of local and global options. Ihealthkonnect aimed to ease that by collaborating with the best hospitals across geographies to give you indicative price points for cost of one's medical treatment. As an easy to use platform, patients were able to search, consult, compare and book their treatment at an affordable cost at some of the very best , trusted, JCI accredited hospitals in India. However, this made her realise that Cancer Treatments were of high cost and were the most popular searches on the website. On talking to a few patients, she also realised that most patients were unsure of their cancer treatment plans and sought validation . Hence, in early 2019, she co-founded CanceRX- a platform that is working on the painpoint of affordability for cancer care. CanceRX offers patients affordable consults, 2nd opinions, affordable diagnostics, and affordable care delivery for cancer treatments- synonymous to her mission with ihealthkonnect. Over the past year, Cancerx has an internal tumour board, has 230 oncologists on board and has grown from being a patient front platform only to a platform where even doctors at the point of contact can query with peers, other super specialist oncologists on cancer cases, helping with earlier detection, diagnosis thereby improving prognosis. E- prescription, and tie-ups with pharma companies ensure drug delivery at a reduced cost even at remote locations. On a personal level, Manisha lives with her family in Gurgaon and loves all things fitness like swimming and gymming. She is also a foodie.
name: Manisha Soin

description: She is one of the women who came in my life 3 years back and she has actually changed my perspective to look at people. Not just that, she made me realise how important is it to keep your friends together when they are fighting and when everyone is mean to each other. I have seen her solving problems by just hugging people and talking. I have always believed in talking to the person directly to solve the issue rather than talking behind the back. I was lucky enough to find myself in her. She is just like me (for this part at least). We had our share of ups and down and she was the one who came and talk to me to figure out what can be done to solve the issue without affecting our friendship. Next time when we fought (on something else), I thought about her ...what would she had done if she were in my place? The answer was straight forward..I went to her and talked to her. Since then we do this juggling where sometimes I go and talk to her or sometimes she come and talks to me. Sometimes we AGREE to DISAGREE (which I feel is a very important part of any friendship or relationship). Not just this, we talk about studies as well. We try to understand each other's work and give ideas about how to tackle any problem or how to make it better. She has taught me that it doesn't matter whether you belong to same field or not, it is all about are you willing to help the other person and learn from the other person at the same time. She made me believe that friendship is not just about hanging out, drinking together, making fun of ther people, rather its is also about growing together, point out other person's mistake (in a positive way), learning togther and teavhing each other about how to be a part of your own and the other person's overall development. According to me, this is the best quality which make you respect and love other person.
name: Jagriti Singh

She is one in a million. It's really tough to put together few words about her. I would need a sea of words for her. She is such a kind hearted women who loves unconditionally, who will help without any purpose , always happy and doesn't allow any kind of stress or problem come near her.
She spreads her positivity every where she goes. 
Just a lil instance I would like to share.
Once while walking down the road she saw a young boy pulling rickshaw with a wounded foot.. Not knowing anything about him,she took him to a doctor. Doctor said that the boy was suffering from absis, wherein the foot becomes purple and it pains alot and that this will need a long treatment, with weekly visit to the doctor. Here I woul like to tell you that the consultatiin fees of the doctor was 800 and medicine that were prescribed were for 2400 .. In today's time who would spend so much on a stranger.. ?? May I add here that not only this lady took care of his medicines for 3 months but also his weekly visit to the doctor but also provide him 2 meals daily.. Hatss off to her. She is an inspiration to me. She is my mother . I live her alot and more than that I respect her alot.
name: Nishi sharma

description:
The lady whom I admire….
	She was born in a lower middle class family, strived hard to complete her studies. Against all odds married the man she loved who was from a different religion, caste and language in 1990 Aug 17th. Both the families were against the marriage.  Life was smooth till the good hearted man slipped in to addiction of alcohol. Life changed upside down…by that time she was blessed with two girls. Life was tough on her; she started searching for a job.  It was not so easy.  Being a graduate finally she got a job in a private school for the salary of Rs.300/- . And then something strange started happening. She began to speak to herself….”go ahead go ahead you can do”.  She created a spark within her and thus moved forward.
	Throughout the years her life was full of chaos, but she did not want to give up.  Lots of painful incidents happened...even then she gained strength from all those things and moved forward. Her little angels were grown up girls now.  Her man was diagnosed with liver cirrhosis, treatment continued for 14 months, but finally he went to be with the God. Even then she is on her own. No turning back, living a content life. A life without any regrets, but full of will power to move forward no matter what.  The lady who admires me is none other than Sophia David…that’s ME. Still the same spirit “go ahead go ahead, you can do”.
name: Sophia David

description:
They say change begins at home. For Chinni Swamy, it really did, when she started her initiative Stree Shakti with one woman at her own home in village Purkal, in Uttaranchal.

It was back in 2001, when Chinni and her husband Swamy thought of moving ‘to some place in the foothills of Himalayas’. For most people that would mean a charming town like Dehradun or the picturesque hill station of Mussoorie. The Swamys chose a little village, Purkal, which falls somewhere between Dehradun and Mussoorie.

Once there, Swamy started a school for children from nearby villages and Chinni decided to introduce the women of those villages to a little known craft form - quilting. Slowly, over the years, Chinni has introduced the world to these quilts through her entrepreneurial venture, 'Stree Shakti'.
What started with one woman then, has grown into a team of over 130 today. This includes the women who make the products, the designers, accounts manager, purchase and marketing manager, store manager, office assistant, supervisor, quality controller and trainers.

Stree Shakti retails its products through their shop at the women centre in Purkal, their online store and at exhibitions across the country. They also have retail partners in the US and the UK.
name: Chinni maam

description:
I am a Yoga expert, Reiki Grand Master, a young Entrepreneur. It wasn’t an easy way choosing my profession as a yoga teacher!
It was that time when my results of the final year of college ( Bachelors in History .)  in June 2008 were out and I was hit by some chemical reactions in my brains. Some doctors even refused to write the diagnosis on the paper. I was not in my normal consciousness for 4 weeks. I was getting hallucinations and I went into my own imaginary world. By the time I got back to my normal self, my family told me that I was unwell for quite a long time. My treatment had started and I was told that I was affected by some type of serious depression. It took me around a year and a half to get back to my normal life again and meanwhile I had gained 25 kgs as a result of the side effects of the medicines. I had stopped seeing myself in the mirror as I refused to accept the person I had become.
For me, my life had come to an end and I saw no ray of hope. What saddened me the most was that some of my school friends spread rumors that I had become mad or faced some mental craziness. They not just made fun of me but made fun of my illness.
I was trying really hard to come out of that safe shell I had created for myself where I avoided talking to people, going out of my home and was hell scared of driving.
A person who had been a topper in her academics in college, won competitions in dance or music performances, a professional Jazz dancer, her life had come to a Halt. But I didn’t give up on life and I fought back!
I started practicing Positive affirmations for my health, I resumed back to my yoga practice after taking permission from my doctor. Yoga helped me in the reduction of my medicine dosage and gradually it pulled me out of depression! Today I run a yoga school and run a brand for corporate yoga Pan delhi ncr and I train yoga teachers with International certification. My story has been featured on abp news tv in 2017 on 21st June.
name: Apurva Saxena - My own story

description:
The Fighting Sprint and Never Die Attitude.

I am a mobile app developer who got married when I was 25 and had my first baby at 28. Being someone who hails from a very small town from Rajasthan, Tonk, I was always wanted to do something for the people who are not privileged and don't have access to right advice and knowledge to break the barriers. I learned most of the things on my own via internet. So, I decided to give it back to my society. When I was pregnant and have to asked to leave the office (yes, my organisation didn't had concept of maternity leaves and I was forced to take unpaid leave). I decided to utilize my time to do something impactful and here I conceived the idea of helping the unprivileged people to learn the computer. I wanted to do it for masses, so I started working on an app idea (being an software engineer, it was my forte), I conceptualized a simple app to learn computer and internet, how to use the computer and internet. From where to get access to the infinite source of knowledge and do something big. I developed and launched this app when I was pregnant, created quality content to learn computer in Hindi and today, my app stand at 2 million installs. 20 lacs people have learned basic computer and how to use internet in simple hindi using my app. I keep receiving a lot of user feedback which are filled with love and emotions as these are the people about which no one is thinking as these the poor people and can't afford expensive courses. So, it feels really great when I see my own hardships and despite those I never gave up and build something which is helping millions now to break the chains and come out stronger where they can follow their own dreams.
name: Varsha Vijayvargiya

description:
Hard work and dedication pays off. 
This is all about my graduation days in the college. 
I was the constant topper for the first and the second year in my class and also got the highest marks in almost all the subjects. 
In the Third year i was getting married, now the question was i was in the final year of graduation and got married before giving my final exams.
People often say that marriage creates lots of obstacles in studies, but I would preferably say NO.
Your personal life and professional life is different.
Why would i have let my marriage affect my results, studies and examination.
I gave the final exam after i got married and scored the highest again. 
At the end of the third year 
I was the overall topper having the highest aggregates in all the three years plus 11 baccalaureate awards and 2 scholarships. 
The path wasn’t easy but it required proper time management, focus and intense hardwork.
It is almost one and a half year since i got married now 
And I’m continuing my studies even after that. 
Now I’m doing Masters- Msc in Nutrition and I’m is the last year of my final studies. 
Think positive & be positive

description:
Dr. Ciby Mathew BDS
Mother | Educationist | Social Entrepreneur

When her first born was diagnosed as differently abled, Dr. Ciby Mathew a dentist by education realized early on that her life’s calling was to focus on her son and his development. 

In doing so she also realized an urgent need in the society and enabled the creation of opportunity for many other similar children to realize their full potential through the establishment of HOPE Qatar Centre for Special Needs, a not-for-profit educational facility bringing out the best in each child under its care in Doha - Qatar.
 
After dedicating over two decades in the care of her son who has gone on to become a young man who has obtained a Diploma in Computer Applications; and after investing over 12 years in enhancing the abilities of each and every child at HOPE Qatar; and seeing numerous students go on to complete their 10th and 12th grade exams through the Indian National Open Schooling exams, and many others complete their diplomas in computer applications, Dr. Ciby bid farewell to Doha in 2018 and moved to India for further studies of her children and to care for her elder family members. 

She enrolled herself in a course for enhancing her entrepreneurial knowledge to be able to establish her second social entrepreneurship initiative that will benefit many youths with disabilities in India. 

A mother who dedicated her life and transformed herself into an educationist whose positive impact on many students has been realized and recognized for over a decade is now dedicating herself to her new mission that will open up new opportunities for her son Stevin and many other youth like him in India. The centre she established in Qatar continues to touch the lives of many students and their families.

Dr. Ciby Mathew is our evidence that in every challenge that life throws at us, there is an unexploited opportunity as well. She is certainly a young woman achiever of our time. Lets Celebrate her contributions.
name: Dr Ciby Mathew

She was a computer teacher in an esteemed school but when it came to fulfilling her responsibilities she dropped teaching just to raise me and my elder sister. Things got worse when my nani expired. We had financial issues so she decided to take tuitions at home and be the best homemaker too. There were issues in her married life which led to suicide attempts but she was a fighter and she is surviving only to teach us how to make a respected living in this very challenging society. She had lost all her educational documents meanwhile so she could not continue teaching in any school due to absence of proof and from that day the pinch in her heart allowed me to understand the need and importance of education. My elder sister could not complete her CS finals and to reach till that stage she took almost 9 attempts meanwhile I started my CA and got the degree in 2019 after struggling with 6 attempts. So my mother took 15 attempts to not only provide us the much required degree and respect but all her patience, struggle, endurance, faith, hardwork, prayers, sacrifice paid off with the message of how much a degree can provide you with! Whenever we fall she is standing beside us only to give us her helping hand till the last breathe of her life. She is an inspirational legend unnoticed to entire world but who is a world for me undoubtedly. The way she has so much in her that even at the age of 51 she dreams of opening an institute of her own, teaching me the importance of healthy lifestyle, good eating habits, saving of wealth is truly beyond imagination. God bless such inspirations...

description:
Dr. Urvashi Makkar, has set out to empower women and youth across the world. She is a seasoned academician with a knack for entrepreneurship and a persistent passion for learning. Dr. Urvashi envisions an empowered woman as a picture of confidence, diligence, exceptional resolve,and comfortable in the skin of multidimensional roles.

An Inspirational Philosophy

Since childhood, Dr. Urvashi has been very strongly inspired by the thoughts and works of Swami Vivekanand. His youth orientation, his teaching and his passion have always inspired her. She imbibes his teachings in her profession to make sure that she contributes towards the society. She claims to have inherited her passion towards work from her parents.“I have never stopped learning and re-learning in my life,” says Dr. Urvashi. She believesthat education empowers us with the ability to think, to differentiate ‘right’ from the ‘wrong’, and ‘good’ from the ‘bad’. Our country needs empowered youth with a wholesome education and Dr. Urvashi believes this to bethe responsibility of the teaching fraternity. For that it is of utmost importance that the teachers empower themselves first. Dr. Urvashi has dedicated a considerable time of her life towards research work than can help in the betterment of the education system in India.

The Future belongs to those who believe in their Dreams

Choosing education sector as a profession was never an alternative to Dr. Urvashi. She had the focus of getting into teaching and mentoring from the very beginning. “Despite the overwhelming haze of gender inequality and patriarchal society in our country, it has been an achievement to reach, where I am today,” says Dr. Urvashi.

Dr. Urvashi is glad that she is doing justice to her dreams and encourages women across the world to follow their dreams and believe in them. She believes that being a part of the Teaching Fraternity was her best decision because it has changed her way of thinking towards social, economic& national issues
name: Dr. Urvashi Makkar

description:
The day her leg was amputated, Arunima Sinha took a pledge that many would find even difficult to comprehend. Her objective, from that day onwards, was not simply to prove her proficiency with a prosthetic leg, but was also to conquer the highest peak in the world – Mount Everest. The sense of accomplishment was what brought back her fearlessness as well as made her a motivation for everybody back home.
As she lay in the hospital bed, with one leg amputated, Arunima Sinha took a vow that many would think impossible. Her goal, from that day onwards, was not just to become adept at walking with a prosthetic leg but scale the highest point in the world--Mount Everest.
It was a feat--which many would consider impossible--that not only brought back her self confidence but made her an inspiration for everyone back home. Even before the horrible accident which left her an amputee, Sinha was a force to reckon with.
name: Arunima Sinha

description: Family has always been of great importance to me and something that I value very strongly. I grew up in an all-girl household with my mom and older sister while my dad and two older half-brothers live in different state. Living in a household just us girls has brought us together and made the bond between us very strong. My parents have always taught me and my sister that family always comes first and that is something that has always stuck with me. Even though my father and his side of the family live in different state both of my parents have made an effort to keep our family very close and connected as a unit. That is something that I love and appreciate and even being miles away from my father I still feel as though I can go to him with anything. Beyond my immediate family, I have 8 cousins and I have a great, really close relationship with every one of them. My entire family from both from my mom and dad's side spend Christmas, thanksgiving and other big holidays together. This is something that I hope to continue as a tradition for many, many years.

description:
Mrs. S. Babita is the founder of Riya Chemy which is a 20 year old chemical manufacturing company having several brands catering to construction chemicals, home care, automobile detailing & instant glue adhesive industry.
What inspires me about her is that she ventured into a business where there has been hard-hitting competition from multinational companies since the beginning but her determination to provide excellent quality products for the mass market made her a winner & is standing strong with these competitors since 1999.
Apart from taking care of manufacturing, she also had to market & deliver these products in the retail during the beginning, even during her prenatal period.
Being a lady, she never let any flaws overcome her. She implemented & overpowered every obstacle & always cared the most for her employees. 
At a very early stage of business, she understood the needs of being there in the Industry for long & established every necessary facility that a full-fledged company has today. The company was the highest tax payer in the circle during the central excise regime.
From zero to a turn-over of thirty million for a lady who learnt everything in these 20 years, makes her self-made & her mortality that kept everyone along the journey.
From making products manually to semi-automatic machines, a full-fledged lab, an appropriate manufacturing set-up & every law being obeyed, this is her true achievement.
Her financial discipline is what inspires me too. In the history of twenty years, not a single cheque default by the Company, this is commendable. 
With no venture capitalists nor any public money involved, Riya Chemy has grown by the support of its banker & the trust built with its suppliers who have been associated since the inception of the Company.
She is a true inspiration to me, she has shown me that there is nothing impossible if you have the determination. She believes that people will someday overcome being brand conscious & value quality products.
name: S Babita

Her lessons are the best medication to cure a disease called life failures because she prepares her child for a future struggle with all her guidelines.
There is a saying in Hindi “Putra Kuputra ho sakta hain, lekin Mata Kumata nahi ho sakti”. It means “Son can do any worse with Mother, but Mother can never think any wrong about her child” and it’s so truthful. She is the kindest hearted person in the world who forgives all my mistakes because I start giving her all the pain right before I take birth but she never felt I am a pain for her, in fact, she loves more than anyone in this universe. Whatever I have earned today it is all and only because of my Mom. So, she is my inspiration,  probably not only me for anybody on this earth.
I am sure that wordings won’t be sufficient, my Mother is the best gift I have received in my life.

description:
My mother is the strongest person I have ever known. I had often wondered when I was little why I had to get up so early like everyone else. 
My mother was a smart lady. She always figured out fun ways to get me to clean up my room or brush my teeth . She always knew how to give the right advice. When I was seven, I often came home crying from school, because, back then, I was a bit chubby and my peers ruthlessly picked on me. My mother would hold me in her arms, push back my long hair from my face, and wiped away my tears as I told her what happened. My mother gave the right advice so many times, it was if she had been right there with me when it happened. Being little, I would sometimes whine about my weight, and then my mother would tell me that she had once been like me. 

My mother was the strongest person I have ever known. And if my mother had not been so strong, I do not think I would be here today, telling you her story

description: By twist of fate I first met Pausali at The Institute of Chartered Accountants  in Kolkata when she was struggling to make her footprints in the professional world.She was very polite,  docile and introvert but rich in values and lots of affection to the needy. Her life-story travels across torrid times when she lost her father at a tender age of 8 yrs, brought up by her mother, a convent school teacher by profession ,single handedly. Her perseverance has helped her pass through the most compelling and difficult circumstances one could have ever imagined during growing up. Her sincerity and determination helped her to come out with flying colours during her schooling at Loreto House  in sports,  culture and academics by winning several accolades and merit certificates. Her struggles in life develop her strengths.  She was a rank holder in Graduation in B.Com (Hons.). Destiny struck her once again when mother was diagnosed with terminal cancer. But her indomitable spirit to face and overcome every challenge that life brings in her journey empowered her to pursue her study and complete he post-qualification from Chartered Institute while pursuing her mothers' treatment. Her affirmative and positive attitude continues to  inspire me. She has earned admiration not only from her teachers but also amongst her peers who has seen her steer through amidst all adversities. . She always believes that what you want to achieve is possible if done with good intention and sharing the fruits of achievements . She instills faith and belief in others that you can rise even amongst adversities.  Till date she has overcome every obstacle faced in her life at the same time encouraging others to attain  success. Every obstacle that came across in her life gives her an opportunity to improve her circumstances.  She is also an active volunteer  in social activities  engaging her kind heart, generosity, and willingness to get things done for the underprivileged.

description:
CAPTAIN RADHIKA MENON IS A NAME THAT HOLDS EVERY INDIAN’S HEAD HIGH WITH PRIDE. A WOMAN WHO HAS ENGRAVED HER NAME IN GOLDEN LETTERS IN THE PAGES OF GLOBAL MARITIME HISTORY BY BECOMING THE FIRST WOMAN IN THE WORLD TO RECEIVE THE INTERNATIONAL MARITIME ORGANIZATION AWARD FOR EXCEPTIONAL BRAVERY AT SEA.

22 June 2015. Kakinada Storm.

The fishing boat ‘Durgamma’ was adrift in a storm after engine failure and loss of anchor due to the harsh sea weather. The boat was originally from Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, drifted to Gopalpur off the coast of Odisha. Saving the life of seven helpless fishermen ranging from the 15-year-old, Perla Mahesh to 50-year-old Narasimha Murthy. These fishermen were alive on ice from the cold storage as their food supplies had been washed away with the storm for almost a weak.

Capt. Radhika Menon was in command aboard the oil tanker Sampurna Swarajya when she spotted the fishing boat 2.5 km off the starboard bow, 53 Nm off the coast of Gopalpur, Odisha. Captain Menon immediately ordered a rescue operation. The rescue was carried out through wave heights of more than 25 feet, winds of more than 60 knots and heavy rain, using the pilot ladder and the life jackets. It took three breath-taking attempts in the in saving all seven weak and starving fishermen.
name: Captain Radhika Menon

description:
It was the summer of 2016, I was the typical carefree college kid just getting done with his internship and getting ready to back home for a vacation of fun and relaxation though that is what I did at the internship too, like I said the typical college kid. Little  did I know that this summer was going to change my life forever! I lost my father to pancreatitis, also known as the silent killer. We had no idea he was ill and neither did he! 
Imagine everything important in your life being taken away without warning, better yet imagine spending your whole life with that person and have it taken away in a matter of days. It was a terrible ordeal for my brother and I. I starkly remember what she had to say that fateful day, who are we to step in to deny what god or fate wants, he’s in better place!
Troubled times did lay ahead with all our relatives asking us to relocate back home and have them support us. But the Iron Lady in my life simple stood tall for us and said we can handle ourselves and you’re damn right she did. Financial troubles and all, she never made it seem like they existed, keeping us protected though I knew they were there. Now that I’ve a job and have asked her to come settle with me,  she simply says that I’m still young and much to experience, why tie you down to responsibilities. It was your fathers and mine to ensure you were settled down in life and I’m going to make sure I complete that. Her down to earth nature, an ever so friendly face and attitude coupled with fierce perseverance and hard work is what that held us together and helped us get through troubled times. She stood tall and made us proud. She’s my Iron Lady. She is my definition of girl power!
name: Jayaraman Sripriya

description: My mother Uma, who is no more was  a personification of dusciplibe, dedication and devotion. Inspite of being a woman of those times, she had a deep leaning towards knowledge and education. She herself was a botany student from a renowed college in Coimbatore. She aimed for perfection in whatever she did. That made her a class apart from everyone. She was very good in tailiring, drawing, embroidery,and an excellent cook too. She was deeply religious, health conscious  and above all an epitome of sacrifice for the family. She inspired me to do my M. . Phil in Biochemistry . She created that passion in me to learn, share and spread my wings of knowledge. Today when I receive awards for my contributions in the field of Education it is a pity she is not there to see them. Yet her advices and uobringing has paved way for me to achieve in life and also lead my son to be a good human being. Kudos to her love for learning, accumulation of knowledge which in turn has inspired me to be a life long learner. I am glad I have passed on the same to my son,. Thanks Ma for instilling a love for knowledge, duscipkine and above all to care and share theo positive things of life with all. Thank You once for nurturing ne to be an excellent human being.
name: Uma Sathyakaman_ My mother

Yes, it was true, she was smart, knew how to save money , had a great marriage and had raised independent and secure kids. But her greatest strength had been shown when she had fought cancer. Not many could be like her and not play the sympathy card. For her, it was an illness that needed to be dealt with without creating havoc for everybody around. And she had been victorious in that. description:
She's my mother. We had a family tragedy in January 2015 in which we lost my elder brother and my father in a road accident. Only me and my mother survived with major injuries. 
When everything was falling apart in our life, and I thought, being a student at that time,  we won't be able to survive in this world. But she stood up irrespective of having major surgeries and numerous stitches on head, and joined her job as a school teacher in March. She stood up for me, got me admission in DTU, Delhi in MBA, while I was struggling with my injuries. She stood up for me, she fought everyone for me, the family which was left. She stood strong alone, and in year 2017 she happily retired as a principal of Govt school in Rohini. I can't imagine how she did that, who gave her the power to rise this strong, but she's my everything. She was always there when I felt weak and took all the burden of running the family. We're still not recovered completely but she always stay positive about Life irrespective of challenges after loosing almost everything. Yes, my home is a home because of her with all doors open for relatives and friends. She's my Superstar and she always will be.
P.S. now all because of her efforts I'm settled after completing my MBA, and I'm sure I'm never lacking motivation and positiveness she gave me. Yes, she's my mother and she's nothing less than a warrior in every aspect.
name: Lalita Sharma

description:
Dear Yes Bank Team,

Am the YesFirst customer with ID NO 6766940. 
I appreciate this platform, we get so busy with our lives that we tend to forget value of our dearest ones. 

Here, person whom I will be mentioning is my wife itself. 
Let me clarify, we had a courtship period of 18 months as well, prior to our marriage. 
So when I came to know about her parents being interested in me  for the marriage. I was not sure, as I was in Dubai, working with luxury hotels.
And was on a brink of entering the cruise industry. 
So this came as a surprise to me, as I was never ready for marriage.
Luckily I got my dream job and said yes for the marriage. 
And there begun our 18 months courtship period, before we got married in Dec, 2016.

Every girl wants her partner to be with her all the time.
We were not lucky in this case due to the nature of my job.
I always had an impression, that I have abundance of patience but I was horribly wrong, she is a goddess of patience. 
My work pressure kept on mounting, stressed was rising day by day in my new cruise job and all these frustrations, I used to shower it on my fiancee. She still listened it silently and hanged up, with patience, telling me to go and sleep. Deep down she knew, it was not real me. 
This frustration builded up like mountain and I was not happy with my job, wanted to quit, but was not in a financial situation to do so. Also I was being paid well, so had to drop the idea. But again she stood and consoled me began to motivate me like 'Sandeep Maheshwari'. But somehow her words were magical and it used to bring positivity in me.
She being herself a banker, does everything for my parents to make them happy, even when they are not. 3 years to the marriage and her respect is still same for my parents and still she gives her best. 
'What a wonder women' she is. 
I realised later on what about her own happiness, is she happy and she said 'yes'. Because she loves me and her only goal is to keep me motivated. 'Akansha' I ❤️you
name: AKANSHA KATYAYAN

description:
Muniba Mazari is lovingly referred to as the Iron Lady of Pakistan. And for all the right reasons.

At the age of 21, Muniba was left paralyzed from the hip down after surviving a tragic car accident. Her backbone was crushed and she sustained multiple fractures to her arm, shoulder, ribs and collarbone. Doctors told her that she would be unable to walk, paint, or give birth; this left her devastated and questioning her existence in the world.

“…that day I decided that I’m going to live life for myself. I am not going to be that perfect person for someone. I am just going to take this moment and I will make it perfect for myself, that I’m going to fight my fears.”

In her powerful and inspiring speech, Muniba shares coming to terms with her new purpose while being confined to a bed for two years. Nine years later, her inspirational story continues to touch people all over the world. Muniba was named one of BBC’s “100 Most Inspirational Women in 2015” and featured in Forbes’ “30 under 30” the following year.

“You know, when you end up being on the wheelchair, what’s the most painful thing. People think that they will not be accepted by the people because we in the world perfect people are imperfects. So I decided to appear more in public.”

Her presence in Pakistan continues to grow as she works as an anchor at Pakistan Television Corporation (PTV). She has also worked on campaigns for Toni&Guy and refuses to portray herself as a victim of circumstance. A firm believer in ‘turning adversity into opportunity’, this 29-year-old has made it her mission to inspire the same in others.

As Pakistan’s first wheelchair-using artist and first female Goodwill Ambassador, Muniba continues to model, speak and sing, proving that determination always trumps hardship.
name: Muniba Mazari

description: Sudha Murthy is the lady who inspires me. Reading her books has given a direction to me, as to how to lead ones life. Short stories, her life experiences pen down in the form of small chapters. Every chapter gives you a reason to be good to others and teaches how to serve others, value of what God has given us and finally share what we have be it materialistic or knowledge. Sharing some of her charity works, sponsoring a girl met in the train, how she stopped drinking milk, stopped buying Sarees, giving good quality rice to people you come begging at your door.something that had a major impact on myself.... Influenced by her work, this year dedicated my summer vacations one month in Banaras and joined a NGO named Aghor Foundation for a month, taught under privileged kids in Anjali school , 6 days a week and on Sunday visited eye-camps. Wonderful experience..... pure, connection, love with kids. Reading Sudha Murthy’s book helped me as a guide what to do in life. Celebrated my late fathers birthday with kids, served food to them and cooked Kheer for 150 kids myself....picture I have shared with little Rohan drinking kheer made by me.... heavenly satisfying feeling..... unconditional love..... promised myself would come to school to do service every year now on..... learnt a lesson, everybody should do little what one can do..... world will surely become heaven.....the way god has made.
name: Sudha Murthy

description:
. Shake off Your Problems

A man’s favorite donkey falls into a deep precipice. He can’t pull it out no matter how hard he tries. He therefore decides to bury it alive.

Soil is poured onto the donkey from above. The donkey feels the load, shakes it off, and steps on it. More soil is poured.

It shakes it off and steps up. The more the load was poured, the higher it rose. By noon, the donkey was grazing in green pastures.

After much shaking off (of problems) And stepping up (learning from them), One will graze in GREEN PASTURES.
name: Tarun

description:
The woman that inspires me the most is my mother .  She is like a super woman and I mean it when I say there’s no one like her. 
What inspires me the most about her is her will to work for others and be there for not just the family but anyone who needs help. 
She ran a school in Dehradun for 27years where most of the students were studying for free. I think education is a great gift that you can give to people who ho can’t afford it. 
And that somehow inspired do something . And I decided to open a café where people come an eat good food at highly subsidised prices . If someone doesn’t have money they can eat for free too . I mean I’m not doing something as great as what she did but I’m just trying my bit. ❤️

description:
Every once in a generation, there comes a leader who provides a beacon of hope. For our generation that leader was Sushma Swaraj. As women lawyers, her journey was so personally inspiring to us. But the truth is we, women, alone cannot claim her. What she represented was so much beyond gender. She truly was what we want our leaders to be, our politics aside.
Her powerful oratorial skills were enhanced not only by her command of the Hindi language, but also by her scholarship in Sanskrit and political science. But mostly, it was enhanced by sheer hard work and her acquired in-depth knowledge of every subject she touched upon.Swaraj carried herself with grace and dignity. Her public life spanned an unblemished four decades. She will remain an inspiration for all young political aspirants that desire change through a mechanism of clean politics.
“All good things come in small packages” is a phrase she epitomised. The image of her standing head and shoulders above ministers from other parts of the world, at the foreign ministers meet, in Beijing, will remain her lasting legacy. It is a matter of pride that the tallest figure of Indian politics came in the form of a woman. A woman who wore her Indianness and femininity, each day and everywhere.
name: Sushma Swaraj

description:
Hi,
An angel who will always be with me is my Mom.
It seems like there’s a giant wave of women who are not afraid to be who they are and make a difference in the world. I think it’s really important to encourage each other. Encourage other women. We have to be joyful warriors. Your Confidence should come from who you are and what you do. Every step that I have taken in my career, I have been fearless. I don’t like giving negativity power. It seems that women is taking over the world. We are moving forward. You know, change is happening. That’s beautiful.

I believe everyone goes through hardships in life. Some choose to accept and the others like me try to change the world revolving around me. Here is my story, I’ am sure there are lot of people in this world who have faced lot many problems and some are still dying daily from inside.

My mother was 6 years old when she lost her mom. She got married at the age of 18. My father is a businessman and wanted a son. I still remember those days when I use to visit my mom after school at a nursing home nearby my place because my father use to beat my mother very badly. Most of the times she use to get injured for no reason. She use to stay quiet and we were too young to interfere. With time when I grew, I realized that my mom is getting punished for no reason. One day in 2004 my father left us as I was a girl child, hence he never wanted to take our responsibility. My mother took care of me as a single parent. I was too close to her. I never missed my dad.
did last right of my mom and still remember she always use to say be independent. You are my daughters and I am always there to support you in all highs and lows. I never missed my dad and he never came back. In February 2011, I became cabin crew in charge and I am so proud of my angel mother as she was the one who inspired me. I always walk with my head high. I have learnt that where there is no fear of failure, whatever you do would turn out to be success.PRIYA MAKHIJA
name: Priya Makhija

description:
She is my true inspiration, a woman of few words, a woman of dignity, poise and composure. She is my grandmother. 
Like most women her era, her life was never her own. Married at a young age, bearing kids before the hight of her youth and losing her loving husband before the due time. What inspired me most is her resolve to smile everyday, to bring joy to her family. To be a religious mother, grandmother, and great grandmother. She has taught me to accept things with silent resolve to endeavour and come out for the better. She has taught me to be kindly smart and respect people. She might not have gone out on the world and conquered sea's but she did conquer her fears, struggles, and hardships at home. Her tenacity is silent like the smoke with a power to choke. 

She is my grandmother and she has been and will be my inspiration to get up everyday and face my reality head held high.
name: Gannamaneni kasturi bai

description:
With due wholeheartedly respect and love all the Motherhood; I would state that my “MAMA” is my world and my inspiration. She is always being there for me in each and every progression of my life simply like a protector, like an adviser, like a caregiver. All I can say in regard to motherhood that all the love begins and ends there.

In a different culture, a Mother has different forename as MOTHER, MAMA, MUMMY, MOM, MAA, etc. I call my beloved Mother as “MAMA”. In fact, I can say that I have no words to fully express the sentiments about my mother.

Like others, I also have a beautiful experience with my “MAMA”. When I was a kid, she cares for me with so much love and affection. She guides that how to mark a step in each next stage. Her applause when I accomplished something. She undergoes miserable when I lost from my objectives however she never neglected to spur me to continue attempting.

Even, during my growing age, my “MAMA” showed the significance of life like an educator. She trained me like a soldier to confront the world with courage. She instructed about the tradition and culture of our human society.

She shared her experience with me that how to survive in the social life and how to talk mannerly with others.

Indeed, in my struggling period, “MAMA” dependably addressed that ‘Never loses hope..Everything will be fine..Keep trying and try to be the best version of you’. I never forget that inspiring words of her that energizes me throughout the life. In addition, she taught me every aspect that helps to accomplish my coveted objectives.

A famous quote by Jewish proverb- “God could not be everywhere, and therefore he made mothers”…. This line clearly characterized that god favored us with an exceptional and valuable blessing as a Mother.

Furthermore, I hope that everyone should concur that the lady as a mother who often loves us and forfeits for us at any condition deserve the best.
I love you, MAMA. You are the real inspiration for me.
name: LATE MINARBHA SAHOO

description:
The story continues.....Lastly, to be honest, my goal is really just to have a positive impact on everyone I meet, whether it’s a smile, a laugh, or a changed heart. I remain so positive at work, home. I am so blessed that people love me a lot and for them I am an inspiration. I have been to the darkness of hell, endured the most desolate times, and has been made strong through endurance. Now I walk with the FEARLESSNESS of a WOLF, the BRAVERY of the LION, and the FIERCENESS of a DRAGON.

“ZINDAGI EK BAAR MILTI HAI BILKUL GALAT HAI, SIRF MAUT EK BAAR MILTI HAI, ZINDAGI HAR ROZ MILTI HAI”.
I moved all polished wrapped up in grace, inside is a vulnerable child, and a warrior outside that the world praise.
So rise above or fall low. It’s your call….!!! I am a survivor. People will quit on you! You got to get up every day and make sure you never quit on yourself. Death is not the greatest loss in life. Loss is when life dies inside you while you are alive. Keep shining as you do. Celebrate this event called LIFE.
Long lost hugs,
Priya Makhija
name: Priya Makhija

description: She is like Confident package. After passed higher education, she went to college but because of brain tumor, she had to left college. Because of Operation, she hadn't given semester exam and suspended from college. This might be very depressed phase for her but still she went to another college alone to take admission. She faced daily headache and travel alone around 20 km, inspite of this difficulty she passed college with a very good percentage. After post graduation, she went through severe stomach pain and can't eat at least 3 to 4 month. Because of daily vomiting, her depression level was so high. Her liver was damaged because of no food, swelling in the stomach, liver and other organ. But still she survived this phase also, and want to became an IAS officer. Nowadays she is preparing for civil service exam

description: A lady coolie, the first I ever saw... She travels daily 45 km to reach Jabalpur, then Katni, works at the station till evening and then goes back home for house chores like cooking and cleaning. I was proud when I became a Civil Engineer that will make a mark in the men's world about 15 years ago.. But Hats of to this Lady... Who makes us believe that though we always hear that Women have more mental strength than Men, they can even have as much physical strength as Men too. I believe she is the First and maybe the only female coolie in India who makes us proud and inspires all the women to believe in themselves and the fact that nothing is impossible when you believe you can do it!

description:
My wife and I were waiting to get into an elevator at a metro station in Paris when a tall African American guy stepped into the elevator. He stood to my left and stared at my trolly bag which was quite heavy. He wore a black jacket, was decently groomed and looked pretty smart. 

When the elevator stopped, I unsuccessfully tried lifting up my trolly bag. The guy offered help. He grabbed the straps of the bag with one hand and dropped it outside the elevator. After we came out of the elevator, I thanked him for the help. He pointed towards the floor as if I had dropped something and disappeared into thin air. I checked the floor for any possible item that I could have mistakenly dropped. All this while the British woman kept grinning as if she knew something which I didn’t.

The train arrived on the platfom and I boarded the train along with my wife. I checked my pant’s side pockets for wallet only to find that it was missing. I rewinded my memory to recall the exact moment when the Afro American guy stealthily maneuvered his hand inside my left pocket on the pretext of helping me lift my bag.
Stunned, I recalled that I had my yes bank credit card in the wallet. I immediately callled the credit card customer care helpline which connected me to the yes bank customer care representative. He asked me only two questions- first, is it a staff account and second, what is my date of birth; before blocking my card. After hanging up, I got a message that my credit card transaction of 11 euro was declined at some restaurant in Paris. I heaved a sigh of relief. It hit me that the British woman might be aware of the tricks being played by the thief and that could be the reason why she had that wry smile.

My wife, being the super smart wife that she is, had already replaced the euros in the wallet with Rs. 300, credit card and lots of visiting cards. The poor thief was now left with INR 300  after putting in so much of efforts at the risk of getting caught.
name: Sapna Rajak

But now i am a software engineer in a very good company. Evrytym i wear only full length dress and clothes bcoz i dont want to show people my short coming. I want to earn more and more to get proper treatment some where. I have cried alot when people ask what is this on your skin. It is like crying and my life are related to each other. Why i m not normal is one thing alwys comes in my mind. I cannot wear dress of my choice. Every time it is needed to cover the scars other wise what people will say and they will ask always. It would have been very difficult when students bully you and tease to that what is this. But still i focussed on my studies and today i am a software engineer on my own. Life is not easy and was never easy for me. But still i am trying hard to make a good life for me where my parents will be free from tensions of mine. My own experience tells me that dont stop fighting and you will definitely achieve what you want. Just ignore what people say to bring you down. description: Dr Parveen Dang was my mother. As her title suggests, she was a doctor. Why she inspires me is simple. Not just because she was my mother, but also because she was a loving doctor. She put her duties before herself. Back in her days, she qualified the coveted Christian Medical College examination. Why is this special? Because everyone thought that it wasn’t possible for a Punjabi Girl to clear a Christian Medical College exam. But she did and became one of the top doctors in Delhi NCR. A general physician, I still remember the day we got our home made. With one hand she fed me, her baby and with the other she wrote the prescription for her patient while supervising the cementing of the house. In 2007, she passed away. She caught a disease from one of her patients only. Well, her patient got well and healthy but she couldn’t survive. The only thing she said to me back then was that I should make her proud. I’m trying hard. Just like how she was a thoughtful leader, a thoughtful parent, I am trying to be the same. She told me I need to work hard to make a name in this world. And I’m proud to be following her footsteps. With her light on me, in my second year I was the First Woman President of Enactus Ramjas, Ramjas College. I try to imbibe in me her qualities of hardwork, empathy, dedication and multitasking. I wish I can become even an iota of what she was.
name: Late DR. PARVEEN DANG

description:
I was a girl from poor financial background.Completing education was one of my biggest challenge.If it was a financial problem I would have seen for an alternative,but as I received scholarship for my education that was not at all my problem.The problem was my own family members jealous attitudes which made them do all the worst to me stop my education and growth.But myself collecting every stone that they threw at me and successfully climbed those steps with the same stones they threw at me .

My father used to not take care of my mother and me.Even though I got a free seat in Engineering in a reputed college,it was not digestible my own family members who used to provide us food.They took us to the worst situation where we would do anything for money and at that moment they offered us a assistant Job and asked me to leave my education and do job.Otherwise they don't provide food or anything.That was the day where I have to decide,should I accept the job offer and make my living smoother or to reject the opportunity  and to stand on my own legs without depending on anyone.On that day I felt,If today I will put my head down,I have to do it for my life long.So,I rejected the offer,and said them that let it be if I don't have food also.i will starve and complete my education,but not accept that offer from you all.My decision has made them angry,they stopped talking to us,they stopped giving us basic needs.At that moment I was having a debt of 10k,no ways to pay that,thinking like that ,in my mind there stroked about tutions,searched but didn't find.Have too pay that debt,so wrote records of engineering students for 1 rupee per page.In all the leisure hours and after coming home from college.Have dinner and sit on that from 7.30 pm to night 1-2 am and used to give them.Like that in one month I wrote 7000 pages.But in that period even though if I have to go for share auto to my home from the college bus dropping point for 2.5kms.i used to go walking to save money.
name: Myself

description: Saalumarada Thimmakka, also known as Aalada Marada Timakka, is an Indian environmentalist from the state of Karnataka, noted for her work in planting and tending to 385 banyan trees along a four-kilometre stretch of highway between Hulikal and Kudur. She has also planted nearly 8000 other trees. Her story is that of grit and determination.[3] With the support of her husband, she found solace in planting trees. She received no formal education and worked as a casual laborer in a nearby quarry.[4][5] Her work has been honoured with the National Citizen's Award of India. Her work was recognized by the Government of India and she was conferred with Padma Shri in 2019.
name: Salu Maradha Thimmakka

description:
My mother is my favorite person in my life because I can talk to her about everything, she is very blunt, and she is also very dependable.
             I can talk to my mom about everything because she is the only person that I ever had that I can express myself to understand what I am saying and where I am coming from. I can talk to her about problems that I am having in my life and in school. I like talking to my mom because she always listens and gives me good advice. For example when I felt like quitting school because I was stressed out and felt like I wasn't getting anything accomplished she told me to just calm down. She also told me to stop worrying about things that are going on at home and stay focused on my work, because there is nothing I can do about things happening at home while I am down here in school. Another thing I can talk to my mother about is something that most men my age usually wouldn't talk to their mothers about which is, women problems. When I talk to her about my women problems, she always predicts what is going to happen. Whatever she says is going to happen, always happen. For instance when one of my girlfriends from back in the day was lying about something, my mother told me that if I was to just wait and ask her about it another time that her story would be different and all mixed up. It just so happens that it was true. I caught her in a lie and there was nothing that she could do about it but just sit there and look dumb. My mother also tells me what to do if a girl is acting a certain way and if she thinks it will work if I get in a relationship with the girl and why.
             Another reason why my mother is my favorite person is because she is very blunt. She says what she means and means what she says. She will always tell you how she truly feels and give her opinion about something if you ask her.
name: Savitri

But one of the main reason out of the hundreds i can say that inspires me the most is her will power. Even at the age of 50 she has been tirelessly working and providing for us to have a better life. And that inspires me to do better in my life, in my studies so that i can give her the life, the luxuries she deserves for being our rock for so long. It's time we give her back. 
Thankyou
name: Mrs Meena Sharma (my mother)

and got best outgoing student of our university named tamilnadu dr mgr medical university...and also got 5 gold medals under various names...we were frnds by end of final year...once we finish mbbs final year we need to undergo one year intrenship period which ll be hectic and 24x7.....so we joined intrenship and she used to do duty in hospital...for long hours and then go extra duty....then i description: Continuation from previous story-At that last moment when I want more 3000 rupees to pay my debt.i received scholarship for exam fees,I felt that I have one month time to pay my exam fee.i will plan something till that time,but now let me pay off my debt.Then one day stanging at my bus stop I taught,,to get my bus it's taking easing 1.5 hr- 2 hr.In this this time what can I do.Tutions stroked  my mind.Then I searched for home tutions got it.i used to go to college at morning 7.30am and return to my place bus stop at 6.45 pm .From they in 15 mins I used to go there say tution and then 8.30 pm I used to have another tution,but the place was 2.5 kms far from first tution .no bus route also..In half n hr I used to run instead of walking to reach my destination.By whatever money I got ,I used to run expenses in my home,but I was unable to get books stationery and all properly.So I used to go to library and read in college and make notes and come off.To study I used to travel to college for 2.5 hrs climbing 4 buses for 35 kms one way,study over there and return back.I used to go even in holidays as my sirs where so supportive they used to help me.Finally I got graduated from my college in first class and now I am a successful civil engineer.

description: I was once the woman who wants to fly but never had wings , I got my wings when I started believing in myself n my power of manifestation. I wanted to do some thing creative n wanted to contribute to society as well . I was 20 years old not even completed my graduation when I got married. More responsibilities involved when I got kid at the age of 22 . But I used to dream of doing something big n wanted to touch skies . In 2009 My kid was Juz one year old n i was so confused about my life that what job should I pick so that I can tke care of him as well, n that was the time when I started my first school n daycare . I was given very less money from the family saying I hve to manage n earn more n if I can’t , not even a penny extra vll b given then. So for me it was a challenge n a question of survival . I put all my efforts n worked so hard that even within 3 months not only break even , I touched the profit as well , then I never looked back n learned that v all have power to manifest what we want in life . Today I hve 6 branches of Thomas kids international. In 2015 I faced health issues because of my non healthy eating habits . I became overweight also. I overcome that also n took my physical fitness as a challenge again .Not only that I run marathons now n support many runs n NGOs today . I m a successful business entrepreneur n a runner n a mother of 12 years old kid at the age of 34 . I m a pinkathon ambassador n work with Milind Soman n spread awareness about breast cancer in women’s . On September 2 nd m going for Ladakh marathon, the worlds highest altitude run . I m super proud of myself n believe in my power of manifestation. I manage my business as well as my running involvements n serve my family n my kid as well n never miss on to gym for 2 hours every day . Now m not a fairy but m a dragon with wings n super powers .
name: Kajalsuri

description: The SMILE on HER face did not come easily. At the age of 36 with two loving kids she faced CA BREAST.
