description: This is my own story that is ispired me it's about my journey about my life .I am 28 years old girl and my story stared after graduation .after graduation I have no idea that what to do now because I have no support no guideness to do something because I belong from a village and my father was working in private sector as a boiler opreater and he was earning only 7 k or 8 k at that time and I am very embitious girl I want to do something to my family so I decide to do accountant course from bijnor but challenge was ,from where money will come,course fees was 48 k for 15 month and my room rent expenses also was there and I need to live alone in bijnor so I go with my father for this course and we talk for this and forse that person to take this money in installment that time was a very diffecult time for me and my father also to take risk I don't know that after  that course I will get job or not .so facing difficulties during course about money I completed my course my grandfather don't want that I do this course he was thinging about my marry.after the course I started to search job but I am getting only 3 k salary that was not enough to run the house .now what to do I was nothing that time mind was blank what will happen ahead i was seeing dark in my life .My conscience was asking me to do something.i decide to do mba but problem was same no money was there to do anything and how can I told to my father for this because I know the condition of my parents .but I need to do this course at any cost so I told to my mother ,mother was blank what to do.my father was working in Punjab at that time so I told to my father for going to management college about confirming the fees .per semester fees was 46 k.auuuuu I was shocked.i was crying what to do what to do .one more thing during my accountant course I  falled in love that time with a guy and that guy has ditched me. description:
What all difficulties and struggles she has raised her two Children.

She has born and bottom in conservative Sikh family.
Her parents married her a hard drinker and non earner person who has spoiled her life who had not took his responsibilities as a husband as a life partner.
When I was in her stomach, no food was available there to eat.
No body support her, not even family not even anybody. 
When she put her husband's from drain,  every person watched her but nobody support her. She cried every sec every day night as she couldn't sleep as her husband used to abused and shouted whole night. 

All she suffered but she never give up just coz of her children only. 

My mom always inspired me and my sister for progression in life after sudden death of my father in 2017. Despite all odds, she never let us have feeling that we lack anythng in life. Like an umbrella she always protected us from all evils and we owe to our mother if we are able to stand tall today in society. Salute to my mother. She never let us feel that our father isn't with us and guided us the best possible way always.. Always she lived a simple life and gave us all emenities of life. Her life is a message to all those who giveup in life and fear syruggle. Love you mother... God bless you...

description: When I see 2 years back my son was giving for his 10thICSE exam, younger was not well due to chickenpox. It was tuesdaynight  my husband came from office ate food n went to sleep as he had rushed for urgent meeting next morning.i thoght he was snoring but that was cardiac arrest. We rushed to hospital but attack was so severe that within fraction of seconds it happened. I was fully scattered, what I will tell to my motherinlaw who is 89 yrs old that her son who is always fit n fine is no   more. I came to house at 12 clock night told my motherinlaw n children that he is in ICU n feeling better. Full night myself n my sister was awake. We told all relatives not to come before my elderson goes for his final board exam. Morning time I told my son pappa always wanted you to do your best. He went for exam. I showed lot of patience n told my motherinlaw herson umesh is not with us but there are 2 umesh my 2 sons are with us. My son passed out with 97℅  n he secured 100/100 marks in paper which he gave next morning when his pappa passed away. I always tell my children n motherinlaw we cannot see pappa but he is always with us.

description:
In the 9 month of her pregnancy Sindhutai was thrown out from her home by her husband. She gave birth to her 4th child girl after 3 sons in a cow shelter.

When her mother refused to help her she started begging on railway platforms. The orphans children's on those platforms move to Sindhutai and then she decided to look after them.  And today's Sindhutai is affectionately known as a mother of orphans. She adopted and nurtured more than 1400 orphans and by doing her work she have been received 500 award of appreciation.

Sindhutai Sapkal called ‘Mai’, is a social worker in Maharasthra, India. She is a social activist who works  pationatly towards the welfare of orphaned children in India. Having built a grand family over the decades, she now has one thousand grandchildren who are offsprings of the children she had previously adopted! Most of her ‘children’ are doing very well in life- some are lawyers, some are doctors and so on. In fact, one of her children is pursuing a PhD on Sindhutai’s life. Some of them are even running their own independent orphanages, and proliferating her good deed and spirit. This holds true even for her biological daughter!
name: SINDHUTAI SAPKAL

description:
HER STORY

The world is full of opportunities and the one who grab it becomes winner. In our life we all get a chance to prove our self and that chance makes us shine. 

The above lines are applied to me as well, when I got that chance, I found myself independent & doing well in my life.

Some one has once well quoted that “ behind every successful man there is a woman behind rolling her eyes”, and I found myself lucky to have one such woman in my life who always supported me, guided me and helped me to sail through in all ups and down of my life and she is none other than my MOM.

She is the most bold, beautiful and intelligent lady behind me. She guides me in each and every step of my life. She became my friend when I was teenager and a guide when I was struggling in my life to settle my self. She made me comfortable in every stage of my life. She never judges me or misunderstands me.

Each one of us faces that phase of life when we found that all are friends are settled and doing well, and an unseen pressure is developed on us. This is the time where we need a support. At that time also she stood by me and helped me to become what I am today.

She is the lady of great will power and confidence. Throughout her life she had worked very hard to support our family. She stood like a pillar with my Dad . she is the one who first support me financially when I was  going to start my business and found lack of money. She gave me financial support and moral support too. Time to time  she guides me in my job  as she also belongs to the same field in her job profile, so you can also say professionally  I had chosen the same as business that was her working profile. There was a time when I was not doing good in my business. She gave me a great break through and I got a very good opportunity to develop my business. I grab it and after that there is no looking back in my life. 
She choose a very beautiful and intelligent life partner for me ( as I said her “mom life partner to
name: SMT. SANTOSH KUMARI SETHI

description:
Aneesha Modi ,a self taught prolific artist ..her journey from a housewife to a professional artist is an inspiration to all the woman & younger generation too
A lady with endurance, she proves that tough times don’t last , tough people do. 
Aneesha Modi is a hobbyist prolific artist who turned her hobby into profession. Her journey: A journey of an aam woman to a khaas life, aneesha modi is the founder of “aam e khaas” , an artistic platform where she curates her ideas into reality. Aam e khaas is the result of the time when she and her family had to start from square one. As life is a roller coaster ride, she had her share of ups and downs as well. But this lady, with all the courage, didn’t fall but bounced back even higher. She understood her responsibility of being a wife, a mother and a dog mom, she decided to share the workload & start working on a commercial upfront. Her husband was a little hesitant before but looking at her acceleration towards success, his claps were the loudest for her! Whilst working hard, she was constantly looking after her family as well. She started posting her work on facebook and started receiving a great response. She managed to create a niche for her products. She has been a one man army! From raw materials to dispatching, she did it all by herself. Her diligence made her win a lot of clients globally. Even media has also appreciated her a lot that has given her a rapid pace. She saved her earnings and let her daughter pursue IIT Coaching from Chandigarh & now she is proud iitian.She beams with pride whenever she shares her story from being an ordinary housewife to a professional artist.The strength of a woman is not measured by the impact that all her hardships in life have had on her but it is measured by the extent of her refusal to allow those hardships to dictate her & who she becomes. Aneesha Modi is the biggest example of this. Inspite of all the odds when she was left with nothing but only hope & courage, she stood up.
name: Myself..

description:
1977, she became the youngest ever Cabinet Minister in the Government of Haryana at 25 years of age.[36] In 1979, she became State President of Janata Party, Haryana State at the young age of 27. Sushma Swaraj was the first female Spokesperson of a national political party in India. She has many firsts to her credit as BJP's first female Chief Minister, Union Cabinet Minister, general secretary, Spokesperson, Leader of Opposition and Minister of External Affairs.[citation needed] She is the Indian Parliament's first and the only female MP honoured with the Outstanding Parliamentarian Award. She has contested 11 direct elections from four states. She has served as the President of the Hindi Sahitya Sammelan in Haryana for four years.[11]

On 19 February 2019 Swaraj accepted the prestigious Grand Cross of Order of Civil Merit, which was conferred by the Spanish government in recognition of India's support in evacuating its citizens from Nepal during the earthquake in 2015.[37]

Personal life

During the times of the Emergency, on 13 July 1975, Sushma Swaraj married Swaraj Kaushal, a peer and fellow advocate at the Supreme Court of India. The Emergency movement brought together the couple, who then teamed up for the defence of the socialist leader George Fernandes.[38][39] Swaraj Kaushal, a senior advocate of Supreme Court of India and a criminal lawyer, also served as Governor of Mizoram from 1990 to 1993. He was a member of parliament from 1998 to 2004.[40]

The couple have a daughter, Bansuri, who is a graduate from Oxford University and a Barrister at Law from Inner Temple.[41][42]

Sushma Swaraj's sister Vandana Sharma is an associate professor of political science in a government college for girls in Haryana.[43] Her brother Dr. Gulshan Sharma is an Ayurveda doctor based in Ambala.[44]

On 10 December 2016 she underwent a kidney transplant at AIIMS, Delhi with the organ being harvested from a living unrelated donor. The surgery was successful.[45]
name: Sushma Swaraj

description:
Fatima Agnela Graciana Justiana Fernandes is my mother and I inspire her the most for the following reasons:

1. She at the village level never gave up her fight in her daily life, protection of Bogmalo village, villagers and it's Beach.
2. Daily life: She being educated unemployed the going was always tough for the family. Latter when my Dada was suspended pending enquiry by person without designation /enquiry never conducted; as Accounts Manager from five star Beach resort for refusing to make illegal payments / wrongly accounting to politicians for Sea side illegal constructions, hill/tree cutting, sewage going to Sea etc. So as  a housewife with single earning member the going was smooth but for the last ten years it was hell in this inflatory world.

3. The challenge at the village was always tough as panchas/sarpanch, politicians and administrators were greedy for more money and we're always interested about their illegal well being. Mass felling of trees and cutting hills for illegal constructions in no development zone blocking access to the beach or paddy fields converted and high rise building permitted by turning a blind eye due to corruption. She approached various authorities including GCZMA and Hon'ble National Green Tribunal which gave it's direction to GCZMA to initiate action within three months some two years back, but GCZMA failed however to file contempt before Hon'ble National Green Tribunal was long for but avoided for want of money.

4. Bogmalo Beach was awarded a best Beach and Rs11/- posted stamp awarded on golden jubilee now destroyed inspite being declared a No development zone, it's access blocked by illegal constructions of shacks, bar & restaurants and guesthouses.

5. Bog means Bay and Malo means greenery, both on the verge of distinction, hills cut/ trees felled where will birds like peacock nest? or even leapords on hill side are trapped in cages, moon light shooting in sea; such is the greed of human destruction or even guesthouses
name: Fatima Agnela Graciana Justiana Fernandes

description:
Many women are absolutely phenomenal; but Nanda is the most important one. Now that I know her more, I continue to discover just how amazing she is. I refuse to find fault with this woman, because to me, she is the ultimate example of what a woman is. She never lectures, never moralizes, but instead she is a perfect example by the way she lives and the way she conducts herself throughout her life. She lives a life filled with integrity, with dignity, and with quiet wisdom. If she could only know that I hold her in the highest of esteem. And how much she means to me she would understand integrity, love and honor has changed my life. 
             The first time that I saw this question for this essay, one woman came to mind. As the answer Her name is Nanda and she truly is phenomenal. She was there for me when it felt like the rest of the world walked out and she continues to stand by my side through thick and thin. For that I am forever grateful. This definitely isn't the only thing that makes her phenomenal. I didn't meet her until way after all of my family problems happened. When she and I met I was 17 and I didn't think anything of her until I really started to talk to her. I am now 41 and she is 38 and she is and always will be my Guardian Angel. I honestly don't think that I would be the way I am today if it wasn't for her and here is why.
             I give credit to this woman in my life, which has taught me many lessons, but mostly through positive uplifting experiences. From these experiences Nanda has always been present, teaching me, giving me strength, courage and wisdom; encouraging me to be more, to strive harder, to have confidence and most importantly to seek divine knowledge and understanding. The woman who raised me never taught these teachings to me, so Nanda is the phenomenal woman in my life.
name: Nanda Puthran

description: My mother is a true inspiration for me. While she may not be my birth mom, but the way she cares for me is no less. Her tireless courage in the face of adversities teaches me that the night always passes and the sun comes up. Her grit and determination move me to never stop succeeding. She teaches me that failure is not when we fall, but when we don’t get up to overcome millions of other falls that will come our way. My mother may not have given me birth, but she gives me life by loving me with all her affection. No she’s not always appreciative of me and it’s hard to understand why, but finally I have understood that it is important to correct your loved ones when they are wrong, because love entails company not just when everything is going right, but also when the times are tough and you’re almost losing the fight. She’s beautiful inside out, and her kindness inspires me to strive to be a even as part as good as her. My heart goes out to all the mothers and fathers .
name: Santosh

My incredible mom beat cancer at the tender age of two; and despite being told by countless doctors she could surely never be pregnant, here I am, 23 and healthy!

Pregnancy for her body wasn't easy, but my amazing mother never complained. She has always taken life with so much joy and faith. Despite unfathomable health issues, my mother is so much more today: She is healthy, strong, independent, beautiful, loyal, hilarious, an awesome cook, a dog lover, a wonderful wife and the person I most strive to emulate.

She is the embodiment of resilience, and as I start to build my own life, I am incredibly confident knowing she is, and always will be, part of me.

description:
Above name mentioned is of my mom. She has inspired me in every single step of my life. I have grown so much inside and outside just by following on her examples. She lost her father when she was 2 years old. She didn't know what father love is. But i was fortunate enough for 18 years of my life. I lost my father when I just completed my 12th. Those recent few years were hard for me and my family as we all were very dependent on him. 
But my mother she took care of three families at that moment and her job simultaneously. Our own family, my nani ji family( since she is the only child) and my dadi ji's old home.. She handled it all. 
I don't have any idea how, but she did all she could do best and she did great.
In those tough times too, she never uttered a word that she is going through a lot. We three (my sister, my brother and me) we all have moved out to cities to pursue higher education or to work further as back there are not enough options to earn. She has been manging all of it alone there.
Whenever I have called her I only hear a firm and confident voice on phone no matter in how much pain she is in just so as that we do not take tension and concentrate more in our studies or our job. At harsh times like when I was searching for job and it was taking time, she motivated me enough to keep me going in the right direction and never settle for what is not worth the value. Whenever I think about it deeply, she never had too much happiness and yet she tries to stay calm and happy. Did not see father love, when it was time to enjoy life with husband she lost him as well nd now when she took retirement all her kids are out for jobs. AND YET SHE IS HAPPY AND CALM. 
So, if I have a mother so inspiring how can I stay down and not hussle with life. She is all what keeps me going in all situations. She has a kind heart, people still take advantage of that. She has always been nicer to everyone and even harsh to some who needs a dose. I only wish for her happines. d/o MOM
name: Sarita soel

description:
Vandana yadav born in a poor family on 12 dec 1994 . They were a family of 10 people living in a small room in a village. They were so poor that getting a single meal a day was a privilege for them.In order to make a living, her parents did part time jobs like maid. Though poor, her father wanted his children to be educated.
Her father also had a dream that she would become a great doctor and serve the poorest of society. This clearly shows that her father was a visionary who looked beyond his existing circumstances. Her mother sold milk and work in a farm to make their ends meet. She helped her mother at home.
Vandana is an excellent student but after the 12th standard she knew that her parents could not afford to fund her further studies. Her other siblings also needed to be educated.
One evening she heard her mother gave her gold ornaments even  mangalsutra to her father so that they could get a loan for her MBBS entrance exam at the Medical College. All these sacrifices had motivated her to do her best and live a life which would make her parents proud.As all her education was done in the Hindi medium, she was not able to cope up with her studies in the first year in medical college. The medium of learning was English and suddenly her mother lost eyesight and so she failed. But soon she took the help of her teachers and went on to become the rank holder of her university.
She is now a doctor in udaipur government hospital. She is loved by her patients, peers and her mentors. After a long fight , she fulfill the dream of mother but lost her mother in a accident.then she decided to do something for poor and talented children .she is planning for this.i am proud of her she is my cousin.
name: Vandana yadav

description:
In my childhood, I never thought that I become a nurse. But now when I’m looking back on my profession, I’m really proud of being a nurse. My aunt was a nurse she truly inspired me care and compassion to the patients were really touching.

When I was in school, I often visited the Government hospital were my aunt was working.

After my high school , I expressed my ambition to my aunt; her advice was “don’t consider nursing as a profession but consider as an occasion”. Whenever I’m in uniform I still consider this as an occasion for serving the suffering, and the satisfaction it gives to me is beyond all the monetary benefits. 

After I become an Nurse, I was a CCU nurse taking care of patients, which I truly love doing. It was challenging at times but very rewarding.  I love to help patients and their families. I love learning new techniques and procedures. I found that in nursing there is a door to learn something every day. Also my wife is working as nurse.
name: J.M Costa

description:
My mother is my greatest inspiration. The things which inspire me have been written in a way of poetry below.

She is 46 years old,
However, not so bold.
Having one makhan-chor
Whom she does not scold.

She does all home chores,
Cooking, stitching and many more. 
In her mind she has stored,
She has never been adored. 

It makes me weep when she is sad,
My goddess never thinks bad.

She wants a beautiful home,
With no affect of rain and storm. 
Sees the things she wants to buy,
No big home makes idea fly.

I always think what should I do,
Things for which mom feels blue.

With hardwork, I will make it true.
I will try and never skew.

It takes blood, sweat and tears,
But today, I have no fear.

It is do or die situation,
There must be no procrastination. 

As the time is running fast,
Makes my mind sometimes blast.

In this poem whatever I say,
I always think when I hit the hay.
name: Uma

description: Hansa is my wife. She is 65yrs. and I am 67yrs.We got married in the year 1978,28th of August. From the day one she has been with me all the times. In the late seventies (1977)I had a shampoo manufacturing unit in Ankleshwar GIDC. She used to assist me in all matters of business. In 1982 I met with a road accident and was completely on bed for 8 months. During the period she learned how to make shampoos from the home and started selling it from home.In the year 1985, I have to liquidate my factory due to financial crisis. As designing of furnitures is my hobby I started it professionally. During the transit period of business, she continued to make shampoos in bulk and selling it in parlours , saloons and also to individuals as our shampoos quality was very good. Thus she continued to make shampoos for about ten years together to support the family. We have two daughters both studying in Aux. Convent School. Hansa regularly seat with them for their study. Both the daughters are now married and have settled abroad. Through out these years she became my shadow and a very happy life we we were enjoying. In 2011 , 3rd of March early in the morning She had a brain streak, her left part of the body got peralysed. She got bed ridden. Till today and so on now I look after her.
name: Hansa Jayprakash Gandhi

description: Mother Teresa was a lady of great tenure who had spent her whole life in helping needy and poor people. She was born on 26th of August in 1910 in Macedonia. Her birth name was Agnes Gnocchi Bojaxhin. She was a lady with strong faith and trust in God and humanity. She had spent lots of time of her life in the church but she never thought that she would be a nun a day. She was a much disciplined woman who seeked God by helping poor and needy people. Each of her life activity was revolve around God. She was very close to the God and never missed prayer. She believed that prayer is very essential part of her life and spent hours in prayer. She was very faithful to the God. She was not had lots of money but she had attention, confidence, trust and energy which helped her to gladly support poor people. She walked barefoot for long distance on the streets to look after poor people. Hard and continuous work tired her lot however she never gave up.She was a lady who had inspired lots of people to do impossible works in their lives. She would always be an inspiration to us. This world is full of good people having great humanitarians but everyone needs an inspiration to go ahead. Mother Teresa was unique one who always stands out from the crowd.Mother Teresa was a very religious and famous woman who is also known as “Saint of the Gutters”. She is one the great personalities all over the world. She had represented her whole life in front of us as a true mother by providing kind services of full dedication and love to the needy and poor people of the Indian society. She is also popularly known as “saint of our times” or “angel” or “a beacon in the world of darkness”.
name: Mother theressa

description: Laxmi Agarwal was born and brought up in New Delhi. At the tender age of 15, she was attacked by one of the friends of his brother. The man named Naeem Khan was twice her age and kept on proposing her prior to the attack. As she had refused his advances and proposal, she was attacked by the man and his other two companions in the Tughlaq road. She was busy shopping near Khan Market while the accident had occurred. She was rescued by a taxi driver and was taken to the Safdarjang Hospital. She had nine major operations to reduce the pain of the burn. The last operation had sent her on ventilation for four long days. Yet, Laxmi had survived and become the hope of the all acid victims of the world.
name: Laxmi Agrwal

description:
1926-ஆம் ஆண்டு 43 நாடுகளின் பிரதிநிதிகள் கலந்து கொண்ட அகில உலகப் பெண்கள் மாநாடு, பிரான்சு நாட்டுத் தலைநகர் பாரீசில் நடைபெற்றது. அதில் இந்தியாவின் சார்பில் முத்துலட்சுமி ரெட்டி கலந்து கொண்டார். அப்போது அவர் நிகழ்த்திய சொற்பொழிவில், ஆண்களுக்கு நிகராகப் பெண்கள் முன்னேற வேண்டும். பெண்களை அடிமைகளாக நடத்தும் வழக்கம் ஒழிய வேண்டும் என்று வலியுறுத்தினார்.
இந்தியப் பெண்கள் சங்கத்தின் முதல் தலைவர் என்னும் பெருமையைப் பெற்றவர்.
சென்னை மாநகராட்சியின் முதல் துணை மேயர் என்னும் பெருமையும் இவருக்கு உண்டு.
அன்றைய சென்னை மாகாண சட்டசபைக்கு முத்துலட்சுமி தேர்ந்தெடுக்கப்பட்டார். அதன் மூலம் சட்டமன்றத்துக்குத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கப்பட்ட முதல் பெண்மணி என்ற பெருமை பெற்றார்.
1925-ஆம் ஆண்டு சட்டசபைத் துணைத்தலைவராகத் போட்டியின்றி தேர்ந்தெடுக்கப்பட்டார். இந்தப் பதவியில் இருந்த ஐந்தாண்டுளில் சில புரட்சி சட்டங்களைக் கொண்டு வந்து நிறைவேற்றினார். அவற்றில், தேவதாசி  முறை ஒழிப்பு, இருதார தடைச் சட்டம்,பெண்களுக்குச் சொத்துரிமை  வழங்கும் சட்டம், பால்ய விவாகங்களை தடை செய்யும் சட்டம் போன்ற சில குறிப்பிடத்தக்கவை.
அனாதையாக்கப்பட்ட குழந்தைகளை வளர்த்து அவர்களுக்கு நல்ல எதிர்காலத்தை உருவாக்க உருவானதே அவ்வை இல்லம் அடையாறில் அமைந்துள்ள இதனை அமைத்தவர் முத்துலட்சுமி. இதனால் டாக்டர் முத்துலட்சுமி ரெட்டி என் வாழ்நாளில் மறக்கமுடியாத பெண்மணி ஆவார்.
                                        இங்ஙனம்
                                 இரா.சதீஷ்குமார்

description:
My mother comes from the humblest of backgrounds. Her father was an alcoholic and a chain smoker and would beat her up on trivial reasons.
There were times when they had no food to eat. Once there were so many rats in their house, that one morning when she and her younger brother woke up, the rats had chewed away the sole of their feet completely.
Even after all of these problems, she played Volleyball at the state level and represented Uttar Pradesh (when it wasn't divided and hence was even bigger and therefore it was tougher to qualify)
She then came to Delhi all by herself, started working and also took a course to become a textile designer. She then started sending money home to her brothers and sister. Infact both her brothers were able to complete their Engineering and the sister her Phd.
Today she is a Textile Designer. She didn't just completed her education and good a job, she also fulfilled her dream.
She is the reason I feel like doing something everyday. Had it not been for her, I wouldn't have been able to take the plunge to start my own Startup
name: Seema Nigam

description:
I did my schooling from St. Joseph's Co-ed Bhopal and my Bachelor's from Sri Satya Sai College for Women's and while my Master's in Microbiology from Barkatullah University,  the election happened !

30th September 2017 was the day of Student Union Election of Barkatullah University by MP Government , the victory was bagged in my favour on the Banner of ABVP and got elected as Joint Secretary of Barkatullah University by 55 votes in 72 . The world seemed alot quite in that counting room as soon as the result got declared, while on our way from counting room  down the hall to the entrance of Department fire crackers made their way to our ears . Soon the Media group started there question answer round and finally while through all of it happened our neck went heavy with soo many garland of flowers ! Soon our rally started from Barkatullah University to ABVP State office and while all the way the real feeling of being a leader felt right there ! It was a huge responsibility , many expectations and implementations were to be made for the students of BU . We did and changed major issues of the University related to students . 
 Sooner everything changed from being just a regular M.sc Scholar to a Youth leader , we took the oth ceremony  and our office got alloted and round the bhopal across every College affiliated to BU , contacts grew eventually ! We had collaboration with so many NGO's , other college student Union's !
We Organized Events across bhopal in concern of Nation building , experienced Event Organizing to Rally Marching to facing Debates and being named as Spokesperson was something which I never even thought of . 
Election and being elected helped me develop my confidence in such a way that a year later today I realise that I have evolved soo much into such a better person.
Being called Influencial by the girls of bhopal gives so much of strength ! Women in politics is so much challenging yet the most adventurous position to hold onto .
name: I inspire myself to be more of my own higher version ! I have role models but I am my own Inspiration - SAKSHI BHARADWAJ

description:
1970 ஆம் ஆண்டுக்குள் இவர் சிறந்த சமூக சேவகர் எனவும், ஏழைகளுக்கும் ஆதரவற்றோருக்கும் பரிந்து பேசுபவர்  என்றும் உலகம் முழுவதும் புகழப்பட்டார். இதற்கு மேல்கம் முக்கெரிட்ஜ் என்பவரின் சம்திங்க் பியுடிபுல் ஃபார் காட் என்ற ஆவணப்படம் ஒரு முக்கிய காரணமாகும். இவர் 1979 இல் அமைதிக்கான நோபல் பரிசினையும், 1980 இல் இந்தியாவின் சிறந்த குடிமக்கள் விருதான பாரத ரத்னா  விருதினையும் பெற்றார். அன்னை தெரேசாவின் பிறர் அன்பின் பணியாளர் சபை அவரது இறப்பின் போது 123 நாடுகளில் 610 தொண்டு நிறுவனங்களை இயக்கிக்கொண்டிருந்தது. இதில் எய்ட்ஸ், தொழு நோய் மற்றும் காசநோயால்  பாதிக்கப்பட்டவர்களுக்கான நல்வாழ்வு மையங்கள், இலவச உணவு வழங்குமிடங்கள், குழந்தைகள் மற்றும் குடும்பத்திற்கான ஆலோசனைத் திட்டங்கள், அனாதை இல்லங்கள், பள்ளிக்கூடங்கள் ஆகியவை அடங்கும்.

பல்வேறு நபர்கள், அரசுகள் மற்றும் அமைப்புகளெனப் பலர் இவரைப் புகழ்ந்து வந்தாலும், பலவிதமான விமர்சனங்களையும் இவர் சந்தித்தார். இத்தகைய விமர்சனங்கள் கிறித்தபர் ஃகிச்சின்சு, மைக்கேல் பேரன்டி, அரூப் சட்டர்ஜி போன்ற நபர்களாலும் விஸ்வ ஹிந்து பரிஷத் போன்ற அமைப்புகளாலும் சாட்டப்பட்டது. இவர்கள் அன்னை தெரேசாவின் உறுதியான கருக்கலைப்பு எதிர்ப்பு நிலையையும், ஏழ்மை தரும் ஆன்மீக மேன்மையின் மீது அவர் கொண்டிருந்த நம்பிக்கையையும், இறப்பின் வாயிலிலிருப்போருக்கு அவர் ஞானஸ்நானம் அளிக்கிறார் எனவும் குற்றம் சாட்டினர். சில செய்தி ஊடகங்கள் அவரது நல்வாழ்வு மையங்களின் மருத்துவ வசதித் தரத்தைப் பற்றி விமர்சிப்பனவாகவும், நன்கொடைப் பணம் செலவு செய்யப்படுவதின் விதத்தைப் பற்றிக் கவலை எழுப்பியும் செய்திகளை வெளியிட்டன.[2]

இவரின் இறப்புக்குப் பின் திருத்தந்தை இரண்டாம் அருள் சின்னப்பரால் முக்திபேறு அடைந்தவராக அறிவிக்கப்பட்டு கொல்கத்தாவின் அருளாளர் தெரேசா  என்று பட்டம் சூட்டப்பட்டார்.
name: அன்னை தெரசா

description:
The lucky women name is moumita who make me to run my life smoothly,She motivates me in worst situations while I was unable to do anything and I was completely bed ridden.i was doing b.tech and suddenly arthritis attack make me bed ridden,my body most of joint had  severe pain and swelling unable to do anything,and exam was near.collecting notes from friends and teachers .stand for me,daily morning and evening she teaches me and make my confidence high that I can walk and write exam.her boost up given confidence and I wrote all exam.and I got  good marks.Before college administrators not allowed due to lack of attendance she fighted and got permission from higher team every body my colleague teacher appreciate her.there was no hope but she has confidence and she proved due to that I got timely degree and even got job ,joined Gammon India limited I.e started my career.otherwise the moment and such kind of arthritis disease stopped my life.
Her stand make my life.i am so lucky that now she is my life partners.i don’t have any word which fulfill thanks.
name: Moumita ghosh

description: My mother's name was Mani Devi. She left us for the heavenly abode when I was only 11. But for whatever time she was with me she taught me a lot of things including cooking, stitching beautifully, knitting, the essence of behaving courteously; a trait that's very difficult to find these days; to keep your house in order. She taught me things that were unimaginable for a 11 year old. Perhaps, she knew she had less time with me. But she has given me so much in so less time that I am n shall forever be grateful to her. I am a homemaker now and believe me a very good one at that and it's only because of my mother and the values that she has imbibed in me. Thank u maa!!
name: Mani Devi

description:
My Aunt  Mother Susan Kuruvilla  was a stigmata nun (had the five crucifixion  wounds of Jesus)  She had dedicated her life to Christ  and  served  the poor  and the needy in His name. 
She was really a blessing to them.Mother healed the sick with her prayers .She cared for and helped the poor and the needy a with so much divine love and kindness... in a small village in Mulanthuruthy near Kochi  where she had set up her ashram..Mar Gregorios Ashram .  Here she provided shelter, food, clothing, medical care  and education  to countless orphans ,widows , destitutes  and the mentally  and physically handicapped  .
 Little known to the outside world ..my aunt was a true believer of  God, full of humility compassion and kindness.  
Wanting  nothing for herself  but giving so much to others  she was the epitome of unconditional love and  humanity .  A tough example  to follow..she really inspired me . .
  I thank God  for  her divine life with us.  May her soul rest in peace   ...she will be missed dearly and will live in our hearts forever
name: Mother  Susan kuruvilla

description: Falguni, my wife, since we met, her attitude to never give up at any point in life on any matter inspires me a lot. Her this attitude helps me in every day to day activities to go for it with a full heart, high on energy without the expectations of the results. description:
Love is not what you say ,love is what you do !!!
Every day and night I dreamt of a prince charm who would come and take away all my problems from my pocket and put them in his own.Life seemed like a fairy tale for me ,my only goal in life was to find a prince .One day I met a guy ,I met him twice thrice the guy started smiling looking at me .Few days later I too started smiling looking at him.Then I dreamt about him,finally I realised that he is my Prince Charming I fell in love !!!Our meetings ,talkings ,fun,laughing went on for months .one final day even he realised that he is falling in love with me!!that day was his birthday and he proposed me . I was on cloud nine I felt like the queen of the world .We decided to marry we convinced our parents everything went well .Later on the day of marriage I got ready like a queen I was just dreaming about him to come on a white horse and take away his princess .Everyone in home were praying for my happiness on this day .I was still waiting for him everyone were waiting for him to come .Then came a heart touching moment !he came yes he came but covered by my country’s flag!!!!!!covered in the tricolours of our flag!!!Yes guys he came he came back but his body was covered by my flag!!!he was shot dead in the borders of our country !!That day I was dumbstruck but I saluted his love for the country where he sacrificed his everything.I will still dream about him to come in a white horse .He changed my life .He taught me love is not what you tell ,love is what you do! He did!!love him always .Jay hind!!!
name: Ayesha

description: Mother Teresa inspires everyone one of us today by her spirit of self sacrifice and her sheer goodness of spirit. She always used to say that her work was inspired by God . She lead by example, cleaning sores, wounds by herself and help the poor by living among them herself. In her own words, the hungry, the homeless, the crippled, the blind, the lepers, all those who were unwanted, unloved and uncared for throughout society and shunned by everyone found a place in her heart and her life. Her Nirmal Hruday and Missionaries of Charity continue her good work even today. All the awards and the Nobel Peace Prize are not adequate thanks for her sacrifice. She continues to inspire us even today and epitomises the spirit and maternal  compassion of glorious womanhood

description:
The never say die attitude my mother-in-law.  Married and widowed within two years of her marriage she was left with a girl child with none to support. With no family members to take care of them, she looked for her mother for support. However the condition presented another challenge. Her mother was short of eyesight and her father not mentally sound .To add to the woes her elder sister had also lost her husband and returned back with two young kids, and another  sister also separated with two kids. The family went through untold suffering , living on borrowed food, in a small space. Inspite of all the hardship, her never say die attitude prevailed. She took the initiative to start a food delivery service to few people.  She had to do cooking to delivery service, all by herself with young girl child in her hips all through. The only thing which kept her going , as she recalls was the words of support her blind mother provided, She supported both her elder sisters and even managed to send their children to school. Over the years, she started providing employment to others, bought the place which she had rented to run her business and married off her child. When everthing seemed settled, lightning struck second time, this time in the form of Tuberculosis, which made her bedridden and it was doubtful if she would recover ever. She underwent back bone replacement, came back strongly due to her pure will power and now continues to run her business successfully. 
She is the live example who is a real source of inspiration for her positive approach towards life. She always reminds me that it is the attitude which define us, and determines how we face our problem . Human life is not one to be bogged down, rather the hope for better tomorrow is that keeps us working all the time. What more inspiration can one ask for from the people whom we see in our daily life. She inspires us to fly just like the butterfly, w
name: Santhi CN

description: The first woman IPS officer of India, an inspiring role model, a Ramon Magsaysay awardee Kiran Bedi has a powerful influence on my life. Two beliefs of her which always give me courage. Life is always on incline way- It either goes up or down. 100 things happen in life- 99% things are your own creations. If good happens enjoy and if bad happens learn from them. 1 % things are beyond your control and you can’t do anything about it like natural calamities, death of your near ones etc. Only you can respond to such situations with all the courage stored in you with no place for fear. The iron lady, who joined Indian Police as a tough woman, a woman with infantile stamina. For her, police stood for power to correct instead of power to punish and believed in equal policing despite of all men around her. It was first and the last time when the Prime Minister of India was given a parking ticket. She denied self-glorification by refusing Asian Jyoti award as it was not for her whole traffic unit. The rule was simple-pro justice because of which she was sent to indiscreet postings where others would say ‘No’. She was sent to prison assignment, was a den of criminals-10000 men to 400 women to lock her thinking as there will be no car and no parking tickets to vips or ministers. She never complained about anything what was left over by the officers earlier in Tihar jail or in other postings of her. She started education and meditation in prison and converted prison to ashram and was instrumental in introducing prison reforms. A beginning of a bigger change.  Change is never easy and full of challenges and when those moments pass, we discover the hidden strength that exists in each of us. She is currently into movements of education and anti -corruption. I take this platform to thank you for being there without knowing how you are still changing my life and Celebrate HER in every woman who gets inspired by such persona even if it means that you are the only woman doing it.
name: Kiran Bedi

description:
This is a rare story about a husband being truly inspired from his wife. But I truly am inspired by her!
My wife Richa is a clinical psychologist qualified from Delhi university. Clinical psychology was then, not a popular degree & hence she had decided to be a homemaker years back.
Not sure, but probably I started undermining her role as a homemaker & hence pushed her to work in a nearby school. While she worked at school for 2 years, her heart was never there in the school job as she could not put her clinical psychology degree & counselling skill set to proper use. Her dislike for school job was further aggravated with long working hours, young child & household work.
Richa suggested me that she should start her own psychology practice but dint get enough support from my end. Fortunately, Richa did not listen to me & decided to go ahead with her dreams and started her own practice. She managed everything with her own finances & contacts. As I could not contribute much to her cause, in fact I initially discouraged her, Richa took every step on her own. She set her clinic, struggled, single handedly and courageously kept moving ahead. Determined she was !
Today, after years of successful practise she has carved a niche for herself as a psychologist & marriage counsellor. She is counselling her clients who are struggling in different streams of her life. She helps people who have lost all hopes. Her counselling has saved many marriages and have helped many people recover from utmost depression. People who have taken her counselling sessions rave about her & say that her counselling sessions have been life changing experiences for them. 
She is TRULLY making a difference & contributing to the society. I am so proud & inspired by her.
She was also felicitated with prestigious Devi awards’16 @ Hyderabad by Shri Venkaiah Naidu, current Vice President. Devi awards recognises & awards exceptional women across the country who display dynamism & innovation in their work.
name: Richa Khetawat

description:
It was half past four - a cold January morning - even the sun had decided to sleep in - but it was another glorious busy morning for this middle-aged, white-haired woman. She woke up briskly, did her morning activities, tied a soft cotton saree and bustled outside to clean and water the front-area of the home, put kolam and hurry back inside with the milk-packet. She warmed the milk and with the aroma of hot filter coffee in the air, she went back to the bedroom and with her gentle hands on my forehead and a soft voice ... she said ‘coffee is ready. Get up. You said you have to study’. This is how I  remember being woken up until my 12th grade...then in 12th grade she fell really sick - cancer took over and my Mom left - never to come back again. Life changed for me ... I got busy being young. 
Now at 40, when I look back... what she said and did not say... the way she was... has inspired me in ways unimaginable. She was married young to my dad and had not completed her 8th grade. But she fit into the family and took care of all of my dad’s brothers and sisters. She bore 5 daughters and ensured all 5 got educated and became independent. She always said- ‘you girls study and make your father proud. I will take care of the cooking and cleaning’. The house was always a home - clean, vibrant, warm food ...
Every evening at around 9:00 pm she would wait outside for my dad because that was when he would get back home from office. She would serve him food and then only rest for the day. Never have I seen her fight with him or raise her voice. They must have had their moments ... but none of us children had to ever witness that. My dad was not a business man ... nor was he very rich. But there was always enough at home and my mom never complained. 
All her life - she gave to others what she never could have. Years later - - The warmth of her embrace still lingers....and she is MY inspiration - today and everyday.
name: Chandra

description:
My inspiration is Mother Teresa. The beauty of Mother Teresa is her power of love, unconditional love. She was a messenger who always had something to teach others, not through sermons but through compassion and mercy.

   One of the things that immediately inspired me about Mother Teresa was her ability to put her trust in God’s call for her. Mother Teresa never questioned what God wanted her to do. In an article about her called I Thirst, Mother Teresa explained her call to serve the poor by saying, “the message was quite clear. I was to leave the convent and consecrate myself completely to help the poor and live among them. It was an order. I knew where I belonged, but I did not know how to get there.” As soon as God spoke to her, she was willing to follow his call. I don’t think I could so blindly follow God’s call, especially if it called me to leave the comfort of my home or in her situation the Loretta Sister’s Convent. Not only was Mother Teresa willing to leave her home, but she left without having anywhere to go, another thing that I don’t have enough bravery to do. I was inspired by Mother Teresa willingness to follow God’s call, even though she didn’t have a clear path laid out for her.

  Mother Teresa’s service to the poor and dying in Calcutta drew many of the students taught by the Loretta Sister to join her in service. Mother Teresa didn’t advertise or work to convince people to follow what she did, but through her actions, she inspired people to follow God’s call.
name: Mother Teresa

description:
Mother Teresa-born on Aug 26, 1910. Yes, today is her birthday & I take pleasure in writing about this motherly figure on her birthday. Her birthday is debateable as for some its 26th & for some it's on 27th. Nevertheles, she shares her birthday with my grandmother, if on 26th Aug & my mother if on 27th Aug. So she is close to my heart and a mother due to her kindness to the needy; shown in the way she devoted her life to caring for the poor indian kids suffering from leprocy and tuberculosis as if they were her own. At age 12 she had a calling from God & joined the church. At the age of 18 she left home for a few months' training in Dublin and came to India to teach at St.Mary’s High School Calcutta, but the suffering she saw made an impact on her and she had a 2nd calling from God to help the needy & she left her job to devote herself to the poor to start an open air school. I got inspired from her & got Masters in Teaching from USA. I volunteered in a shelter in NYC and cared for the children there like my own. I also taught in kindergarten and in 
high schools after which i came back to India and joined a rotract club to help the poor, organised eye camps & visited old age homes & orphanages. I volunteered in foundations to teach kids soul songs, fed them, organised health camps and took kids to hospitals for treatment in Hernia, Anemia, Aids etc. I later joined a Cancer foundation for Children where we funded hospitals towards cancer. We distributed spiritual books for kids so their faith in a super power increased and learnt about the souls journey to a higher kingdom which rekindled a hope for a better life. Mother Teresa's Divine confidence and calling and my divine confidence and calling are similar. Recently I taught Yoga in ashrams for children and teachers which gave me a sense of satisfaction so that they can stay healthy. When they learn how to connect to a super power within themselves by yoga & pranayam there wiill be lesser chances of diseases.
name: Mother Teresa

description: Continued. Needless to say donating food to various ashrams and in schools for the poor also gives immense joy. The feeling of appreciation and the satisfaction it gives them knows no bounds. This is just the start. I thank Mother Teresa for teaching me how to lead a life. She have left her body on World Teachers day, 5th September 1997 and have taught me an enormous teaching lesson for a lifetime. I cherish her incomparable work towards humanity. I wish I can continue to do some good work and establish something great for the less privileged
name: Mother Teresa

description:
If I have to describe about the person who inspires me I feel it should be from heart and someone whom I have been close and personal to get an inspiration from she’s no famous personality but my mother my real life role model, my inspiration, my motivation . If I call her the way of living, it won’t be wrong. The word mother and all we can associate it with is love , care , warmth and selfless love . Coming from a joint family , different people along with different mindset and opinions with a lot more responsibilities . In every situation I found her smiling and telling me responsibilities won’t change all that is in your hand is your attitude towards them, so why not perform them happily it will make your job more easier. She was loved by all, that selfless love inspires me.
28th November, 2013 was the day when her reports came and she was detected with ovarian cancer. In shock and grief and more of a fear since I had lost my grandfather too fighting the same disease few years earlier but her smile and her same confidence that whatever it is I am going to love and live each day with a smile kept us hopeful. 21 chemotherapy, surgery and each passing day more challenges but she was strong telling the oncologist she can take the 22nd chemo too, the pain she had gone through and the courage she had were both high.
Whenever she visited the oncologist there were patients sitting outside with a tired look and sometimes teary eyes , going through the same she used to motivate them talk to them speaking only positive things with a message that cancer is not an end .
After two years of treatment there was a day when the reports were normal, the day we laughed , celebrated specially my father who must have not even had a sound sleep in those two years was relieved. We started living once again had it not been for mom’s courage and determination. After 6 months it relapsed and we lost her but her strength is alive in our hearts that is the reason she is my inspiration.
name: Farzana Siddiqui

description:
A Lady With Will Power As Strong As Iron From A Lower Middle Class Family First Raised and Settled Her 7 Sibilings and even after being Married At A Young Age , Single Handedly Raised 4 Daughters and 1 Son of her own.Life was toughest but the Bricks and Stones that the world threw , she gathered them all and build her Castle. Medically Challenged and Being Operated in her early 30's for lung disease and surviving on one lung , faced a lot of hardships but never gave up.
My mother is a true inspiration of how hardwork and gratitude never fail you.
If it was not for her will power and hardwork today our full family of 50+ Individuals would have been struggling to have a stable life.
We love , respect and admire her for her faith and never giving up spirit.
She deserves every happiness and a relaxing break in this world at this stage when she is taking slow retirement from all the household and family responsibilities.
name: Munira Patni

description:
Kalpana chawla, the first Indian woman astronaut who stepped in space, was one of the seven astronauts who lost their life in Space Shuttle Columbia disaster on February 1, 2003. Her first space began in 1997. The very first Indian woman and second Indian person to fly in space after Rakesh Sharma. In 2000, again she got selected for her second flight which delayed due to some conflicts and technical reasons. In 2003, she took her second fly with her other six crew members but unfortunately she got killed in Space Shuttle Columbia disaster with the other six members. We lost a great woman who was full of spirit, she died like a hero, who is still alive in all of our hearts.

A role model for many young woman in India & around the world. Belonging from a small town, a bag full of big dreams within it. She took step and fought hard against various rules set by society to change her dreams into reality.
She is the best example for all those young women who want to pursue their dreams but due to some circumstances either it can be, society, parents, lack of confidence, a fear to be unsuccessful etc, stops to follow your dreams. But in my opinion we should never hesitate to speak all about instead of keeping the things in yourself.

Her persistent motivation booster was her parents. Her parents never forced her to come back and settle down in India. They kept on motivating and praising her throughout the journey of her life. The fact is, as when your parents start supporting your dreams, then half of the path seems like you have already crossed.

We all should learn & push yourself for getting successful in achieving goals like her.

A very inspiring message from her to all the parents “ Never underestimate a daughter, who knows, if your daughter can also become another Kalpana Chawla”. A great inspiration to all the ladies, and a salute to all the parents who support their daughter, to follow her dreams, keep her motivating, help he
name: Kalpana Chawla

description:
Well, The question will be why?
I belong from a very conservative family. Family so orthodox that even returning home at 6.30 in eve was a sin.
I fought for my rights and dreams of other similar girls who really want to do something of their own. 
I have always been a shield to the girls in Katni (Place where I belong to).  Taken a step and fought to go out for bachelors. Fought to further go to Pune for Masters. Not only this, I fought to work and make my own stand.
Today, I am at position, that people give my reference in Katni and send their daughters out to become educated and successful.
.
.
Seen lot of mothers crying out of happiness and thanking me as their daughters now stand head holding high!
 I have always believed in saying -Try, Try, Try, till you succeed and followed the same blindly.
I am happy I took that step and would be grateful to god for leading me towards that direction.

Hope my story really inspires every small town girl to achieve big dreams.
- Julie

description:
Holding a MCA degree from Nagpur University, Jayanti Kathale came to Bangalore in 2004 to work for Bristlecone. Always in pursuit of implementing her business ideas, Jayanti started selling home made 'modaks' via the then popular social networking platform 'Orkut'. Word had started to get out, but destiny had different plans for her. She had to move to Australia as her husband got transferred onshore. However, this didn't deter her from making homemade Indian cuisines for their new friends there. After returning to India, she had a baby and joined Infosys as a Technology Lead. Within a span of 2 years, she got promoted to the position of a Project Manager. Jayanti had over the years built a strong profile in key technology areas such as Microsoft XAML, C#, Windows 8 App Development, .NET, Silverlight, SQL Server and Oracle.

During this time, she had started developing her catering business as well. Demand for freshly prepared, delicious, home-cooked food always seemed to pick up during festival times like Holi and Diwali. Years of serving food had made Jayanti realise that people who stay away from their families, always craved for access to traditional food.

They received from their company to add to their funds to start PurnaBramha - an authentic Maharashtrian restaurant in Bangalore. They fetched a cook from their native place and set up the restaurant in HSR layout.
They had started off with the idea to not just introduce the highly nutritious Maharashtra cuisine to their non-Maharashtrian brethren, but to also deliver a truly cultural ambience with endearing customer service. They believe their USP lies in their subtle variety and strong flavours and hope to treat thousands with the legendary hospitality that the Maharashtrian community takes pride in.

With a staff of 40+, Jayanti and her team aim to open 5000 centers across the globe.
She takes pride in women leadership and has maintained a 50% staff of women at her restaurant.
name: JAYANTI KATHALE MAA'M

description: In July 2018, Karmakar became the first Indian gymnast to win a gold medal at a global event, when she finished first in the vault event of the FIG Artistic Gymnastics World Challenge Cup at Mersin, Turkey. Karmakar is one of the only five women who have successfully landed the Produnova, which is regarded as the most difficult vault currently performed in women's gymnastics. It is so remarkable achievement where country like India who does not provide proper infrastructure to execute this sport. she not only won but also made country proud.  she inspired me in my day to day life that even when you dont have best of facility one can still thrive for excellence and achieve. She is talented and changed my point of view towards life.

description:
Sindhutai is a renowned and a devoted social worker who focuses on prioritizing the lives of orphaned children. Her decision to look after orphaned children was triggered by her own life experiences. During her childhood Sindhutai went through phases where she missed having someone by her side.
Sindhutai’s entire life inspires me because she has shown how adversity brings out the best in us and dedicated her life to adopting & nurturing orphans. Further, she constructed more than six orphanages in Maharashtra where orphaned children are given food, shelter, and education. Her organization also gave shelter to numerous women, who are destitute and abandoned.
In 42 years she has raised about 1,200 children. Her inspiring journey shows that for a committed individual nothing is impossible. Sindhutai is an epitome of Humanity. From being a deprived wife to begging on the streets, she has now become a ‘Mother of orphans and helpless’ children. Even at 70 she has the same drive to do something good for society.
Many of her adopted children are now highly qualified for e.g. doctors and lawyers. Some adopted children have started orphanages of their own.
name: Sindhutai Sakpal

Married to Prince Charles in 1981, she received the title of “Her Royal Highness Princess Diana of Wales” She is the Mother of Prince William and Prince Harry 2nd and 3rd in line to the throne respectively. Pavithra Kakani , a dynamic young women entrepreneur, who is Co-Founder & MD, GTS- Glocal Technology Solutions( IT&ITES), Amaravati  a pioneer in Amaravati region , for investing in regional start ups based on food-and agro tech, AI-IOT Technologies,  E commerce based fashion and Online equipment service portal.
She is member , CII and chair of Swachh Bharat initiative of CII-Yi (Confederation of Indian Industry-Young Indians) .  
Pavithra is instrumental in being the Co-Founder &  MD, ABC- Amaravati Boating Club India Pvt Ltd  – A  PPP venture with Govt of AP in tourism. Within a short span of under three years, she has made the company a national one by expanding its operations to Orissa also. ABC now is in PPP with Orissa Tourism Dev Corp,  and APTDC- Andhra Pradesh Tourism Dev Corp.
Her passion in food and beverage industry, made her as  Co-Founder & MD, of “Dosa King” , at Padmavati Ghat, Vij franchisee provider, All India . Within a short span of 6 months, it was made as a statewide franchise with its second branch at Tadepalli, Guntur Dist.
Pavithra is also a “Scoops” Icecreams and Desserts Franchisee Holder at Punnami Ghat, Vijayawada
She is Partner -“Amaravati Café” at Bhavani Island , Vijayawada
Innovativeness is a keen aspect in her which propels me to nominate her for the Yes bank “Celebrate Her “ award. She is “Telugu Book of Records” holder for being part of the World’s first floating studio (Flodio) in collaboration with Mahaa News Channel
She is also Angel Investor, Start up Mentor- Partner- Vijayawada Angels through GTS
On the CSR front , she is “Smart Village Partner” of  - Racharla Village, West Godavari Dt. When we get married we enter in a new phase of life that is totally different from our past. We accept the new life with a smile, we respect elders, love youngers and everyone in the family. If we are working we work at home as well as office. I am married to an upper middle class family 
and I personally give my salary to my inlaws which I am not required to but as a gesture of respect and responsibility I do so. I do household chores also. My mother is 10th pass. She wanted us to do higher studies so that we would be able to achieve something and live life happily as we dont know what comes in the future. I manage both, home and office and have a loving husband too. There are many women who live the same life as I live but they are not considered, never appreciated. I think that every women's life should be appreciated who makes others lives easy..
Thanks

It takes nerves of steel to be an inspiration to others .  Jyoti Bawa resident of Amritsar,Punjab is a widow running an organisation Punjabi Samvad for the development of women and children. Her husband died because of brain tumor  . Though she started her journey of social activist with him but realised the true meaning after he expired.She is today motivating all single mothers not to make sympathy as their weapon but learn to admire the beauty of life that's waiting for you .She built this NGO all alone by indulging into research and studies and want to inspire women through out the world. She wants them to come out of helpless mode and believe themself to be the biggest strength .With this she is currently educating more than 40 children and fortunately has been a part of world Punjabi conference ,Canada .Moreover she is qorking on social issues such as female foeticide ,drug aadiction ,gender equality acid attack and many others.She has written number of plays to spread awareness and has even launched a documentary against drugs .
If she receives the award will be able to encourage more and more individuals and will  initiate a thought of humanity in the society

description: I celebrate her every moment of my life! My mother, Chandralekha, who passed on in 2014 due to diabetic complications. She is my hero and my guiding light! The earliest memory I have of her is when me and my twin suckled on her breasts as babies! Our life flowed from her. From that memory as babies, over the next four decades, life with her has been a remarkable journey, a tapestry of overflowing love, nurture, correction, example, sacrifice, excellence, multitasking, and inspiration. She departed like a queen! Her death was a celebration of her life! Her beautiful memory is a celebration of her living that was pure and wonderful. Her life is an ode to motherhood and I’m proud and honoured to be her son! Love you Ma, miss you every second of my life!
name: Chandralekha

description: She is my ex girlfriend. It was 3 years back. when i was struggling to choose my career.  After my schooling, i stepped into Engineering, Everyone in family and relatives suggested so i went for it. Slowly i realised this is what i belongs to. i suppose be to somewhere else.  i always had a hobby of taking pictures on my phone and whatever camera i get.  So gradually i thought i should focus on photography, and i bought i camera. And then one day, I got to know about a online fillmaking completion which was held by YES BANK only.  I was supposed to make a short film within 48hours. I took that challenge and started filming by my own. after shooting when i sat for the editing, i got to know that I've not got the enought clips to make a story i already thought. and it was already late to shoot more there were just few hours left for submission. Then i thought lets not do this. maybe next time, i lost all the hopes. and Then This girl. Prachii gave me motivation to not to loose hope and do it anyhow, no matter what footage you've got just make something out of it. I still didn't want to do it, but her words made me work on the video again. i started again and i somehow manage to submit the video at the last moment. Though it was not a good film,  i didn't get any reward or anything, but making that film first time  was itself an achievement for me. And from that day i decided, i should seek my career into videos only.  & now I'm working as a cinematographer done some good international projects too.  No matter what, she will be always my inspiration. I'm here today is just because of her.
name: Prachi

description: कर्म ही पूजा- एक वृद्ध महिला हमारी कॉलोनी में सफाई का कार्य किया करती थी। वह सदा ही चिंतित व खोई सी रहती थी। जिस कारण सफाई भी उचित प्रकार से नहीं कर पाती थी। यदि कोई सफाई के विषय में उससे कुछ कहता तो लड़ने लगती। नतीजा यह हुआ कि बिल्डिंग में गंदगी बढ़ने लगी। एक दिन वह मेरे घर के सामने से कूड़ा उठा रही थी। उसके चेहरे से दुख, चिंता व क्रोध झलक रहा था। अनायास ही मैं पूछ बैठी- अम्मा कैसी हो? वह विफर पड़ी और बोली- मेरा भाग्य ही फूटा है और रोने लगी । उसकी निराशा दूर करने के लिए मैंने सहानुभूति दिखाते हुए उससे कहा- अपनी परेशानी बताओ, शायद कुछ हल निकल आए । वह बोली- इकलौता बेटा है । विवाह के पश्चात बेटा, बहू की बातों में आ गया । दोनों मिलकर बहुत दुख देते हैं । कई-कई दिन बीत जाते हैं, खाना पीना भी नहीं देते ।  मैंने उसे बैठाकर चाय के साथ कुछ खाने को दिया ।  मैंने उसे समझाते हुए कहा- तुम्हें तो भगवान का धन्यवाद करना चाहिए, उसने तुम्हें स्वस्थ शरीर व मस्तिष्क दिया है और उससे बढ़कर नौकरी दी है। ईश्वर की कृतज्ञता व्यक्त करते हुए प्रत्येक कार्य ईश्वर का समझते हुए उसी को समर्पित कर दो ।  जैसे सफाई ईश्वर के लिए कर रही हो ।  इस प्रकार  शांतचित्त्त्त  से किया हुआ कार्य अच्छा होगा और बोझ नहीं लगेगा ।  सबके साथ व्यवहार व संबंध भी अच्छा हो जाएगा । इस घटना के कुछ दिन पश्चात मैंने उसमें अभूतपूर्व परिवर्तन महसूस किया । वह प्रसन्न मुद्रा में शांत चित्त होकर बहुत ही लगन ईश्वर का नाम लेते हुए कार्य में तल्लीन थी ।  उसकी लगन व मेहनत से  बिल्डिंग साफ-सुथरी हो गई थी और सभी के साथ उसका व्यवहार भी आत्मीय हो गया था । मैंने जब उससे पूछा- अम्मा कैसी हो? तो बोल उठी ईश्वर की कृपा है, बेटे-बहू के साथ शांति से जीवन बिता रही हूं । उसके इस परिवर्तन को देखकर मैं अभीभूत हो गई कि एक दुखी व निर्धन महिला में ईश्वर के प्रति समर्पित भाव से उसकी कार्यशैली व कर्तव्य परायणता में इतना परिवर्तन आ सकता है । अतः उसके महत्व को समझते हुए हमें भी अपने जीवन में ईश्वर की भक्ति के साथ-साथ कृतज्ञता का भाव रखते हुए, उसे अपने कार्य में समावेश करके अपने जीवन का अभिन्न अंग बनाना चाहिए । अतः उस महिला से प्रेरित होकर मैंने भी 'कर्म ही पूजा' है, को अपने जीवन का मूल मंत्र बना लिया जिससे जीवन में सुख शांति व सफलता का आनंद ले रही हूं ।
name: Kavita

description: Born in a middle class family, she had to compromise on many things. Her dream of becoming a doctor was compromised as her parents couldn’t afford her education. Her dream of pursuing higher studies in a dream college was compromised as she was considered not so smart enough. Overcoming all odds, she could excel in her Bachelors, bag a job as a software engineer in an MNC, where she learnt about growth opportunities ahead. Working as a software engineer till 5pm and preparing for CAT post office hours was very tiresome. But her work ethics never let her compromise on her performance. She found favour in the eyes of management, received many awards for her excellence and brilliance at her workplace. Also, she could make it to an IIM, one of the most prestigious institutes to study in. Many of her friends who were jealous of her success tried to demoralize her as she was from a backward caste but she shielded herself by positivity and self-motivation. But holding on to the same passion, she graduated from IIM as one among the top 10% in terms of academic record and also placed in a very reputed firm. At her workplace she continues to battle against all odds and tries to deliver her best for the growth of the organization. The Her in the story is Shanti, myself and I am highly motivated and proud of Her.
name: Shanti

description:

She inspired me to live better and make me better human being.
She is working for bruhmakumari and inspiring all human across globe.
name: B K shivani

description: to self growth
name: AMAN

description:
In an era of perpetual competition between ultra-sophisticated lifestyle and insatiable human demands for luxury, the naïve yet strong Parukutti being considered an inspiration is befitting to say the least. She is my power house, a Dronacharya to this Eklavya in every sense of the word. Smiling while being thrashed in the clutches of poverty, raising all her five children to be respectable citizens, writing poetries and articles while cooking in an old stove was no less than Rani Laxmibhai reigning over her beloved people. She ensured everyone was fed even when her hand was almost scalded bearing third degree burns from a domestic accident, she ensured her graduation aided the completion fo education not only of her own children but also her grandchildren. She in her humble nine yards clad petite frame painted a silhouette that resonated a battalion that guarded a nation. 
At times when the corporate world fathomed to engulf this chartered accountant, Parukutti’s image was enough to kindle me to essay an alternate strategy to win over all challenges. A dull moment in personal life, her smiling face permanently etched in my mind reassures there exists sunshine at the end of the tunnel. I yearn to be a mother like her, a spouse like her and a woman like her that oozed love without expecting anything at all in return! Her hands always fed and protected, her feet never knew the flavour of rest, her lips that were tireless to smile and her heart of pure gold, if only the metal was worth comparing to her!
While we look at world leaders and great scholars for inspiration, there stands my unsung heroin, my paternal grandmother, Parukutti! A small town girl from Taleserry (Kerala), an ardent writer that inspires all of us in the family to achieve great heights in our lives. Her writing inspired this humble Chartered Accountant to become a commercially published author and win multiple accolades for her tales in a number of national and international forums.
name: Parukkuti (Parvathi)

description: How she speak in parliament, argue to make issue resolve and make her point. Her Kind nature to help others.

description: She is my mother. She instilled in me the concept of saving and always taught me only to spend on items that are really useful to us, that also at a price that make sense. Today I am financially independent and responsible only because of her.

description: She is someone who I have seen working tirelessly for rehabilitation of street children  for almost a decade now. I feel grateful to have had the opportunity to work closely with her and be a small part of her journey. This experience inspired me to find my purpose and serve the society. I gave up my engineering  job and got myself enrolled to pursue Master's degree in Social Work. I'm glad to have chosen this path. It fills me with immense satisfaction and reminds me of my purpose on earth everyday. Watching her work makes me put in my best to achieve the goals I have set in this field. She is an inspiration to many others, especially the number of lives she has touched and changed. I pray that God will continue to bless and protect her.
name: Mrs. Sudha

description: Care and love
name: Sarala gupta

description:
We tend to felicitate and praise women who have distinguished themselves in various fields be it business, entertainment, politics, science, medicine or the arts. However, we barely spare a glance for the mother, sister, daughter, wife who in her own unique way is the hub of her family.
One such unsung heroine was my mother-in-law, Edith Correa.
She never held a paying job or was known beyond family circles but left a mark on all the people she interacted with. She called a spade a spade and never minced words when she spoke. It was her forceful personality which enabled her to raise 8 success stories, her 6 sons and 2 daughters. Five of her sons went on to become engineers and rose to the heights of their professions. Her sixth son became a master Mariner and her daughters, a lawyer and a doctor.
She was the wife of a railwayman with a meagre salary but knew the importance of education for her children. Her great faith in God took her to church daily and she would often be found singing 'I just keep trusting my Lord' in her kitchen.
Why is she such a source of inspiration? She was a strong woman, a good wife and mother, the bedrock of her family. It is on the foundation of such women of substance that, strong families are built and on these are built a nation. Like my mother-in-law who did ordinary things in extraordinary ways, there are many inspirational Indian women who may not make it to the covers of magazines and newspapers but are celebrities and heroines in their homes.
name: EDITH CORREA

description: kangana ranaut ki life journey mujhe bahot inspire karti h kangana ek asi mahila h jo ek runivadi pariwar se nikalkar film industry me aayi..unkea shanti se sabhi sawalo ka jawab dena unka sharp mind mujhe inspire karta h wo top 10 high paid acteress me ase hi shamil nhi hui hai ye me jaan gayi Kangana ranaut 16-17 ki age me delhi me doctor ki padhai krne aayi thi wo ek hostel me rhti thi...unhone whi pr ek theatre join kiya wha pr unke guru ne unki jabardast acting ko dekhkr unse mumbai aane k liye kaha lekin unke gharwale iske khilaf the wo chahte the ki wo ek doctor bane..kangana kehti h ki mere mumy papa ne mujhe bahut acchi parwarish di h lekin phir bhi kahi na kahi ladka or ladki wala bhedbhav unke saath bhi hota tha isliye wo apni ek alag pehchan banana chahti thi unki life me bhut problems aayi or wo 10 saal tk industry me nhi aayi phir wo loti or queen se unhe ek bada break mila or iss tarah wo ek se ek hit filme deti gayi ab wo itni majboot hochuki thi ki har mushkil ka saamna krna unhone seekh liya tha life in a metro film k time unke parents ko bhi unhone convince krliya... kangana k successful acteress hi nhi ek unhone nepotism,sexism,journalism jaise topic pr media se khulkar baat ki..me bhi kangana ranaut ki tarah ek nidar, deshpremi, mehnati, bebak, aatm vishwasi mahila banna chahti hu...inse inspire hokar mera stage fear kum hora h i am very much inspired by kangana mam....
name: Kangana ranaut

description:
कंगना रनौत मुझे बहुत इंस्पायर करती है उनके सामने इतनी मुश्किलेंआई लेकिन वह पत्थर की तरह हिली तक नहीं सेल्फ कॉन्फिडेंस, सही वक्त पर सही निर्णय लेने वाली, ईमानदार ,देश प्रेमी ,मेहनती, प्रतिभाशाली जैसे गुण उनमें भरपूर है आज से ठीक 1 साल पहले मैं उनके बारे में कुछ नहीं जानती थी मेरे लिए बस से एक जाना माना चेहरा थी जिन्हें में मूवीस में देखती थी लेकिन एक दिन मैंने यूट्यूब पर उनका एक इंटरव्यू देखा और यह देखकर मैं दंग रह गई कितनी शांति से वह सभी सवालों का जवाब दे रही थी कितना शार्प माइंड है उनका ..कितनी तकलीफों का सामना कर वह टॉप 10 हाई पैड एक्ट्रेस मैं शामिल हुई है जो लोग इतनी मेहनत कर कर इतना बड़ा मुकाम हासिल करते हैं उन पर लोग कैसे 1 मिनट में उंगली उठा देते हैं.. कंगना बहुत जिद्दी रही है इसलिए वे 16 साल की उम्र मैं घरवालों से बगावत करके एक्टिंग करने लगी थी उनकी जिंदगी में ऐसा दौर भी आया जब उन्होंने किसी अनजान पर आंख बंद कर कर विश्वास कर लिया और उस व्यक्ति ने उनके साथ बदसलूकी की पर कंगना ने ना डर कर पुलिस में उस आदमी की रिपोर्ट की वह कहती हैं कि मुंबई पुलिस बहुत अच्छी है उन्होंने उनकी बहुत हेल्प की थी कंगना की सिस्टर रंगोली पर भी किसी लड़के ने एसिड फेंका था फिर भी यह दोनों डरी नहीं कंगना 10 साल बाद इंडस्ट्री में वापस आई और यहां अपनी जगह बनाई रूढ़ीवादी परिवार से निकलकर फिल्म इंडस्ट्री में आना कोई मामूली बात नहीं है आज कई सेलिब्रिटी उनसे जेलस फील करते हैं लेकिन वह तो ईट का जवाब पत्थर से देती हैं नेपोटिज्म जैसे मुद्दे उन्होंने इंडस्ट्री में उठाएं है
मैंने उनके इस जीवन को देखकर यह सीखा है कि निडर होकर अपना कार्य करते रहो हमें सफलता जरूर मिलती है अगर हम अपने अंदर डर रखेंगे तो बाहर सब हमें डरा कर मार देंगे कितनी भी बुरी सिचुएशन क्यों ना हो हमें उसका सामना करना ही होगा अपने सपनों को पूरा करने के लिए हमेशा तत्पर रहो पैसे से नहीं अपने देश से प्यार करो जब कंगना मैम इंडस्ट्री में आई थी तो उनकी अंग्रेजी का मजाक बनाया जाता था जब हमारी राष्ट्रभाषा हिंदी है तो हम हिंदी में क्यों बात नहीं कर सकते हैं बड़ा अफसोस होता है मुझे अपने ही देश के लोगों द्वारा बुरी टिप्पणियों पर...

मैं कंगना रनौत की तरह एक निडर आत्म विश्वासी, मेहनती ,ईमानदार, देश प्रेमी बनना चाहती हूं
