description: Instead of complaining about what she didn't have, Mary decided early on that she would build her strength and make it her talent. Not born into a family of sportspersons or had the privilege of training with the best at the start of her career. She has has six world records, being the only woman boxer to have won in every one of the seven world championships. She has broken barriers to make firsts with her fists both as a woman boxer and as a boxer of any gender.
name: Mangte Chungneijang Mary Kom

description:
Nivedita’s Mission – ”Deification of Motherland”

Dr. Bhupendra Nath Dutta the illustrious younger brother of swami Vivekananda and revolutionary has rightly pointed out in his inspiring work, Swami Vivekananda-Patriot-Prophet, the primary object of swami Vivekananda was nationalism. To arouse the sleeping lion of India and put it on its proper pedestal was his life’s mission. His national ideal was the ideal of Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyaya as depcited in the revolutionary novel, Ananda Math. The Swamiji proclaimed to his countrymen that motherland and the children of the mother are the only gods to be worshiped.  Nivedita said that Swamiji advised her to dedicate her life for the service of the Mother. She says, Swamiji asked me to forge a mighty weapon out of the bones of the Bengali youths which can free India.

Freedom of India has been attained, but we are yet to free ourselves from the bondage of intellectual slavery. The western materialistic outlook and a carving to raise the standard of living at the cost of standard of life is eating into the core of vitals of our national life. It is carrying a need of the hour to arouse once again the patriotic sentiments and spirit of deep respect and reverence to the eternal values of life propounded by our great masters, in the hearts of our people, especially the younger generation. She has given the clarion call: Age succeeds age in India, and even the voice of the Mother calls upon her children to worship her with now offerings, with renewal of their own greatness. Today she asks, as a household mother of the strong men whom she has borne and bred that we show to her not gentleness and submission, but manly strength and invincible might. Today she would hat we play before her with the sword. Today se would find herself the mother of a hero clan. Today she cry once more that she is hungered and only by the lives and blood of the Kings and men, can the citadel be saved.
name: SISTER NIVEDITA

description: As part of the Quit India Movement, members of the Congress planned to take over the various police stations of Medinipore district and other government offices. This was to be a step in overthrowing the British government in the district and establishing an independent Indian state. Hazra, who was 71 years at the time, led a procession of six thousand supporters, mostly women volunteers, with the purpose of taking over the Tamluk police station.When the procession reached the outskirts of the town, they were ordered to disband under Section 144 of the Indian Penal Code by the Crown police. As she stepped forward, Hazra was shot once. Apparently, she had stepped forward and appealed to the police not to open fire at the crowd.The Biplabi newspaper of the parallel Tamluk National Government commented: Matangini led one procession from the north of the criminal court building; even after the firing commenced, she continued to advance with the tri-colour flag, leaving all the volunteers behind. The police shot her three times. She continued marching despite wounds to the forehead and both hands. As she was repeatedly shot, she kept chanting Vande Mataram.
name: Matangini Hazra

description: Every child stays in his/her mother’s womb for 9 months , But I’m the most blessed child who still continues to live in my mother’s womb since 34 years . People may laugh hearing this but I can feel the warmth of my mother’s womb mentally. My mom stays almost 700 km away from me still doesn’t take more than 18 hrs to reach me whenever I was in need...when I was mentally depressed she was always there by me and taught me not to give up.I could get through my biggest challenge only because of her. I had to stay in hospital for almost 4 months for my pregnancy that too after 4 abortions.when I was completely under bed rest she took care of me again like a mom takes care of a new born baby.I got my little angel because of her support and the confidence she gave. She is woman who walked almost 15 km on 30 th oct 1984 just to take care of my 1 year old elder sister. She taught us a lesson that a woman doesn’t become mother when she delivers a baby she becomes a mother when she is with her children supporting them in crossing every grief and happiness . Though everybody in our family hated us for being born as girls she never bothered others she gave us all respect and treated us like princesses . It is very difficult to write about my mom in a line or two because words cannot express what I have in my mind and how much she inspires me as a daughter, wife, woman , mother and now grandmother ....,
name: Hemalatha Radhakrishnan

Our sanskrit text says-The Whole World Is One Family. Mother Teresa brought this saying into reality.

She decided to serve and ease the sufferings of the people of a foreign land and loved them,when we differentiate our own people on the basis of caste,state,language,status,gender and innumerable things.

Its our planet and its our people,if we dont take care of them, who will?

If we only are enemies of our fellow humans,who will save them and where will they hide?

Our home doesnt end at the gates of our houses.Our home is this planet and the people in it.

Her love and sacrifice for the humanity,the strength of her spirit to stand in the face of the most adverse conditions has inspired me to become a better humanbeing and make the world a better place to live.

She represents what influence a woman can have on the world. After all, who can deliver the message of love, caring and support better than a woman.

description: The ever lasting positivity and zeel to get through everything that life throughs her at is something that I grew up watching. She indeed walks the talk. Yes! Mothers have answers to all (almost all) the questions kids have, specially if you are a teacher by heart and profession. I say almost is because, me and my brother were curious kids, kids questioning the way of things, scientific facts, when she didn't know the answer, she will get it for us. Well, getting answers in this era seems easy and just a click away, not if it was 90s. Again, we can say how can that be so different for a special mention here. Okay, club it with 2 jobs, studying for 9 yrs after getting married, demanding household (we all know this means a strict mother-in-law), 2 kids to raise wanting to give them everything they never got and none the less financially broke. All this with a big smile on the face. Sometimes I think and even tell my husband that if I am able to do even 10% of what my mom did, I'd be doing he'll lot! As I write this, she is fighting a court case since over a decade now for her right to get paid as per government rules which also resulted to lose her job, but standing up for what is right is of prime importance to her. As we know getting justice in our judicial scheme of things takes patience, persistence and most importantly time - all this again with a smile on face and positivity in talks. People say I couldn't have a better mother, I say I couldn't have a better mother, teacher, friend, and idol. Thank you for letting me share

description:
Life has been a long struggle for her - with happy moments interspersed but she never gave up or lost hope. At a young age, her father suffered a stroke and was duped by his business partner resulting in dire financial straits. Despite all odds, she took up a job as a teacher while furthering her own education and after graduating, secured a clerical post in a government bank, running her home in a meager salary of Rs 300. Soon, she married the love of her life who has stood by her like a rock all these years - supporting her through every decision she took. After her husband quit his job owing to intense work-pressure and found it difficult to secure a new one, she took up the mantle and was the sole bread-winner for her family of four - giving up every possible comfort and luxury but never once complaining. 
Seema Ladage, my mother, has been one of the most inspirational women I know. Always smiling through it all, always ready to lend a hand to everyone, she is one of the simplest and sweetest person I know. Her story is truly inspirational and makes me proud to know that I'm her daughter. Everyone who knows her loves her for her honesty, her naivety, her openness. She has inspired hundreds through her kind deeds and acts and continues to do so even today. A salute to this simple, yet brave woman who has won at every challenge life threw at her - and continues to stand tall and proud!
name: Seema Ladage

Now i am owning own house, bike , car and a wonderful Kid etc. She is the lucky wife for me.

In this joy i should not forgot to ask the details of that money she gave right?. yes i asked. description:
“Women – God’s finest creation! I have such a marvel with me – Garima, my wife. Since I met her, I’d not say there has been tremendous change in my life but I have become more responsible, caring and a better human being.
There are uncountable examples where she inspired me with her dedication. One of those – when she well managed her home, office & everything while her mother was suffering from cancer. Because of her sincere efforts, her mother survived for 10+ years. Another one, when she did to-and-fro for 1.5 years to manage both the families well, since her mother passed away. 
There were situations when I had a bad day and she was the one helped me to get away with it. To be frank, I am kind of a person not everybody is comfortable with, however she has shown great adaptability and ensured my needs are never compromised with. 
Time has tested her but she has always proved mettle of her character. On this Women’s day, I thank God for bringing her to my life and wish her all the good times in life. Always her, Deepak.”

description:
The first successful patient of pancreatic-kidney transplant in Mumbai, 33 year old Priyanka Digamber has been one of the strongest women I have had the fortune of meeting and becoming friends with in my life. Diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes in Class 11, she did not let that hamper her and continued living life to the fullest. Despite being limited by her medical condition, she continued to be adventurous. From bike riding to adventure activities, she has done it all. 
However, when tragedy struck when she was in Berlin for work when her kidneys failed. Dialysis thrice-a-week was her only option. Coming from a middle-class background, the family finances were soon sapped and they had to sell everything and move to a remote location outside Mumbai. However, she continued to be undeterred and despite the odds, knew she wanted to fight. She signed up for the first ever Pancreatic transplant surgery in Mumbai and as she did not have the funds, appealed to people on crowd-funding platforms. 
Her journey has been fraught with difficulties but she has emerged victorious. On the slow path to recovery, she struggles but has never given up. Womanhood salutes her, celebrates her.
name: Priyanka Digamber

description: It is customary to talk of one's own mother as the true inspiration in one's life, but it is she who made me see positivity in everything that made me what I am today. She was a writer, social activitist, first class magistrate and a dynamo who gave me courage to write, inspired me to get a scholarship to USA to study, made me fly a Pushpak, and made me learn the piano, dance and so much else. She herself won awards in her time that took her to USA in meetings with Eleanor Roosevelt, went with delegations to Russia, wrote short stories, poetry anthologies, novels, and revalued dozens of women's lives who came in touch with her. She gave my father full support in Rotary, in his career, in his embracing of Brahmoism. It was her broadmindedness, her deep seated values, her joie de vivre and love for enjoying all facets of life, infusing a sense of seeking all that is meaningful and beautiful in the cultural and societal milieu that has given me the will to keep going in my profession and in my varied interests.
name: Tapati Mookerji

description:
Rekha is my life partner. We both belong to village. It was near Year 2003 March, we were rented at Gurgoan. I was a Sr.Engineer in an Automobile industry. I became jobless. We were living in Gurgaon with 1.5 Yr Baby Girl & 3 Months baby boy. Recently a big expenditure done in family & next week became jobless. Those days were very hard. A person in tension can't work or sleep. There was a commercial back up for current month. But no any hope for next month. Then what she did...
She always encourage me & says don't worry, we will manage. After 15 days, she stop to buying the fruits or others for us. She stop to buy cow milk for Kids.  Both kids feed from her breast. She became very weak. One day I see powder milk at home. I ask what is this.... she says how we will survive next month so I stop all un-necessary items. She is a good tailor, she has discussed with neighbors for sewing of ladies suits for some commercials.
On that night I think, we both are facing problem. She seams always happy but in actual she is not. She never ask or pressurize me for Job. How she is broad minded & passionate woman. But why she stop milk buying for Kids. I ask her seriously.She said,we both are alive & OK we can make kids again but if yourself lost. I can't make you. You please don't worry... one day you will join a new job & everything will be OK. On that day I feel a woman heart & increase the respect for each woman. in early morning I meet milkman for supplying of cow milk for Kids, payment may be given later. I borrow some money from friend & give to wife for month expenditure, she take but not happy.After hard time I got a Job. / Salary recd, 1st action - return all money to friends with thanks.2 - Discuss with my parents & feel sorry that she was not in touch with parents & send monthly money to them.
She advice me please make a bank balance for future. Today I am AGM R&D, I feel that time & her dedication to family change my life. Now we are living happily in our own home.
name: Rekha

description:
Turning the ‘impossible’ into ‘possible’: Poonam Dalal Dahiya’s story of grit, persistence and conviction.Family responsibilities often cause many to abandon their dreams and settle for less. However, when Poonam Dalal Dahiya decided to clear the UPSC (Union Public Service Commission) exam and join the Indian Revenue Service (IRS), she didn’t let motherhood or police duty stop her. So, what does it take to be like her?

The journey

Poonam was born in a middle-class home in Jhajjar, Haryana. For a few years she donned different hats-a primary teacher in Delhi, a Probationary Officer at State Bank of India and even joined the Income Tax Department.

The idea of taking the UPSC exam came to her when she secured 7th rank in the SSC Graduate Level Examination. Poonam first attempted to clear the exam at the age of 28. At the time, she was already married to Asim Dahiya, who was employed in the Customs Excise Department.

Meanwhile, she cleared the Haryana PSC exam and was recruited into the Haryana police as Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) in 2011. That year, Poonam failed the UPSC prelims and had almost given up all hope.

A turn of fate

After her third attempt, Poonam reached an age that made it unable for her to retake the exam. However, a fortunate turn of events led the government to offer unsuccessful candidates yet another chance. “It felt like the whole universe was conspiring to make my dream come true,” she says. Poonam wanted to grab this unexpected opportunity, but by then she had a three-month-old baby who needed her attention. “I had to find a way to study, without letting my son or duty suffer because of it,” she adds.

Not without my family

“My father has been a big inspiration. He made sure I received a good formal education,” says Poonam. Hailing from a small village, Poonam’s parents always encouraged her to pursue her dreams. “I have two brothers, and both helped me study for the exam,” she adds.
name: Poonam Dalal Dahiya

description:
Being a woman is beautiful. And being a mother puts the whole world in perspective.” 
 
This is true. The ideal, 24x7 example of inspiration, Mrs Bakhtawar Saini is the ‘woman next door’ who has been busy bending the rules. 

Director-Operations at the Scottish High International School, Gurugram and mother to three adorable kids, Mrs Saini feels that motherhood is truly rewarding. It is mixed with challenges that make the reward even sweeter. 

Her challenges started when her son Ranveer, was diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder at the age of 2. As a child, Ranveer‘s growing years were accompanied by a lot of behavioural concerns, aggressiveness and hyperactivity, and it was becoming extremely challenging for her as a mother. She knew that she had a long journey ahead.
 
However, she didn’t give up. As much as she wanted to help Ranveer cope up with his normal life, the social stigma of being the mother of an autistic child started alienating her from the rest of the world. But she kept going.
 
A beam of comfort came through when one day she discovered Ranveer discovering Golf. It was a breakthrough for her. Ranveer found recreation in golf. Fumbling and taking his chances at the Golf course. It seemed that he had found a spot where he could be all by himself. 

But it was not that simple. Golf required long hours of attention, focus and hours of sustaining the game and it was going all against Ranveer’s disability. However, she was unrelenting. Every day, she would take Ranveer to the Golf course and sit for hours, watching him struggle to make things work. And finally, it did.
 
Today Ranveer is the first Indian to create history by winning a Gold medal in Special Olympics, World Games, LA, 2015, followed by a Silver medal in Special Olympics, World Games, Abu Dhabi-2019. He is the Limca Record holder - 4 years in a row (2014-17) & recipient of the Bhim Award, and many more. 

Truly Mrs Saini is a brilliant example of victories over challenges!
name: Mrs. Bakhtawar Saini

description:
I am writing this story with abundance of gratitude and plethora of love in my heart for her. The gracious lady who has managed to inspire me since my day 1 at earth - my mother/mom/ma! I have always wondered what a superhero she has managed to be through all these years. My mother lost her mother when she was in class X and early on she started playing the role of a care taker for her siblings, manager of household and was studying to make a career.She started teaching at Adult Education in rural areas, post completing her B.Ed. in 1976. As a part of her job, she had to travel to distant remote (rural) locations using public transport irrespective of timings of the day. That is extremely courageous! She got married in 1982 and I was born to her after 8 years (and several medical complications) of her marriage to my father. 
Since my birth,I haven’t seen a day when she had left a stone unturned to provide me with loving, protected and disciplined surroundings. Now, she is retired and happily managing her home. However, her dream of owning her “home” and a “car” is still unfulfilled due to stressed financial situation of the family. Her health has deteriorated due the kind of physical hard work she did during her younger years. She is suffering from psoriasis, arthritis and spondylitis at the moment and has become quite weak. However, she is still gleaming with goodness, kindness and the first one to offer help when someone needs it. ❤ 
She is an angel in real life because I have always seen her strong, smiling and full of life. She has faced a lot of hardships and challenges at different stages of life but I have never seen her down and low. She has taught me to be a fighter, be strong willed and follow my heart always. My heart is filled with joy while writing this excerpt and I cannot have enough words/space to describe her full-life story in one go. She is my love, light and the personification of God on earth. SHE deserves to be celebrated!
name: Radha Tandon

description:
Sania Mirza

A sports-star who needs no introduction, SaniaMirza, the female lawn tennis player, has brought laurels to the Indian nation and is continuing to do so. In 2015, she became the first female Indian tennis player who gained the number one position in doubles, beating Sara Errani and Roberta Vinci from Italy. Her success story is one which is driven by consistent passion, hard-work, unstinted commitment and dedication. A sports prodigy who began playing the sport at the age of five, she hasn’t ever missed her routine training sessions for twenty-three years.

SaniaMirza’s success story has also been besotted by troubles of a different kind – for instance, being a Muslim, the so-called ‘upholders’ of morality posited that it is a matter of shame for her to wear skirts and expose her legs in front of the whole world, or specifically, in front of strange men. Secondly, her marriage to the Pakistani cricketer Shoaib also drew a lot of flak from the general public. Her decision to marry early was condemned, overlooking the fact that it is only her right to decide such issues. Additionally, it was rumoured that she would now play for Pakistan, since she had married a Pakistani national. Despite all such baseless, distractive accusations and remarks, Sania has never been bogged down.

She has always concentrated on her game, in a truly professional manner. Her biggest source of support has been her family, as his evident from the fact that it was her father who had begun training her at the tender age of five or six. Her family did not hesitate to drive across state boundaries in a car to enable their daughter to participate in tennis tournaments.

 Also, her own determination and grit in the face of all adversity has gained international recognition – she is the UN Women’s Goodwill Ambassador for South Asia. Her name also features in one of the fifty heroes of Asia – a list released by Time magazine.
name: Sania Mirza

description:

Since the past few years, I have not been worrying about the next step.  In case I feel I need to do something, I just go for it.  I am proud to say that I am POSITIVE ENERGY that has taken a human form.

I have this perennial thirst for knowledge. description: It was a classic case of business risk – working capital tied up in inventory. The manufactured equipment was lying in our factory, and the customers were dithering to pick-up the ordered goods. What might have been normal for large businesses, became a matter of grave concern for my father’s then-fledgling company. There were vendors that needed to be paid and we didn’t even have any money for personal expenses. I was 12 and very scared. We constantly received angry calls from vendors at home and with my dad frequently traveling to sort out customer-issues, somebody was required to step-up to help with this unravelling chaos. That somebody was my mom, a housewife with zero business experience became the ad-hoc factory manager to manage this crisis. In those days, she would wake up at 5 AM – prepare breakfast and lunch for everyone, get ready, change 3 rickshaws (8-9 people crammed in a single tuk-tuk) to save travel cost, be at the factory the whole day – a single lady amidst ten men which included the contract labor staff, come back home everyday at 7 in the evening and prepare dinner for everyone. She ensured that we adapted our lifestyle to our changing financial condition. She would drive hard bargains with kirana store-owners and vegetable vendors, find out all about discounts and sources where we would get things cheaper, and walked a lot (she used to wear crepe bandages around her feet to reduce the pain)! She ran the ship with a tight budget and ensured that our bellies were warm and filled. It was a hard life, and everyone of us worked harder. But none, more than my mom! In a few years the situation eased out but the lessons my mom taught me, helped me in becoming a better person today. She taught me how to bargain hard, she pushed me to work harder and she ensured that I participate in each competition that came across in school or college. She has always inspired me and inculcated this very vital lesson in me: Winning is not important, participating is!
name: Manju Kapoor

description:
In the backdrop of this fast changing scenario emerged Ms Ava Banerjee. A rare personality undaunted by the challenges around, Ms. Banerjee is in the business world for the last 34 years dealing in Garment manufacturing in West Bengal and in other states curving out a name for herself. Her manufacturing unit operating from New Alipore employs a sizeable work force that works in different shifts and roll out products of fascinating and intricate designs that have caught the imagination of thousands of her customers. Even to a casual onlooker her creations leave a long lasting impression. She has slowly and surely expanded her horizon by creating new markets for her products in different parts of the country. Her relentless efforts, creative vision, tantalizing designs and above all her ability to understand the mindset of her customers have given her national acceptance and a strong base within the country.

Even at this age of 74 she is as young and energetic as can be imaginable eager to learn and develop her skills. She has provided employment to many under-privileged females who look upon her as their bread winner.

A big salute to her.
name: Ms Ava Banerjee

description:
As King Solomon describes, she (Valsa, Mrs.Aleyamma Jose) gets up early morning,prepares food for everyone in the house,lunch boxes for the children and husband and used to rush hurriedly to the high school where she taught Science and Maths.Often she skipped her breakfast for the sake of the family.then continuously taught for many schedule periods in the assigned classes.
She had to attend to classes in addition where teachers were absent for the day. As school has more than 100 teachers in both English and Marathi medium. Finishing the shift, She visited the nearby market for purchase of daily needs like vegetables and fish. And carried them home-crossing a serious of railway tracks. Back home,in the afternoon-she gives tuition to students-did house chores like cleaning,  washing,ironing.Plus attending small prayer meetings and Church. Above these ,attending to relatives and visitors to Mumbai, often staying in the house,attending to parents.In fact no area of life is untouched by her in 24 hours of a working day.Helping our two children in studies,attention to me (husband).The engagement are limitless all with a smile and great enthusiasm, she did it. My wife Valsa(Mrs.Aleyamma Jose) is such a store house of energy and enthusiasm and central figure in our Mumbai city life. Even on holidays,her eyes are on all arrangements of travel and stay. She is always such a motivator by doing and greatest woman who influenced my life. 
Thank God for her.
name: VALSA(Mrs.ALEYAMMA JOSE)

description:
My wife, who believes in giving. She says “never pray to god to get one thing or the other rather always pray to make yourself so competent that you are always giving to others”. she has always encouraged me to give as much help to the needy as you can. She is full of compassion and never hesitates when it comes to giving. As she believes that “One who gets a lot from the world is a big man, but the one who gives to the world is bigger”. These words always remain with me and inspire me to give back more to the world. 


After a tragic demise of my first wife, Lalita came into my life. Our families got us together as she also lost her first husband. Although, she is 14 years younger to me, she is much wiser than I am. She has worked hard to achieve a lot in life and further encourages me, even in this old age, to be progressive in life.  She worked relentlessly to keep the synergies of the family together by taking care of all our 5 children(from previous marriages). It is magical that there exists no difference among them. They love and care for each other. It is my wife who helped us all to bind together. Not only this she believes in giving and says “One who gets a lot from the world is a big man, but the one who gives back to the world is bigger”. These words of my wife always inspire me to give back more to the world.
name: Lalita Singhal

description: My life
name: Ritika Gupta

description:
You get in life what you have the courage to ask for. Oprah Winfrey, one of the most inspiring women this millenium has seen, once spoke these lines. And they stand apt for the woman whose story I am about to share 
- the woman I love, admire and take strength from  - my wife Lakshita. 
She has been a strong pillar of support, especially pertaining to my profession where I have to be away from home for long periods of time. She has stood by me through thick and thin.
I am a Captain in the Merchant Navy. My wife was working as a Mathematics teacher in a highly reputed school in Delhi before we got married.
After our marriage, she quit her job so that we could be together and start a family. She decided to accompany me on my ship and we started sailing together on board for very long periods of time without having the luxury of normal day to day things, which we realize the absence of more, like talking to your family, going out with friends , have unrestricted internet etc...The list is enormous.
Life has been an adventure ever since and we managed to travel and explore all seven continents together in the last decade.
She has always smilingly and willingly sailed with me on ship even though we faced extreme violent weather conditions and storms, hurricanes and typhoons where the ship was being tossed around the ocean waves like a toy. We also survived a piracy attack off the coast of Somalia when the vessel was attacked by armed pirates.
She had the courage and the strength to go through it and even now the beautiful journey  that we share is because of her constant endeavors for us to be together. 
As she always says - Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take but by the moments that take our breath away...
name: Lakshita Kapur

description:
I often heard stories of women going after their dreams and finding a way to it but mine is different. I am only a housewife, just a housewife.
       Like all women, I did household chores working from early morning till night. Whole family took me forgranteed as if I am a maid, a free maid, a permanent maid.They ignored my whole day hard work and pointed only left ones. Something was now killing me inside. I felt exhausted as if it has drained me of everything that i had. I am tired of being unappreciated..
     I had two possibilities : either to repent on present situation by comparing my current self with the best I have been ( lecturer in college nd artist/writer by hobby) or to make best of the situation to be happy. Then came the stage of realization. Sometimes, a little change is good thing. One can change ones life by changing one's thinking.  I changed overnight. I took a deep breath and had affirmation that everything is best. I took my home making as God given gift. I started saying..
I m a super woman, super wife, super daughter in law nd a super mom!!  I am the best.
Truly, change your thoughts and you will change your world. Now I see myself as a strong pillar of house without whom whole family will shatter in pieces. My kids are best in  studies and cocurricular activities all due to my teaching and hard Work. When they win, its my victory. When my in laws are not well I take care of them as a nurse. Their health is my wealth. I maintain home nd take care of my hubby. I never go extravagant by joining kitties or doing parties in club. I save hard earned money. In return I get what I desire without even uttering.He persuaded to give sometime to myself too, to my hobby nd to my passion of art , craft nd writing. Because of his support my story book  Uljhan Rishton Ki  is published. My art and craft is gaining applause everywhere. This is my victory of being just a housewife 
- Payal Mittal
name: Payal Mittal

description:
Whenever I could think of a woman that inspired us in all walks of our life, I immediately think of my Mother. My life has been a roller-coaster ride of ups and downs. The untimely death of my father when I was 13 years old caused us great distress. My mother was working as a Government Servant, had already completed 25 years of her service by then. She rented a 1RK place and me, my mother & elder sister started our new life after my father’s demise.
Mom always worked hard and provided us everything she could. I don't think we even asked for a lot of 'things' when we were growing up. And even if we did, it never occurred to us that in that moment mom was probably giving up something she really wanted or needed for herself just, so I could have something I wanted. She would never show that as a burden though. 
I could get my Computer Engineering degree just because she taught us to be focused on our career. The 3 years Engineering fee was something we couldn’t afford but we took a Student loan which made it easier to get what I needed. While sister completed her education and was doing a full-time job to support our family.
By this time, my mother and sister had gone through a life-altering accident from which mom’s recovery had took almost a year. Since mom was a Government Servant, she re-joined but had to travel too far daily. The commute was difficult. The journey took 2 hours one way, state transport buses had no good suspensions which led her to have another operation for slip disk. But she never gave up & fought back. 
I remember when mom was in the hospital after her major accident, doctors thought she wouldn’t survive. But “Wheel-power” it was that made her recover & be an example of how one could fight back with life. We were astounded every time mom took things in her hand and came back as a fighter, winner, champion. A grand salute to her “Wheel-power”! Thank you mom for always being there in our life & know that I love you and cherish you more than life.
name: Smt. Sunanda Jayant Sharma

description:
About 10 million people of East Pakistan (now Bangladesh) fled the country and took refuge in India after Partition. Among the migrants, were my maternal and paternal grandparents. They were left homeless and traveled to unknown destinations to build a new life, not because they wanted to, but because they were forced to do and they had no choice left for themselves. 
Shishu, adorably called Manu was born on 5th of June 1947. She was the eldest of the four siblings. Dr. Haripada Halder , an Ayurvedic doctor by profession had a flourishing practice in Barisal district (a town in Bangladesh). However, Post Partition things started changing drastically. Hindu houses were plundered and burnt. Women were molested, raped and many murdered. Seeing conditions worsening day by day, in 1958, Dr. Halder decided to leave the country with his family. They crossed Petropole, and travelled to Sealdah Railway Station (India) bare-handed and bare-footed. After spending eleven days in make shift tents on the Railway Platform, they were sent to Refugee Camps in North Bihar. Life was hard for the distraught family to adjust to a new land and start afresh without financial resources. Mother Belaka, Manu and her eldest brother started making “bidi” to add to earnings. Dr. Halder struggled to establish his practice. Soon, he regained his prosperity as a skilled physician. Things started improving gradually. Shishu continued with her studies, and was the first girl in the Camp to complete her Matriculation in 1962. She did her Graduation and was selected as Welfare Officer by the Bihar Govt. in 1967. Later, she joined Indian Oil Corporation in 1973.
My mother is a woman of substance. She has brilliantly managed and excelled in her job and family responsibilities. It’s because of her noble parenting, today, I and my sister, both are academicians and pursuing our career successfully. Lucky, I am to have her in my life and wish that, I was born in her womb again for my next re-births!!
name: Shishumati Mazumdar

description:
Our dad being a religious and spiritual person, endowed with utmost honesty, generated values, culture,  integrity, truth  and dedication which  got rooted deeper  on our growing, schooling,  pursisng higher studies which could not be shaken by any amount of ‘greed’, ‘compromise’,  whatsoever. These were devotedly enforced by my sister, being dedicated and passionate about integrity  in family and in career advancements; ‘virtues’ rarely visible currently.  Family economics deprived me of regular Post Matric studies. Undeterred, I completed my Graduation, LL.B., Management studies while learning and earning for parents, brothers and sisters. Had been a major earner. then. Thanks to the motivation and the inspiration received from my sister whose motivation still keeps me going on. I worked as ‘Post man’, ‘clerk’, a ‘typist’, Assistant, Sr. Assistant, officer, Dy. Manager, Manager, Sr. Manager, Dy. General Manager, Additional General Manager, got fellowships from UK and Denmark Governments and finally superannuated as General Manager;  getting elevations in a zig zag way by changing one company and the other, – approximately a dozen. And still at young age of 77, I continue to hunt for fruitful engagements.  My hunt does chip in a few thousands though on short time assignments.   
All these elevations were not ‘simple’; rather earned after a long list of struggles facing ‘unethical’ persons, political leaders and other miscreants. a.	Once advised a trade unionist to be punctual in attending office, three to four cops from Delhi Police suddenly came to office and showed me a couple of  complaints from two MPs then; one sitting and the other ‘formerly’ accusing me of amassing wealth in recruitment and giving shelter to Sikh terrorists way back late in 1980s/1990s. 
One cop from Ghaziabad too came asking me to accompany him which I resisted that he should approach the Chief Vigilance Officer of our Company since I can’t leave Hqrs without his permission. Case was close
name: Mrs. Sudershan Kaur Nindra

description:
The woman who is a living definition of inspiration in my life is the iron willed lady- Sunitha Krishnan. From being gang raped at the age of 15 to winning a Padma Shri award, she has seen it all. 
At the age of eight years, she started teaching dance to mentally challenged children. By the age of twelve, she was running schools in slums for underprivileged children. At the age of fifteen, while working on a neo-literacy campaign for the Dalit community, Krishnan was gang raped by eight men. They did not like that a woman was interfering with what they claimed as “man’s society.” They beat her so badly that she is partially deaf in one ear. She has been physically assaulted, attacked with acid and attempts have been made on her life. But these incidents didn’t deter her spirit. Instead they intensified her passion for serving the society. 
She sold all her jewelry and even utensils to found the NGO, ‘Prajwala’ to not just rescue but reintegrate the victims of sex trafficking into the society. She not only leads these interventions, but has also led a program which trains survivors in male dominated professions like carpentry, welding, printing and masonry. 
Till date, Prajwala has rescued and rehabilitated over 12,000 survivors of sex trafficking. She has drafted policies, made national award-winning films and conducted sensitization programs, all with a singular goal of providing respect, compassion and 
embracement of the survivors, which they very rightly deserve! 
She indeed is a one ‘woman’ army who’s on a tireless crusade against human trafficking and truly exemplifies the age old saying that, ‘a true woman is both soft and strong’.
name: Sunitha Krishnan

description:
I had just funished my Internship in Homoeopathy.. and i had graduated with Degree of BHMS.. thats a Homoeopathic Doctor.. as i had just stepped out of college i was totally in delima as to what my future was.. I went around to meet many Homoeopathic doctors for their guidance and help, to my utter disappointment they all refused..  this was the time my aunt introduced me to a Doctor from mumbai.. Dr Anjali Tayle.. as my aunt was her patient.. my aunt had told Dr Tayde about me and my delima.. As i called her and asked her whether i could just sit in her clinic with her and observe her cases.. without a second she said Yes Raja you come.. she had this habit making people comfortable by speaking to them so politely.. i packed my bags n next day i left for mumbai.. 
I went to see her.. and she asked me to sit with her and observe her cases.. 
The thing that i liked about her was.. her godly attitude of helping others! When in need she was the one who came to my rescue.. even though i was a stranger to her.. and her help was selfless!  He motivated me alot.. in many ways.. she gave courage.. to start my clinic.. i observed her .. she is a lady with a lot of positive energy and she spreads this positive energy to the ones who surround her.. she gives hope to people..as she is a Homoeopathic doctor..many people came to her for counseling.. and she solved their cases and consoled them beautifully.. all her patients left the clinic with a smilie on their face.. 
What i also loved about her is.. in todays world where everyone thinks only about themselves..and keeps all secrets.. she was exactly opposite.. she never kept anything hidden.. she gave advise without any inhibitions.. n spead a lot of love and hope.. she inspires people to follow their passion.. she herself loves making utility bags.. and has a separate business of that.she also is a good mother and good cook too. i would just say that like me there will so many people that she must inspired and spread her magic!
name: Dr Anjali Tayde

description: It's my mom who has inspired me throughout my life. The way she fought everyone in family to send us to a convent school for studying is one of her major debt which we owe to her. She has always given more than 100% to educate us, to stand us on our own feet. After getting married in a small village where she had to do all the household cores alone for a big family of 12 persons that too by keeping a veil from all the elder males, she had almost forgotten herself. Side by side she was also giving tutions to 3 of us. She was a pampered child who had never touched any household core before marriage. The way she has suffered throughout her life has made her a strong person. I had seen her crying, being scolded from my great grandmother. I had seen us in depression. All I regret is that I could not save her from this suffering. I owe my life to her. It is her hardwork that has made us stand on our feet today. Words are not enough to describe her sacrifices. All I wish is that she does not suffer anymore and we keep her life full of happiness.
name: Smita Tayal

description:
Life is more than just spending, earning, or enjoying with man made products. Life is all about living for others. She makes me realise about the beautiful nature we have and how we are destroying it. She is from Kalimpong ( Darjling ) and she is living in nature since her birth. I am from Gurgaon where pollution is a problem. We had a arrange marriage. She encourages me to plant more & more trees in our surrounding. We both have planted 10 trees this monsoon season and teaching my only kid to how to love nature. She also focuses on water saving. Earlier i used shower for bath, now i use bucket. Saving water purifier water for different use & use bucket for car washing. Small steps but our small contribution towards our Mother Nature. Even she aware people ( her friends, officemates, realtives ) about benefits of having trees and water saving. 
I am learning a lot from her and spreading the good deeds among people . 
Love our Mother Earth. She is giving life to us. No luxury can buy you clean water and pure air, but Mother Earth is giving you it free of cost. Her words.
She is my wife, my better half & my love.
name: Manisha Sharma

description:
In our Indian tradition of late 80s where women stop her studies and other activities after marriage...... She also get married in the age of 19 and forced to make home but she can see beyond that and she makes home with prefaction as well as continue her studies and selected in gov. collage for studies but family not allowed to let her study but she do all home stuff first @ 5am than she go for her studies and complete her graduation as well as post graduation in the same manner with given birth to two of her sons after that she got selected for job in Rajasthan education department but as her husband in army she have to move to South India with him...... Many faces she faced in the same. Manner but she won't given up on her success and at last she end up her career as paper reader from Rajasthan state agriculture department she got respect, award everything what she dreamed in her 19th age.
That inspired me alot everything is just excuses, if u dreame something by heart u will definitely find some way to achieve it, u just have to keep doing your afforts with honesty. 
Only that matters 
And she is my mom.........

description:
It is something significant, that being in a married relationship has stretched the breadth and depth of Ginnie and I‘s knowledge of each other. Our relationship seems to uncover new, and unexplored, areas of who we are as individuals and who we are as a married couple. Throughout the twists and turns of the voyage of marriage, I have observed who I have become up till now through everything and it has made me see how much my wife inspires me to love, be joyful, and to create.

Loving Unconditionally
My wife inspires me to love very deeply. Her love is strong. Even saying that is understatement, but it is true. Her love for me is a strong force that is constantly going deeper to where it reflects a love of a divine savior; it is unavoidable and unstoppable. There have been times where anger and self-pity twisted and rooted far and wide inside of me giving birth to children of hate and spite. I become a dark, frustrated, and vile person to where being near me brings my wife to tears or resentment; but amazingly, throughout the ridiculous mess–she chooses to love me. Her love doesn‘t draw away or turn into violent action. It remains strong; and even through there might be tears and pain, it never backs down; leaving me, eventually, with no choice but to love back.

Surprising Joy
Similar to my wife‘s love is her inspirational ability to shine with joy. It is hard for me to go a day without smiling because of something my wife has said or done; and if you knew how hard it is for me to go a day without feeling heavy amounts of negativity then this amazing. Ginnie sees the life around her with such beauty that her actions and words involved in our relationship are colored with bright tones of joy. It takes me by surprise sometimes, as I am someone who gets lost in an un-joyful state; but no matter what, the light that is reflected from her joy eventually breaks through into my heart and brings in a warmer mindset of the life around me.
Creativity To Share
Combined with

description: My mother inspires me every single day. I know you may think this is cliche, but wait, let me explain why.  Ayesha has been both a mother and a father to my brother and when our father didn’t really want us or want to take care of us. She’s never made us feel like we are inferior or that we lack something or someone in our life. She’s extraordinary because while her parents disowned her for marrying a man of her choice, a man out of her religion, she chose to live by her choices, unapologetically. See she was born into a conservative Hindu family and fell in love with my father, who was born in a Muslim family. When the marriage didn’t work out and my father didn’t really want to stay involved, my mother stepped up. She became both our father and our mother. She’s been our guide and our confidante. Imagine being disowned by your parents, going through a divorce and being left with two very young impressionable children. They say the children of divorced parents may end up exhibiting signs of trauma for their whole lives. Not with my mother around, no. She made sure we weren’t a stereotype. She worked multiple jobs, saved up, sacrificed a lot so that her two children can be educated and brought up without obstacles. So that no one would point fingers at us and call us fatherless. I know all mothers are selfless but this lady does the job of two parents in one. She got me married single handedly and helped my brother with his basketball goals. She taught me how to drive and him how to cook. It’s not easy to fight patriarchy, your husband and your parents to bring up your children in this world alone and she continues this fight for us every single day. We’ve never felt the hardships of single parenthood because she’s never let us. I know there may be many stories like this but no one is like my mother. When I have children, I hope I am even 1/4th the mother she is. She’s an extraordinary human being and her story is an exceptional case of growth, strength and love.
name: Ayesha Ahmed

description:
I salute her for the spirit to make her loved once have there best chance in life. The women I talk about was a housewife once upon a time. All that she was best at was household shores. Life took a sudden flip, the only support and trust to her, the husband died. She was left with a daughter who was just a year old and a cruel world to face. 
It was her spirt, which said she needs to make sure that the daughter gets her best chance. She took over from where ever the shores were left unfinished. 
She studied , took a job and started working for Ministry of Defence (DRDO). Not only did she look after her daughter but also took care of her demised husband's mother. 
Despite the hard ship and no support, she has eventually raised her daughter independent and a lawyer.
What I admire more about her is that not only did she improved the life of others, she did it for herself as well.  It needs a lot of guts to get remarried at the age of 55+ , to find a companion. 
And you know what she inspire with the fact that no matter what you face in life .... You learn and if you have the guts to conquer, you will! I am proud to say that I am honoured enough to call this women my MOTHER!

description:
Kiran Bedi is truly an icon of heroism. She was the first Indian woman to join the Indian Police Services. She was born on June 9, 1949 at Amritsar in Punjab. She is one of the most renowned police officers, who have put in their whole hearted effort in serving the society,,
She has also been the Lieutenant Governor of Chandigarh and Director General of Narcotics Control Bureau. An interesting thing about Kiran Bedi is that, sometimes, she is referred to as Crane Bedi. The reason behind calling her by this name is that, she dragged the car of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi due to violation of parking rules. 

Kiran Bedi made the Indian Police Service change its decision in matters related to traffic management, control over narcotics and VIP security. During her tenure as the Inspector General of Tihar Jail, she brought about several reforms in the way the prisons are managed. She brought forth a number of measures like yoga, meditation, redressal of complaints made by the prisoners etc.
name: Kiran Bedi

description: When I was little I didn't knew how it was to have a mom all day around . Because my mom was working I didn't get to spent entire days with her . And she always came bearing toys , balloons ,pens . And our afternoon naps were the times when she used to catch up on me what I did in the morning how I played that day etc etc. But now when I think of those times all remember is that she tried everything she could . She worked so that we could get a better future . She worked even when she wasn't feeling well . She always stood up for her so that we can understand how  important it is to have own identity . She did both her jobs well . She took care of us while working. She always inspired us to be more and do more. She always insist on educating ourselves. Because she's seen difficult times while she was younger. She used to work for her fee and then study . She worked so hard to get her degrees and job. And now l can understand her better and respect her even more. And love her even more. She's the backbone of my home. Our strength.
name: Manju lata Pareek / my mommy

description:
Vidisha is my better half. We have been married from more than 2 years. Before marriage I use to be very rude guy with very bad temperament. VIDISHA was teaching in one of top schools of city. Her patience level is so high that she has changed me completely with her right approach. She has beared my behavior in beginning still stood with me in all important decisions. Even my parents has recognized change in me after vidisha came in my life. She taught me how to handle situations case to case basis and take approch to every situation accordingly(Behaviour based). My all relatives/Freinds are jaelous of me that i have got so nice wife. She is professional Driver in which woman's are not considered at par with their male counterpart. I am not very good in driving. We successfully completed Leh Circuit(Manali-Leh-Siachin-Kargil-Srinagar) & Spiti Circuit (Shimla-Sangla-Kalpa-Kaza-Manali). She drove all the way on these routes without any support, infact i was scared but i believed in her skills & wisdom. Even regular taxi drivers We met along the way were amazed by her knowledge of vehicle and her driving skills.
Skills apart her day to day life has been a journey since she got married. She is born &  brought up in city and married in small town of Himachal. Initially it was very tough for her but eventually she got use to the environment. She was working before marriage but after marriage she could not continue for various reasons. She started intraday trading with me, what I use to do for killing some time while at home. Being a sailor wife most of time she is alone(without me). She learned nitty & gritties of tradiy so well that she is considered successful trader now. I also have second career option now and I can earn while I am with her. She learnt it so passionately in order to keep us together. She has been an inspiration all over, a loveable wife, supereb daughter & daughter in law and great human being.

Rgds
Vikas

description:
I work in an MNC as a software professional and had the opportunity to lead a Team of 21 associates between 2014-2016. My Team ,for a change, had a very impressive Female to Male ratio (15:6) and managing each of those Team members helped me tremendously both as a Human being and People’s manager. I got to know the challenges that female associates face everyday starting from commuting to office in shared cabs , cooking lunch/dinner etc and then bare the heat of professional environment.
One of the associate,Monika Gupta, was a new joiner to my company and project and was suffering through many diseases and had a turmoil personal life but to my surprise, her health and personal issues never stopped her from doing her work with perfection. She was just into first year of her professional journey but was way ahead of her superior. Her preservance, dedication , diligence and never say no attitude were some of her stand-out attributes.
At that point in time, I was at a very crucial juncture of my professional career where-in I was trying to settle into managerial role and become people’s manager and I feel very fortunate to have her in my Team because she inspired me to be sensitive to Team Member’s aspiration , their personal hurdles and that continues to help me even today when I manage new Team in different accounts and projects.
name: Monika Gupta

description: In simple words I would express the story of my mother from whom I learnt to be bold and brave in any circumstances that life pushes to.  Living lavishly in Mumbai she married to a man who was well settled then.  Later on due to the family issues they were separated from the family and they began living together. As days passed by the man[my father ] became an alcoholic. He left his job and started boozing limitless. When he lost all his money,  he kept stealing gold from home to keep up the money for his drinking. Thus we lost everything we had . There where days when dad used to not come home for weeks together and me and mom searching for him in rickshaw stands,  petrol pumps etc. I was bullied in the school for all this. I didn't have food for weeks together. People kept telling my mom keep your daughter in boarding school and go abroad and live your life. But my mom was strong enough. She decided to live with her husband no matter what.  She completed her Montessori course from Bangalore and began teaching to support our family. She kept giving tuitions after her classes. Meanwhile I used to stay by the shop nearby no matter what the weather was. The sunlight,  heavy rains, splash of water from puddles by those cars etc.  I faced everything waiting for mom to return after tuitions. My relatives kept coming to the same shop where I used to sit. They ate drank kept buying stuffs to eat but they didn't  even bother to ask if I've eaten anything. My uncle smoked in front of me took food stuffs for his son leaving me unnoticed. At the same time mom also faced all the criticism and harsh words from people around. But my mom was brave enough to move forward in life. Finally when dad had almost lost everything and had planned to commit suicide he left the house in the midnight and never returned for a week. We kept searching for him and finally found him in front of a church in mangalore. He was put in a de addiction center. Mom forgived him.
name: Juliyana lasrado

description:
The CEO of Pepsi Co belongs to an average middle class Indian family. She moved to New York for higher studies but sadly had little money to get through. Working as a receptionist, she could pay her tuition and afford a suit to wear to her job interviews. With all the hard work in place, Nooyi worked at several consultancies in top positions before finally walking through the hallowed halls of Pepsi Co.

Women are not simply someone’s wife, daughter or mother. They are individuals in and of themselves with individual dreams. The persistent toil and success of these incredible women keep burning the beacon of hope for millions of other girls who one day hope to find their voice.

description:
Shalubai is born in a village Kinnisultan of Aland Taluk, Gulbarga to Smt Parvathamma and Shree Siddapa Mulage. Have five siblings. Studied upto 4th class become school dropout. Her parents married her to a Rich Patil family of neatest village Tadkal, thought that she will be happy through out her life. But the reality is different then. Even to have food they have to wait until her father-in-law finishes first. Her father-in-law in-law never allowed her to step out of his home except once in a year for Diwali celebration in her mother home. She raised three of her Husband’s brothers with at most care, affection and motherly love. But after death of her father-in-law her Husband’s have tortured her like anything by not allowing to take care of her 4 children. They maid her to prepare food for all family members until 1pm everyday. Even for basic needs she has to beg in front of her husband’s brother because her husband is illiterate, hardworking, villager. This has not stopped her in nourishments of her children’s with limited resource. Today she has given a great soldier to India serving in J & K. Younger son as Engineer and two daughters as business womens. 
One instance I want convey that she had ear problems in her early age she has to for 4 decades just to get operated from her sons earnings. She is well know in Tadakal village for her sacrifices for her family. Who had tortured her are now facing sufferings from god and regretting for their past acts. I thank god wholeheartedly for giving her as mother in this life. 
She is the greatest source of inspiration to me in all paths of my life. Thank You mother Shalubai.
name: Shalubai

description:
I am proud of myself as I fought single handed without a lawyer to get back Rs 13 lakhs from IIFl ,the finance co in 2009 which were lost from my account due to unauthorised trading done by my RM Mr vinod from Bandra west branch .This money along with 18 percent IIFL handed over to me when I eon agsinst them without any lawyer , in person in NSE Arbitration , High Court mumbai and in EOW , also filed FIR against them where in ther MD Mr Venkat raman was arrested and it was a breaking bews on all tv channels and newspaper . All this I am proud that I did alone without any  lawyer nor any law degree niether had I had seen NSE or HighCourt in my life .  Also this fight has been an example wherein a huge loss to amiddleclass homemaker had been converted into an opportunity to understand the legal rdcourses and also while doing this fight I would attend courts just to understand the court language wherein I also found my next profession of buying and selling auction properties sold by courts DRT . 
Thus I can proudly say I had converted the threat to an OPPORTUNITY , where dven the senior officials in EOW would call me Jhansi ki Rani as I would collect all the evidence on paper and hsnd over to them to make their eork easy and that alone woman with children had singlehanded had got the Indias boggest broking company to knees !!

Since I had never purchased any shares from stock market and ghe IIFL would keep calling me to open account I finslly agreed to open account and told the RM that as I have never purchased shares to please guide me to do so as I want to buy blue chip like L & T and hold them fod 8 to 10 yrs for my daughtersmarriage . As I had my money in bank account he asked me to keep in IiFL saying its same like bank account .He was a crooked fellow and he used this my open confession of ignorance to cheat me by doing unauthorised trading in F & O of 54 crores in my account just to generate commission gor him . description: Mary Kom Hmangte born 1 March 1983 is an Indian Olympic boxer from Manipur. She is the only woman to become World Amateur Boxing champion for a record six times  and have won a medal in each one of the seven world championships. She belong from poor family. Kom grew up and helping her parents with farm related chores, going to school and learning athletics initially and later boxing simultaneously. Mary Kom completed eight years of education in Moirang and proceeded to Imphal for her ninth and tenth standards. Unfortunately, she could not pass her examinations. So, she quit school and gave her examination from NIOS and graduated from Churachandpur College. Although she was not brilliant academically, she did not give up on life. Not everyone is good at studies; some are good at sports. She is inspired me a lot because  be a successful boxer one must also have a strong heart. Some women are physically strong but fail when it comes to having a strong heart. One also must have the zeal and the right fighting spirit. We work harder than men and are determined to fight with all our strength to make our nation. From young, Mary Kom was interested in athletics, but the success of Dingko Singh, an Indian boxer born in Manipur. Just like Mary Kom, we have role models of our own and we look up to them. When they achieve great things in life, we are inspired to follow in their footsteps, and this is what Mary Kom did. Her story inspired me and all youngster beacuse we know that boxing is considered unsuitable for women but Mary Kom did that role. Many of the youngsters today are afraid to pursue their dreams; they are afraid of rejections from the society. Success can never materialise from fear. For success, one needs to be confident and determined. If you are certain about your goals and youryou should take up the challenge and pursue them. Only then will you be able to reach the peak of success.Mary Kom proved to the world that age is nothing but a number.
name: Chungneijang Mary Kom Hmangte

description:
The story of Sindhutai Sapkal is one of incredible determination in the face of adversity, rebirth and love of children who nobody else wanted. The 68-year-old has raised over 1,400 orphans, offering them not just food and shelter, but also the love of a real family. Her amazing work has earned her over 750 awards, and the nickname “Mother of Orphans”.


Sapkal runs four orphanages in her home town of Prune, India’s Maharashtra state – two for girls and two for boys – with the help of her biological daughter, Mamta, and her eldest adopted children, some of whom have become lawyers, doctors and professors. The children under her care were found trying to fend for themselves in railway station, abandoned in dustbins, or even dragged by stray dogs in the streets. New ones are brought to her orphanages all the time, and as long as they are eligible for adoption, she never turns them away. But unlike state-run orphanages, the Mother of Orphans doesn’t give her children up for adoption with other families, and doesn’t turn them away when they turn 18.
name: Sindhu tai

description:
We lost our father eight years back. She is my hero, my mother. She took over his business and ran the household along with my sister. I help when I can, I practice art. 

She was a regular housewife; not well treated by her mother-in-law, tired and plain helpless at times. But her fierceness came out when she lost her husband and with unimaginable grace and patience she drove the boat.
I fight with her, upset her and sometimes just discard her for not understanding me. But she always stands next to me; holding my hand when I had asked her not to touch me. Because she knows I might fall. And that grip is what saves me and makes me feel loved. 

She inspires me in the most unexpected moments. We all want to be amazing , different, unique and lovable. 

She is just simple, normal, basic and she loves. 
She loves me, my sister, our family and mostly just everyone. 
Which is disturbingly alarming!! Lol!! 

She inspires me to have flaws, she inspires me to have faith, she inspires me to look beyond the veil of life, she inspires me love despite being broken. 

She is my mother. And she is my inspiration. She might not know this but she is and will always be.

description:
Neerja Bhanot was a flight attendant who died while saving passengers from terrorists on board a hijacked airplane. She was only 22 years old.

Neerja Bhanot was a purser for the Pan Am based in Mumbai, India. She was shot and killed while saving hundreds of passengers on board. On September 5th 1986, a Pan Am flight was hijacked by terrorists at Karachi airport in Pakistan. Bhanot worked with her team to prevent the flight from taking off. She later singlehandedly saved the lives of all the passengers (apart from the few who unfortunately lost their lives).

Apart from this incident, Bhanot left her abusive husband earlier – she stood up against the abuse and divorced him (in a time when it wasn’t really acceptable).

Bhanot was the recipient of the Ashoka Chakra Award – which is India’s highest gallantry award for bravery in the face of the enemy during peace time. Bhanot is the youngest recipient and the first woman recipient of this award. Since then, she’s received many awards from various countries for her bravery and kindness.
name: Neerja Bhanot

description: she along with her sisters of the Missionaries of Charity became a symbol of love, care and compassion for the world. Blessed Teresa of Calcutta, known the world over as Mother Teresa, was an Albanian-born Indian citizen who abided by her religious faith of Roman Catholicism to serve the unwanted, unloved and uncared people of the world. One of the greatest humanitarians of the 20th century, she led all her life serving the poorest of the poor. She was a ray of hope for many, including the aged, the destitute, the unemployed, the diseased, the terminally ill, and those abandoned by their families. Blessed with profound empathy, unwavering commitment and unshakable faith since young, she turned her back to the worldly pleasures and focussed on serving the mankind ever since she was 18. After years of service as a teacher and mentor, Mother Teresa experienced a call within her religious call, which changed her course of life completely, making her what she is known as today. Founder of the Missionaries of Charity, with her fervent commitment and incredible organizational and managerial skills, she developed an international organization that aimed towards helping the impoverished. For her service to the humanity she was honoured with Nobel Peace Prize in 1979. She was canonised by Pope Francis on 4 September 2016
name: Mother Teresa

description:
MOTHER, a person who is very important in everyone’s life and for me, my mother is the source of inspiration for me.
 
There are many mothers out there who have made many compromises to raise their children, and I have massive respect for them, but my true inspiration is MY MOTHER. I wish I can be at least 20% of her, trust me. I try a lot to become like her, but I lose my control every time.
 
Throughout my childhood till date, I have seen her living in what she has, giving the best to her kids, complaining about nothing…this list can go on and on. But what makes my mother stand out from others and make her my inspiration is she has never quit in her life.
 
We are four siblings; three sisters and a brother. My father used to earn hardly 5K, and there was no other financial support for my mother to raise us and give us a good lifestyle, instead, I can say an excellent education for a bright future. Let me tell you, running the house and educating 4 kids in just five thousand is a very critical job, but my mother did that without any complaint.
 
Even today, when we all are grown up, she is still there for us, especially me. Whenever I feel low, I call her and tell her everything, and somehow she manages to handle the most complicated situation so easily.
 
Today, we four are well-educated, earning well in our life, my two sisters are married, and yeah this all was possible because of my mom. I don’t know how did she manage, but I owe her everything. I try to make her proud every day.
 
Massive respect and love for MOM.
 
Who said being a housewife is an easy job, I am working now, but I feel the struggle, adjustment, and compromises my mother has made being a housewife I am far away from it.
 
Salute to all the housewives there who are doing a great job every day without any weekly off.
name: Sunita Dokewar

description: Never giving up on me and believing in me and for making me a better Man.
name: Kekhrienino Sogotsu

description:
This is a story of myself.
 
I believe that we should never judge everything on the same scale.
 
Hence, the phrase “All Men are Dog” is wrong, but some men are dogs.
 
So let me tell you my story!
 
But before that tell me;
 
How will you feel when the person you loved the most in your life actually used you to fulfill his fantasies?
 
I have been through this situation in the recent time where I came to know that the person I imagine my future with has gone to his native and got engaged. The cherry on the cake was he didn’t tell me this, and I came to know about this through his brother’s Whatsapp status. I don’t want to take this platform to cry about my whole story; hence, let’s move to the main point.
 
Being a heartbroken girl, I was not able to figure out what to do, my entire world was shattered, and then my MOTHER who is always there for me comes in the play and helped me to overcome that situation. She gave me many examples; she used to find or search for new things every day to get me out of it.
 
Trust me; I was not an easy kid to handle during that phase of my life. I used to cry on every small-small things. But today, I am all new person, and all credit goes to my mom.
 
She is always there for me in my good and bad and doesn’t matter how many times I thanked her it wouldn’t be enough.
 
All the ladies out there, don’t let any man control your life.
 
Be Strong, Live Strong!
name: Sunita Dokewar

I stood like a strong pillar for my family. Today after 30 years, i am a proud mother of my two daughter,. One is a civil engineer in a leading Us firm and the other is a dancer/ choreographer and an educator and am a proud wife. I inculcated in them whatever lagged in me. I feel successful. I am a teacher today since the last 25 years and i wale up at 5:30 a.m. Prepare tiffin for all pf my family and leave house by 7.30 a.m. I feel proud and i inspire a lot of mu collegues today.

description:
Cultural India
Lata Mangeshkar is one of the best-known and most respected playback singers in India. Let's take a look at her life history including music career, and achievements and personal life.
Cultural India : Indian Music : Indian Singer : Lata Mangeshkar
Lata Mangeshkar

Date of Birth: 28 September 1929

Place of Birth: Indore, Madhya Pradesh

Parents: Deenanath Mangeshkar (Father) and Shevanti Mangeshkar (Mother)

Siblings: Meena Khadikar, Asha Bhosle, Usha Mangeshkar, Hridaynath Mangeshkar

Occupation: Playback Singer, Music Director, Producer

Religion: Hinduism

Start of Playback Singing Career: 1942

Total number of songs (approx): 50,000 in 36 languages

Nickname: Nightingale of India

Net Worth (approx.): $10 million



Image Credit: ndtv.com
Lata Mangeshkar is one of the best singers of the Hindi film industry. She is listed in the Guinness Book of World Records as the most recorded artist in the world. She started her started in 1942 and has spanned over seven decades. Lata is said to have recorded songs for over a thousand Hindi films. She also has the credit of having sung in over thirty-six regional Indian languages and foreign languages. Lata Mangeshkar is the elder sister of singers Asha Bhosle, Hridaynath Mangeshkar, Usha Mangeshkar and Meena Mangeshkar. She was honoured with India's highest award in cinema, the Dadasaheb Phalke Award, in 1989.
Childhood & Early Life

Lata Mangeshkar was born on September 28, 1929 in Indore, Central Provinces (now Madhya Pradesh). She was the eldest daughter among the five children of Dinanatha and Shevanti Mangeshkar who belonged to a Maharashtrian Brahmin family. Dinanath hailed from the town of Mangeshi in Goa and he changed his last name from Haridkar to Mangeshkar in identify with his hometown. Her father Pandit Deenanath Mangeshkar was an accomplished classical singer and stage actor. Lata was initially named Hema when she was born.
name: Lata Mangeshkar

description:
Being a new mother initially you struggle alot to handle your little one and home together.As I’ve walked through motherhood and seen many of my friends enter into it, I am realizing that we all just handle it differently.
Since my husband serves in Army Fraternity ,most of the time he is not there when I need him the most.
I still remember days when my baby was just few weeks old ,one fine day he went out of station as his duty called him out,for me it didn't get off easy.My baby cried whole night she couldn't sleep for a sec.I felt more alone than I’ve ever felt in my life. I loved my child but had a hard time liking my fussy baby. I was overly anxious and can’t relax,so I also cried along with her. That night was a nightmare for me.
Struggling mama I thought my experience of motherhood in the first few months was a taste of what my entire life was going to feel like hence forth.I  wish I could enjoy initial days of my baby.
 But gradually I learnt how to handle her and started taking care of her it.now my husband is in abroad for a year and I have also rejoined my job.Managing both my work and baby perfectly. This is what my baby teaches me to keep it simple,relax and enjoy.
name: Priya Tyagi

description:
This story is about my mom. Its a bit long since so many things happened with her that I couldn’t cut it short.
I was very young, my dad was very well off but he used to drink day and night due to which he was always very aggressive and ruined all our lives. When my younger brother took birth the conditions even got worst because of his drinking habits and my grandparents were not at all supportive. Before 5th grade i changed my school 10 times because my dad used to kick us out of his house and my mom used to come to her native place to her parents. Me and my mom we together raised my brother, my father he never bothered about my brother. My mom was 29years when my dad passed away. Since my mom got married at very early age so she couldn’t complete her MA graduation. She didn’t get job anywhere. We did not know that my greedy grandparents took the advantage of my dad’s drinking and they had taken everything on their name from my dad. And my mom was left with nothing. Then all the relatives talked to them so they decided to give only Rs. 10,000 month out of the interest from my dad’s funds for all our education and household chores. We struggled a lot to survive. My grandparents and my bua used to abused my mom a lot. They used to throw money when my mom used to ask for and harassed her mentally. My bua(my father’s sister) she was my grandparents favorite so they used to favor her a lot. We never went anywhere on the trips when we were young. My maternal grandparents supported my mom emotionally a lot. But my maama g he never supported her. Nobody thought of getting my young mom remarried.
I grew up doing engineering, got a job In Infosys. And my brother who was 7years younger to me, 3years back also started doing engineering in Sep 2015. But again god gave us set back giving shock of our lives when my mom lost his 18years son in an accident and i lost the best brother in this whole world. He was my mom’s last hope of happiness. She got devastated. She got so depres
name: Vandana

description:
Savitribai Jyotirao Phule was a prominent Indian social reformer, educationist and poet who played an instrumental role in women education and empowerment during the nineteenth century Jyotirao advocated widow remarriage, Savitribai worked tirelessly against social evils like child marriage and sati pratha, two of the most sensitive social issues that were gradually weakening the very existence of women
. She worked in tandem with her husband in the latter’s efforts in eradicating the custom of untouchability and the caste system, garnering equal rights for people of lower castes, and reform of the Hindu family life. The couple opened a well in their house for the untouchables during an era when the shadow of an untouchable was regarded as impure and people were reluctant to even offer water to the thirsty untouchables.
name: Savitribai Phule
