description:
A woman is the centre of inspiration for everyone.It is rightly said that a woman is better than a man in every sphere of life.
There is a story that inspires me a lot.This story clearly states about the intelligence, dedication and devotion of a  girl towards her family as well as for her studies.
Once there was a girl named Aditi. She was intelligent and  witty .She was likely to 16 or 18. She not from a very rich family but the  earning of the family was sufficient to feed themselves. Aditi had one elder brother. Unfortunately her mother, father as well as her brother suffered from Night blindness. She was the only in the family who did not have this disease. She was super in her studies and was super in her duties towards her family. She never cursed her fate and  loved her family.
She studied only in the night as  her family members suffered from Night blindness and  she was the only person who cooked the food, did the dishes, washed the clothes and took care of the cattles . She helped her mother before and after the school. She was very sincere for her school projects and completed the work always before time. Besides this  she even taught tution to the children of her neighbours and contributed to strengthen the financial condition of her family. She was the brightest student of her class and the beloved student of all the teachers.

When the board exams of her 12 class arrived , she followed her daily routine as such but studied hard the whole night and prepared for her exams.
It was only due to her selfless struggle, devotion and hard work that she topped the state by obtaining 98.50% in medical field. She was offered for a scholarship by the Government , but she refused to accept it because she wanted to find the cure of the disease of 
Night blindness which the poor could afford.......
This is how Aditi Paul showed everyone that the devotion of a woman towards he work, is the most powerful weapon in this world.

description:
mother teresaMother Teresa was born in 1910 in Skopje, the capital of the Republic of Macedonia. Little is known about her early life, but at a young age, she felt a calling to be a nun and serve through helping the poor. At the age of 18, she was given permission to join a group of nuns in Ireland. After a few months of training, with the Sisters of Loreto, she was then given permission to travel to India. She took her formal religious vows in 1931 and chose to be named after St Therese of Lisieux – the patron saint of missionaries.

On her arrival in India, she began by working as a teacher; however, the widespread poverty of Calcutta made a deep impression on her, and this led to her starting a new order called “The Missionaries of Charity”. The primary objective of this mission was to look after people, who nobody else was prepared to look after. Mother Teresa felt that serving others was a fundamental principle of the teachings of Jesus Christ. She often mentioned the saying of Jesus,

“Whatever you do to the least of my brethren, you do it to me.”

As Mother Teresa said herself:

“Love cannot remain by itself – it has no meaning. Love has to be put into action, and that action is service .” – Mother Teresa

mother-teresaShe experienced two particularly traumatic periods in Calcutta. The first was the Bengal famine of 1943 and the second was the Hindu/Muslim violence in 1946, before the partition of India. In 1948, she left the convent to live full-time among the poorest of Calcutta. She chose to wear a white Indian sari, with a blue border, out of respect for the traditional Indian dress. For many years, Mother Teresa and a small band of fellow nuns survived on minimal income and food, often having to beg for funds. But, slowly her efforts with the poorest were noted and appreciated by the local community and Indian politicians.

In 1952, she opened her first home for the dying, which allowed people to die with dignity. Mother Teresa often spent time with thos
name: Mother teresa

description:
My wife's journey..  

She's born in normal middle class family and eldest of her two sibling brothers. 

Usually middle class families prefer girl child to get standard education and spend time with household stuff and later marriage but my wife was different and she had strong desire for higher studies and quality education which wasn't there in her hometown. Her father was against it, as after 10th standard she had to move to a different city for higher secondary education however  her mother supported her decision.

With her mother's support she eventually moved a new city for higher education. Where she had to cook her own food and stay and rented room with other girls and managing studies as well without family at a young age.. I could say that experience made her strong and independent woman.

She was intelligent and scored good marks in higher secondary and chose engineering field for further study. With the help of her maternal uncle she took study loan and self fun funded her studies as again this time too her father was completely reluctant to fund any fees for education and asked her to comeback to her hometown. 

Since she had strong desire for studies she finally chose the civil engineering branch  which is considered and male dominant engineering branch.With her mother blessings she stood top 10 students of her college in B.Tech and got top rank in M.Tech.

After her completion of M.Tech is she got a good job offer from my city. After three months we finally met through online matrimony website. We liked each other and decided to get married.

Here I forgot to mention that she had one of the conditions of marriage with me. She told  me that I will marry you if you support me in my Phd education :) which I accepted.

At present I am helping her to get admission in a reputed foreign universities for her PhD thesis.

Conclusion: Education gives you every attribute to become successful in your life.
name: Jyoti Nayak

description:
Kalpana Chawla: Astronaut (1962 - 2003)
Major achievement: First Indian woman in space
Why I included as my inspirstion: I remember when Kalpana made her way onto the Space Shuttle Columbia in 1997 since it was a big moment in India's history. At school, one of our assignments was to collect newspaper cutouts and write an essay on her. She, unfortunately, passed away in the infamous Columbia disaster in 2003 at the early age of 42. On that mission, she worked as a mission specialist and primary robotic arm operator.
In 1994, the much-awaited dream was about to come true with NASA selecting Kalpana for astronaut training. She had to undergo evaluation for one year – an arduous process which required immense levels of fitness. Kalpana Chawla’s determination saw her through this rigorous training programme. In 1996, she was assigned the role of a mission specialist on STS-87 Columbia. In 1997, she finally realised her dream by being a part of a six-astronaut crew aboard the STS-87. Of her first trip to space, Kalpana said that sunrises and sunsets defined her experience in outer space. She yearned for a second chance and that came in 2003, when she was a part of the crew of STS-107, on a 16-day mission dedicated to science and research. On being selected again, she had then said, “Doing it again is like living a dream – a good dream – once again.” But, sadly, this time she went off on an eternal voyage to outer space, never to return.

When you look at the stars and the galaxy, you feel that you are not just from any particular piece of land, but from the solar system.

-Kalpana Chawla
name: Kalpana Chawla

description:
Today I am using this platform to write something about my mother. This is neither a story to inspire others nor she is a super woman. I believe you cannot inspire other until become successful, till then you are still a struggler. She is just a simple lady born in an Orthodox family. Her father married her at the age of 18 and she could not fulfill any of her dreams. When I (her daughter) came in her life, she has lots of dreams and expectations from her. Unluckily, my family (her in-laws) are Orthodox too. I too had dreams of studying from some nice college and get a good job so that I can fulfill her dreams and can make her feel proud. Whole family disagreed to sent me some other place to study and strictly against my job as they consider very bad instead of proud if a girl goes out of home and earns. But it was my mother only who fought with the whole family including my father and sent me for good education and job. She wants me to be Independent so that I can follow all my dreams which she could not.

I just want to pass on the message to all the families though today everyone is busy in proving how modern they are and women tries to show off fake feminism. Not all girls wants to have night stays with friends, having boyfriends, wearing short clothes and dreams about rich husband. Some just wants to fulfill their dreams, wants to make their career. They want at least their parents to be with them in their career decision. Now with my  mother's blessing and God's grace I have not left my job and continuing it (right now from home only) and will never give up on my dreams. One day I will be definitely there where I always wanted to be and can make her feel proud. 
Just a question, forget about fake feminism,  Are we even allowed to take our decisions by ourself? Stop showing off how modern you are until you can listen to what your child wants. And girls, never stop dreaming and Stand for yourself if you know you can make it. My mom is my superhero :)
name: Sunita Goyal (my mother)

description:
The woman who has inspired me the most is my first love, my mother. Her story starts as a 7 year old girl who is travelling back to her Village house on a horse Carriage. The carriage suddenly broke down and she, along with her mother (my Nani), her father (my Nana) 2 younger sisters and 2 younger brothers fell down. In this mishap her mother broke her left arm and got hit in the head. The blood clotted in her mother's head and  was admitted.  My Nani recovered soon but was unable to work. All the household responsibilities fell onto the little shoulders of my mother. She had to quit he school, stop her education. The tiny hands which were earlier used to play were suddenly burdened with house hold responsibilities. The school that she was still going into, to drop her brothers and sisters, seemed very far away. At an early age she got married to my father, and after a few years I was born. A few years past my father met an accident and broke his left leg, being a bus driver he could no longer go back to work. So, in order to meet day to day expenses my mother started working. I was kept at my Nani's house. She used to come every Sunday to meet me. This would obviously have been a very tough situation for her but she never gave up. In a few months every thingngot back to normal. When I was around 2-3 years old. My elder sister got blood cancer. Mom and dad tried their best in and out, spent every single penny they had, took loans, asked people for help. Even after doing all this, still, they couldn't save my sister and she died. There have been a lot of tough situations in my mom's life like my grandmother just before her death had huge medical problems, she couldn't even use the toilet and usually did her routines on the bed itself. But never did I see my mother getting upset or irritated about this. More over, mum was more concerned about bringing her into a healthy shape. 
All such situations made me believe that she is the strongest women and I am really proud.
name: Neelam tiwari

description:
She was a woman who was brought up in a well to do family and got married  in a well to do family.she had never known any problems in her life.Easy going life.two kids,nice husband.....what could she want more from life??unless one day when her mother suddenly passed away...that too only at just fifty!!oh how much she loved her mother ! And with that came the responsibility  of her father and brother.Her own kids were still very small.but suddenly she grew up.she started  taking care of two houses. Then suddenly  god took away her father.she was taken aback.somehow she recovered.but then came the bolt from the blue.Their business suffered  a loss and suddenly everything was gone....the luxuries, the friends nd the relatives .She tried to save her house...gave all hersavings,her jewellery every penny but  couldnot save her house..her sweet house.The house that had been made with so much love.the were on road.They rented a small  house. She was shattered.Her health began to fall.Shealways had a fever without any diagnosis.But then She decided to face the life. She tried many jobs-stock exchange, insurance,tutions.she made  her children her strength and started investing in them.She spent her money on nothing but her children....to make them capable. The children  who had been brought up do lavishly started facing the hardships and turned out winners.And for herself, she is still doing tutions.But she has earned s name for herself.To tell you, that 'she' is myself. I find my life inspiring  because the situations could have sent me in depression .But not only i survived them, but i learnt to be a better person.I recognized my hidden talents and used them to face my life.I learnt to forget and forgive other's follies.My smile shows that life is not regretting about past but being optimistic  about future. Today my sons are well settled. We have built a new home and I am still teaching.And will continue to do so.I think that if I can do it,you can also do it.
Thank you.
name: Seema gupta

description:
She is my mother and has been a strong influence of positivity in my life. In spite of being from a very backward village in Murshidabad WB , in spite of having no formal education or outside influence , she had a very modern outlook of Life. Luckily , she got married to a BRO soldier who catapulted her to a relatively modern life . She learnt quickly about the defence way of working, the chemistry of relationships between the surrounding groups et all. 
In those days when people had 5 or 6 kids at a minimum, she stuck at one child and strictly said NO to another child in spite of huge societal pressures.
 At 20 years of  her age ,say around 56 years ago from today, she forced my father to take a big decision ,that is ,to construct a house for them. His salary was very less ,obviously, he was scared to start that venture. But her perseverance pulled him through and a house for us was made. I learnt from her that whatever happens, first try to get a roof over your head in your name. 
Secondly , when I was at a low point in my life, with a small child about to start school and my CA finals still pending ,I had almost given up on my career dreams . She was the one who stood before me like Maa Kali and exhorted me to leave everything behind ,even my husband ,my daughter and dedicate myself for one year to my Finals ,not even coming home for that one year ,she told me that Sadness is an Overrated emotion. 
Initially, I did not feel it is ok at all to leave everything and go far away for a year. Nevertheless, I gave it a try .
And I succeeded. Now, I am a practicing Chartered Accountant and my daughter is a Doctor. My mother is a mother to both me and my daughter. We three are very close and friendly ......She stands as a Pillar for all three of us . My husband, my daughter and for myself ...
name: ANIMA ROY

description:
Most of the people consider that girls should not do job and at a certain and young age, they should get married and settled without having earnings and stand in their career. Fortunately, this story could be mine story but with the support of my leader and family, I achieved what I deserve. A happy IELTS and spoken English trainer with good reputation makes me feel good and satisfied. The main contribution was given by Mrs. Ashima.

I first met her when she and her husband promoting BJP during the elections of 2014. At that time, I was studying in B.com in Govt P.G college and even struggling to support my family and meet my expenses where we were 4 members my parents, brother and me. My father is self employed and could not earn that much to fulfill our family needs and mother was also on shop to support my father where my brother was also not settled in his career and struggling. As I was living in Topkhana bazaar so there the financial resources were limited and family could not earn that much and due to that I felt undirected towards my career path. Surprisingly, in 2014, I went to her home for signing the document related with my college scholarship form. I got impressed at first sight with her motivational nature then I considered that she is the only one who can be my leader. I considered her for a leader because while we were having conversation, she told me her own story like how did she come to BJP where she was just a teacher and her husband used to do job and even more how before marriage she used to meet the financial requirements of her house. Then,I felt motivation inside me which I was lacking somewhere. Interestingly, I was selected among 30 women and I was the youngest one among them and that was pride for me and Mrs. Ashima and even our area too. After that, I taught there for 1 year. She already knew that it was just a small step so she guided me to give tuitions to local students. I became a successful IELTS trainer now all because of her.
name: Mrs. Ashima Pahilwal

description:
she was an American astronaut, engineer, and the first woman of Indian descent to go to space. She first flew on Space Shuttle Columbia in 1997 as a mission specialist and primary robotic arm operator. In 2003, kalpana Chawla was one of the seven crew members who died in the Space Shuttle Columbia disaster when the spacecraft disintegrated during its re-entry into the Earth's atmosphere. she was posthumously awarded the Congressional Space Medal of Honor, and several streets, universities and institutions have been named in her honor. The late astronaut is recognized as a national hero in India.
her story is so inspiring and motivates all the women in india to reach up to heights and show their talent to the world. 

thankyou
name: kalpana chawla

description:
Last year, Delhi saw 18 incidences of acid attack. However, this number doesn’t paint the correct picture as these incidences are just the ones wherein the victims registered reports against perpetrators.

Laxmi Agarwal is one such victim of an acid attack which happened in 2015 in Delhi. At that time, Laxmi was a 15-year-old teenager. This unfortunate incident left her scarred – both physically and emotionally – for life. Not being the one to give up, she sought the support of many acid victims and filed a petition to curb acid sales in the Supreme Court of India.

For her commendable work in helping acid attack victims, Laxmi received the International Women of Courage Award from the then U.S. First Lady Michelle Obama. Today, Chhanv Foundation – an NGO run by Laxmi - is the hope and voice of acid attack victims all over the world.
name: LAXMI AGARWAL

description:
It was in 1969, I got married abruptly  at the age of 20 ,while I was doing my MA at Allahabad University. My father had died a year earlier, hence my brothers hurried my marriage to get rid of their responsibilities. 
I was devastated leaving my studies midway. 
At my in-laws place, I was taunted and ridiculed for not getting dowry. 
Then my first daughter was born within a year of the marriage and I started devoting my time and energy to the child and household. 
Somehow I still felt a stranger in my new environ. I could not even connect with my husband as he never saved me from the barbs of the family. 
Then I had another daughter and another. 
In 1980,we came to Delhi on transfer. 
When my youngest daughter was 3 and started going to school, I felt as if I had no meaning in life. There was such a vacuum in my life and I was undergoing extreme sort of depression. It seemed as if I had no meaning left to live now and thought of even ending my life. 
My chance meeting with the renowned journalist and writer brought a new turn to my life. 
I met him at his house and related all my woes. While returning home, he gave a bunch of books including one of his own short story collection - Mark of Vishnu. 
After a few days I received a post card from Khushwant Ji. He had written -
It's sinful to corrode life like this.. You start reading and writing as I have seen a great potential in you, the way you explained your story. 
You will soon realize how beautiful life is and how much it can offer you. 
Tears were flowing from my eyes and I made a resolve - I will start writing. 
My first book published by one of the best Hindi publisher Rajkamal Prakashan was the translation of Mr Khushwant Singh's short stories 'प्रतिनिधि कहानियां ' in 1989.
Then came my own short story collection शोषित और अन्य कहानियां in 1990.
After that I never looked back and today have 28 books to my credit and my short story collectionऔरतें  was taught at Bonn University in 2009.
name: I'm writing my own story - how I got out of my depression and became a renowned Hindi writer and journalist

description:
Celebrate her story
I have known her since childhood. I have seen her praying for a shooting star so that she can wish for something else.  I have realized that all my hope was purely her benefaction to me. I vividly remember I used to babble on my school drama and she, she used to dig a befitting moral of the story from it. I abruptly used to shout at her for finding an escape in these dramatical viewpoints. I used to give her rude comebacks for trusting people around.
I was always the one who used to give “What if….” to every happy ending that she used to narrate. I used to blame her for letting in those deep poems and for preaching love even when she didn’t know how it felt there (She only had all of it in her perfect stories).
I wished for her that she realizes that the real world is not only about perfect sunsets, or about painted oceans, or about the extended beauty of flowers. I hoped for her that she stops writing about the magical moments like stargazing, kissing under the night sky, watching lanterns and about long drives.
I knew that she always wanted it to be perfect.
I was aware that she had never been in the same story that she had been weaving since so long, I knew she craved for it. 
She used to take me into confidence that this would happen with me too, although I was sure it cannot I used to agree. 
But, every time I  used to agree. 
I used to agree not because I thought that life was a fairytale but because I used to celebrate her faith, her belief, and her story. I hope it at least happens to her someday.
name: Pratima Ratwani

description:
It's me who inspires myself to get better every moment. I would love to share the first time I inspired myself: I had just passed my class X board exams with distinction and was asked by my teachers to apply for the National Merit Scholarship. I was ranked in the merit list and only needed to submit the marksheet attested by a Gazzetted Govt Officer. In was in 1980.  I went and approached a govt officer. He without looking at my marksheet, asked what my parents did. I told him politely that I lost my father early and mother was a school teacher. With lot of pride, the officer asked me learn typing and to join a clerks job after passing class XII. He said that by doing so , I could help my mother financially to make my brother study!!! That was perhaps the turning point of my life! I took my marksheet from him and walked out telling him politely that just because I was a girl , I  needn't necessarily become a clerk. I had the merit to become a Gazzetted officer and I also told him that someday I would certainly become an officer who is competent to attest marksheets/ documents. 
I and my attitude was my inspiration at that point of time and as on date I am serving as a senior Civil Service officer.
name: Bijoya Choudhury

description: She got married early and came to delhi without single penny in her hand and a baby in her womb in 1982, as she was uneducated she started making paper bags and stitching clothes to run her house, my father who was in depression used to stay away from house for months on and off basis, but she used to stand rock solid for her kids, after 6 miscarriages and lot of hardwork of stitching and raising family single handedly my parents fought their bad time like true warriors and stand their wholesale business and own house in delhi.But when time came to enjoy, few months before of their 25th anniversary my father passed away within night due to silent heart attack, then my brother left us alone and again my mother stood like a mountain to protect her two teen girls nd married them off all by herself in well off families. Now my brother has returned with her wife and son nd things are settling down. I want to give best of her life as she has suffered alot. When bad times come relatives and families usually leaves so it happened with us as well. But my mother strong and confident nature and my sister love kept us strong and together even till date.. may god give both of them best of their life..

description: After the divorce, Diana maintained her high public profile and continued many of the activities she had earlier undertaken on behalf of charities, supporting causes as diverse as the arts, children’s issues, and AIDS patients. She also was involved in efforts to ban land mines. To ensure that William and Harry had “an understanding of people’s emotions, their insecurities, people’s distress, and their hopes and dreams,” Diana brought her sons with her to hospitals, homeless shelters, and orphanages. To acquaint them with the world outside royal privilege, she took them to fast food restaurants and on public transportation. Her compassion, personal warmth, humility, and accessibility earned her the sobriquet “the People’s Princess.”
name: Diana, princess of Wales

description: Her ability to empower women and the underprivileged in rural Tamil Nadu
